campaign.story:
Organicer is a smart planner that elevates note taking to a whole new level by bridging the gap between your hand-written and digital notes. By capturing your daily handwritten plan with the Organicer app, you can check, change or mark tasks on the go without carrying a planner with you. Transferring your checklists from paper to phone have never been easier! 
 Organicer app works on both - iOS and Android platform.
While putting pen to paper will always be appealing, digital calenders are becoming more and more handy. Organicer found the way that serves as a bridge between paper and digital notes. 
Handwritten notes from the paper planner are transferred to mobile APP with the help of QR codes: 
 Organicer app works on both - iOS and Android platform.
A weekly 6.00 AM to 9.30 PM table is here for you to organise your appointments and daily action plan into hourly sections. With a little help of your phone you can take a snap and transfer your appointments into Organicer app. 
Organicer app will automatically recognize filled spaces and set reminders in your phone. You can always choose how much time before each appointment a reminder should be made. 
Each daily layout comes with a checklist to get a more transparent overview of what are your daily must-dos. Either you can use it for shopping, tasks that needs to be tackled, steps in a project etc. You can name the tags yourself.
You can create unlimited tags in Organicer app. There are 3 icons under a checklist in a planner’s daily layout. Set tag names for these 3 icons – for example Shopping, Tasks, Projects. If you write down shopping items you need to buy, draw an X across the icon you set for shopping. You can easily edit your lists in Organicer app – either change them, share them with a friend or mark them as done. 
There is a blank blacklined space positioned under the date in everyday layout. That is a place for your brainstorming and writing down your thoughts. Taking a snap with your phone will transfer your thoughts into the Organicer app. 
Storing your notes in the app have many advantages. They are easy to edit, manageable and light to carry since they are in your phone. You can always add more of them directly in your phone. 
The best part about Organicer checklists and notes is that they can be instantly shared amongs your friends and family. When a task on a shared list is marked as completed it will immediately notify and update everyone else with the list.
Our commitment to make a difference in the world we live in and those coming behind us is manifested in our active participation in causes that protect the environment and empower people around the globe. Considering Ines's background in social work, Sasha's involvement in eco and fair-trade products and their passion for travelling in was inevitable that there had to be a greater value added to the planner. 
They were amazed by the impact Barefoot College projects have on different layers of everyday life in rural communities in developing countries. In June 2018, Ines and Sasha travelled to Tanzania, East Africa as part of the Organicer research task. They have visited the Barefoot College's educational centre and a village where their project Solar Mama's is active. They also met Mr. Xavier Juncadella, a head coordinator of Barefoot College for East Africa. 
"When a dream comes with tennacity, hard work, planning, clear objective and is mixed up with good sould you get Organicer," Xavier Juncadella (East African Coordinator - Barefoot College International)
We believe that the liberating power of education can help people take control of their lives and live purposefully and this is the main reason why we support the Barefoot College.  
We are a team of 4 friends from Slovenia. Our paths crossed already in teenage years yet our professional lifes merged with the birth of Organicer, in 2017. Ines is a social worker with an artistic soul and David owns a small print shop, is a web developer and designer. David enthraled Ines for graphic design and they started collaborating on various projects. Sasha with his outstanding communication skills, tons of experience in fair-trade projects and a kind soul, fits perfectly to the pair. And then there is  unreplaceable Nika who takes care for organisational means regarding time management and controlling. 
Left to right: Ines Mulec, David Sovec (Founders), Nika Starovasnik, Sasha Segula (Team Members)
Ines was a full-time student and being a student nowadays demands having a planner. She tried to find the perfect one but soon realised it does not exist. David's working table was always covered in self ad notes and piles of unorganised papers. He as an IT guy, had a total chaos in his office, but had his meetings well organised in his mobile app. They both looked at their needs and realised developing a smart planner would make their lives considerably easier and more productive. With that realisation, Ines's growing designing skills and David's IT knowledge – the idea of Organicer was born. Firstly, creating a functional planner with a good look - secondly, fulfilling the regular planner with an awesome app to keep your data handy in your pocket - and last but not least, contributing to improve the access to education in developing countries. Voila – Organicer has it all!  
As a young team committed to making a difference, we have big ideas that require ample funds to make them a reality. We do not have these funds yet.
Since our production depends solely on the support of everyone including YOU, we would kindly ask you to back us up by investing in the KickStarter packages we have created for you as we target the $15,000 mark for a successful campaign. We are grateful to you and we appreciate your being a part of our journey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are very excited to launch this campaign. This comes after countless hours of work and dedication to develop and design the Organicer planner. Organicer is a completely new product line. With a new product in production, we understand the possibility of facing unexpected challenges.

We're working with two very experienced partners: an app development company and a print shop. With our team's experience in the web development, print services, and manufacturing, we are confident in our ability to mass produce Organicer for you. With that being said, if for any reason we need to switch suppliers you'll be the first to know. If you have any specific questions, please reach out to us directly!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi dear backers! 

We have happy news for you! 🖤

Android app is available on Google Play. You can download your app here:  https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tovarnaidej.organicer

Please, keep in mind this is a beta version. 
If you find any irregularities, let us know on app@myorganicer.com.

Bye bye,
Your Organicer Team x

Dear Backers! 

We wanted to give you an update on how to download the Organicer app.

The beta version for the IOS is already available on the App store (Organicer - Smart Planner). 🎉
Please, keep in mind this is the testing version so it may happen there are some irregularities in the functioning process - if you find any, please report on app@myorganicer.com.

Dear backers!
We are terribly sorry to let you know we are not able to provide all of you with a tracking number of your parcel.
We live in a small town in Slovenia and we have a contract with the local post. Sending out a big number of parcels to the US (more than 700) is not common for our post office and they got 'a little bit' confused because of it. The result was they were not able to provide us with all of the tracking numbers of the parcels we have sent out on Monday, 17th of December.

If any of you urgently need a tracking number, please send us a private message on Kickstarter or write us on info@myorganicer.com. We will do our best to provide it to you.

Dear backers!

As mentioned, all the parcels are on the way around the globe.

We wanted to let you know, we are currently waiting for the post to send us the tracking numbers so we can distribute them to you.

Hopefully, you will all get your tracking numbers tomorrow.

We wish you a very creative upcoming year and many goals achieved!

Best, 
Your Organicer Team x

Dear friends!
Organicers are finally on the way around the globe!

As promised, we received the planners on Friday, 14th. We spend the whole weekend packaging! That was fun! 📦
We managed to send out all the parcels yesterday! 🎉
You can expect the delivery by the end of December.

Dear backers!
Here are some updates on how our planner is coming along.
The paper planner has just undergone final quality testing before the printing process. Now we are ready to begin mass production!
The app development is already in full swing. Today, we will be able to test out first components of the Organicer app! So stoked!

Happy Tuesday, Organicer Supporters!
Did you happen to see our latest article in Gadget Flow? Check it out here!
“Halfway between a paper planner and a digital calendar, Organicer offers the best of both worlds. This beautiful planner lets you manage your schedule on paper and sync the whole thing to your phone for mobile access.” - Mark Myerson, The Gadget Flow

campaign.story:
When the Boss hands everyone a large pile of assignments all due tomorrow, there's not much choice but to stay Overtime. Everyone just wants to go home, and will make sure they are the first to do so!
Overtime is a humorous interactive card game for 3-6 players, where players try to finish up their assignments in any way they can, so they are the first to leave work behind. Working hard can do the trick, but having your dear colleagues “help” out by giving them your share of the work... sometimes the easier way out is the best way! And all this under the watchful eye of the Boss.
Will you be the hard and honest worker, or will you play foul and dirty to get the job done, the choice is on you!
Looking at a card game you expect a lot of cards, right? Well, you are right! So check it out:
If the cards seem a little shiny, it's because they are sleeved. We like to protect our prototypes!
Shown above is everything you get with the base game!
Included in the base game are:
120 main deck cards (the white backed cards)
30 Assignment cards (the black backed cards)
6 starting Employee cards (The Average Joe/Joanna)
6 reference cards
1 time counter card and 8-sided die
1 6-sided Work die
40 Snooze tokens
In addition, all games pledged now will include "The Kickstarter" promo card, just for you during this campaign!
So that's quite a few cards, but what do they do, you ask? Well, have a look!
Plus more! Well maybe, who know... It all depends on this next bit, and we'll just have to wait and see!
The workload is pilling up... how much can we do?
Play action cards, draw new cards and discard any extra! This is in short a description of a players turn. It's that simple! Of course, you'll also want to react to the cards your opponents play, lest they beat you to the finish line.
Here's a quick overview of how the game is played!
If you want to know in more detail, check out the WIP prototype rules. We'll update the rule book along the way, as the design and campaign goes along!
Or give it a look on board game geek on the link below:
You can also create your own copy and try it out yourself, using the freePrototype Print n Play files! Just have fun!
Check out some thoughts and comments on Overtime!
Something to read:
Thoughts and comments by our local board gaming news crew!
And something to see:
From Life of a Board Gamer (preview):
From Logan Chops Reviews (quickie  full preview ):
From The Kwarenteen (preview):
From The Cardboard Stacker (preview):
More reviews coming soon!
 Let's have a look at what's in store:
The $1 pledge is for those that just want to support! The $1 goes a long way in the run to the final goal, and all of the support is very well appreciated!
This also gives access to the pledge manager at the end of the campaign, if you change your mind! 
The P'n'P pledge is great for those that like to make the games themselves! You save yourself some waiting time for the game to arrive, and save on the shipping cost!
The base game pledge has everything you need to play the game, plus the exclusive "the Kickstarter" card! You can even grab it at a 20% discount in the first 48h!
The group pledge is perfect for those that want to save some on shipping! 5 games for the price of 4! Come together with your friends on this bulk order!
The "Employee of the Month" pledge offers a chance to appear in the game! In addition to everything the base game pledge has to offer and the special credits, we will make a stylized illustration of you that fits the games style! In addition, there is no extra shipping cost to your pledge, and it goes to any part of the world!
The "Employee of the Year" pledge is the very top! That special, exclusive "the Kickstarter" card we keep mentioning? With this pledge, that can be you! Make your way to the table off all the other backers, and in addition to getting all the same goodies as the "Employee of the Month", you also get a special something from the Boss!
 Of course, we want to give retailers the option of receiving all the same goodies for their store as everyone else for their store! If you are a retailer, and are interested in getting some copies at a discounted price, send us a message at retail@dazboggames.com.
Shipping is obviously a major player in any Kickstarter campaign. We have decided to complete all of our shipping through fulfillment centers, and have chosen reliable and experienced partners.
Overtime will ship world-wide! Right now we are able to offer VAT-friendly shipping to the following areas:
For the rest of the world, we want to offer as fair prices as we can. Have a look at the table below where you can see an estimate of how much it will cost to send the game to you!
Shipping too costly for your country? Send us a message and we'll see how we can help!
So who are we?
Dažbog Games is an Association of board game designers from Belgrade, Serbia. We are passionate gamers and we love what we do - bringing the fun and joy of games to others.
If you want to know more about us and what we do, you can check out our website here!
While we have been working on various projects and games since 2013. of which we even self-published one last year, this will be our first project on Kickstarter, and we will show you what we've got!
Find us on social media:
Meet the team!
But let's give credit where credit is due, and introduce the team!
But, they are not alone however! We have a great support team behind us, helping us all the way to the end! Have a look at those smiling faces!
A warm "hello" from the rest of the team!
THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Running a Kickstarter campaign is no easy task, especially for a first campaign. We are well aware of this, and are not taking this Kickstarter lightly. We want to make our first product an example for any that follow, and strive to make the best possible product we can muster!

As with any project, delays and chances for mistake can happen, but we are confident we can tackle them, and here's why:

The game itself is well tested and complete. While the game design is 100% complete, illustrations and artwork are at around 65% ready at the start of the campaign, and we expect them to be finished within a month after the campaign is over, if not during the course of the campaign itself. Our team is set on delivering the best product we can, and everyone is devoted to the project goal.

We already have a quote ready with a manufacturer. While this may be our first Kickstarter project, it is definitely not theirs, and we are satisfied with the quality of their previous products. We have had back and forth communication for a couple of months now to ensure the best possible and most accurate quote, so production can start without any delay. In addition, given their experience in previous Kickstarter campaigns, we are confident that they know what they are doing.

We plan on using fulfillment centers to deliver all your pledges, and have chosen experienced partners in this area, with port to door services to ensure the packages are delivered safe and in due time.

And in the end, we are working with a team of experts in crowdfunding, who have helped many previous campaigns succeed and pull through. Any holes we may have, you can be sure they will patch up!

Of course, unexpected problems can still arise. We will take on these problems as best as we can, and with full transparency, keeping you up to date along the way. We are ready to listen to the community, and as backers of previous campaigns ourselves, we know what we as backers would expect, and therefore, what we will aim to deliver.

So thank you for backing, and let's make this project happen together!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp:
Well, at least you have some kind of job, right? And this "Do it Yourself" pledge is great for those that can't wait!
Plus, you will get access to the pledge manager at the end of the campaign!

updates.update_userinfo: Coming to a SPIEL near you!
updates.update_content:
Greetings all!
Essen Spiel 2019 is almost upon us, just a two days away... And as announced earlier, we'll be attending with our very own booth!
You can find us in Hall 4, at booth 4-J104, where we will be presenting Overtime, as we'll as demoing our next project: SHELFIT! The the roll and write game of board game collecting!

updates.update_userinfo: Overtime is comming to Serbia, and some Essen Spiel Previews!
Fulfillment about to start! Last chance to update your addresses!

updates.update_content: We're checking in with some mid-voyage news!

updates.update_userinfo: Production complete! Woohoo! - and more, this is a long one!
A little bit of bad news...
updates.update_content:
Hello dear backers,
Unfortunately, today's update comes with some bad news, but accompanied with some good as well... It doesn't quite even out, but we make do with what we have.
We'll start with the good news

updates.update_userinfo: Overtime Digital Print Review - our thoughts and next steps
Pre-production is under way, and we'll be holding the first copy of Overtime soon!

campaign.story:
Imagine if you could build your very own mobile phone
MAKERphone is an educational mobile phone that you assemble and code yourself.
It’s a kit, it’s fun, it’s simple… and we need your help to make it happen.
What can I do with it?
MAKE...
A fully functional mobile phone that you can code yourself
 Games such as space invaders, pong, or snake
 Apps such as a custom media player that only plays cat videos
Programs in Arduino 
Lines of code in Python 
Your first working piece of code in Scratch 
A custom case 
LEARN...
What a resistor does
The basics of electronics 
How to solder 
How your smartphone works
How to code 
Physical computing 
Scratch
Python
Arduino (which is based on C/C++)
Turning consumers into creators
Mobile phones are revolutionary. They’ve changed and shaped the life of a modern man like nothing else. 
Everybody has one and daily activities without this tiny black “brick” are unthinkable for most of us.
Despite their presence little does an average person know what’s inside this magical device.
With MAKERphone we’re trying to show people that every machine you see was designed by a human being not different nor smarter than themselves.
MAKERphone is actually an educational device disguised in the shape of a mobile phone.
Our main goal is turning consumers into creators.
MAKERphone steps up the game
We’ve learned A LOT from manufacturing and shipping over 6000 MAKERbuino kits in the past year and here’s a short list of most notable changes and improvements that we’ve implemented in MAKERphone:
 A color screen
 Better microcontroller with our custom software
 Python programming language compatibility
 Scratch programming language compatibility
 Dedicated DAC and electronic volume controller for sound regulation and mp3 playback 
 8 individually programmable RGB LEDs for a lightshow in your palms
 Better PCB architecture for easier soldering
 New prettier box with a black touchy cut-out sponge (IMPORTANT!)
 The thing can now make calls, has a SIM card, and built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
 RTC (real time clock) - MAKERphone now keeps time and wakes you up!
  4G or not to 4G?
Every MAKERphone reward perk comes in two versions:
Standard - which comes with a 2G GSM chipset (SIM800 chip)
4G variant with a 4G chipset (SIM7600 chip)
Why would you want a 4G version of MAKERphone? 
There are mainly two reasons you might want a MAKERphone 4G:
1) Your carrier doesn’t support 2G, or might phase out 2G in the near future or your carrier doesn’t support 2G at all.
2G will remain available in most countries at least by early 2021 (and by 2025 in Europe).
 2G was already shut down in Australia, Japan, Taiwan, Singapore.
2) You want the phone to use cellular data connectivity (so, WiFi is not enough)
If you plan just on assembling the MAKERphone, using it for phone calls, text messages, playing music and connecting it to WiFi - you can probably just stick with the standard MAKERphone.
If not - you can just go ahead and adjust your perk! 
How is MAKERphone 4G different? 
MAKERphone 4G is a version of MAKERphone wih a 4G chipset (SIM7600) instead of a 2G GSM chipset (SIM800) that’s included on the standard MAKERphone. 
LTE chipsets are still more expensive than regular chipsets. 
The other aspects of MAKERphone will work similarly on both models.
MAKERphone teaches you about wires and chips (a.k.a. “hardware”)
MAKERphone is hardware.
 MAKERphone is wires.
 MAKERphone is chips.
 MAKERphone is education.
 MAKERphone runs on electricity and has the same components like your smartphone.
It comes in a kit form (not assembled) - you get a box with all the electronic components necessary for building your own fully working mobile phone.
You’ll need two things to build your MAKERphone:
1) some basic tools
2) passion and interest in technology
MAKERphone is FUN
We’re living in the 21st century when kids are not only playing Fortnite. They are building their own electronic devices in their garages #badass #supersmart 
There’s internet, open-source code and wires you can buy on the internet. All knowledge is a few clicks away and you just need the willpower to start learning and doing something new!
Try building your own mobile phone, you'll see how much fun it is!
MAKERphone needs tools
MAKERphone teaches you REAL electronics, it’s not like those wanna-be Lego-like electronics kits.
Thus, you'll need some REAL tools and equipment for assembling your MAKERphone:
A regular soldering iron (nothing super expensive)
Some solder
Diagonal cutter pliers
A regular screwdriver
A piece of insulating tape
If you're a maker, you probably already have these tools.
If you're a maker-to-be and still don't have these tools, don't worry as we've got you covered.
We've prepped a special version of the MAKERphone kit that already comes with the required tools.
Check out the rewards section (at the bottom of the listing) for more info about the available kit versions.
Who is this kit for?
Based on our experience, an 11-year-old kid should be able to assemble their own MAKERphone with a tiny bit of help from an adult. 
Therefore, the estimated age group is 11+. 
Estimated hardware build time: 7 hours. 
Build time varies and depends on the skills of the person and if the person has ever soldered before.
Estimated play time: unlimited
Estimated software development and learning time: unlimited
Building the MAKERphone is just the beginning. After that you'll spend numerous hours creating your own games, apps, learning about software, and experimenting with hardware.
What's in the kit?
1) MAKERphone circuit board - the main board that connects all the components in a uniform device that can work as a mobile phone
2) MAKERphone casing - multiple sheets of acrylic cut with the power of lasers. They protect the innards and give MAKERphone this sleek look
3) 128*160 full color TFT LCD - for playing games, displaying phone numbers and everything in between
4) GSM module - a tiny module responsible for everything related to calling and texting other people
5) Main microcomputer module - a dual core processor with built-in Wi-Fi, BLE, and a charging circuit
6) Sound module - a board with a DAC (digital to analog converter) chip and a headphone jack for music playback (responsible for ringtones, alarms, game sound effects)
7) Amplifier module - makes loud buzzes, bleeps and bloops
8) Stick-on antenna - for superb phone signal (a.k.a. send text messages while in the bathroom)
9) A bag with other tiny electronic components such as pushbuttons and colored button caps with a 128MB SD card preloaded with games and apps included
What’s in the tools pack?
If you choose a perk with a tools pack included, you’ll get this neat wooden box filled with all the essential tools needed for  MAKERphone assembly:
1) USB soldering iron (lightweight and portable, solder on the go!)
2) Metal soldering iron stand
3) USB cable for the soldering iron
4) Screwdriver  
5) USB power brick for powering your soldering iron
6) Some solder
7) Needle nose pliers
8) Diagonal cutter pliers
MAKERphone teaches you Python
Python Is Everywhere
Python is and has been for a while one of the world's most popular programming languages.
Every day, without realizing it, you probably use software that is written in Python and big companies use it to write all sorts of useful applications.
Python is easy to learn, intuitive, pleasing to the eye and comes with a plethora of libraries.
In fact, Python’s creator Guido van Rossum said that he wants to make computer programming accessible to everybody.
The best thing - you can code your own apps and games for MAKERphone using Python!
MAKERphone runs a special version of python called MicroPython - which has all the basic functions with some specific ones that we’ve defined in order to help you control your MAKERphone’s hardware.
Python is a type of programming language that’s not compiled but instead interpreted by the device in real time.
Despite that, we’ve designed special code snippets that will “freeze” your Python code and generate an executable file that can be placed on your MAEKRphone’s SD card!
MAKERphone teaches you Scratch
Scratch is a revolutionary program that makes it easy for kids as young as 5 to learn how to code with a simple drag-and-drop system of programming.
It already is one of the most popular programming tools for schools.
An awesome project called Whitecat IDE made it possible to control MAKERphone’s hardware with ease! It’s an open-source online tool that allows you to create code in a Scratch-like environment.
If you’ve never coded before, this is the way to go. 
Scratch’s intuitive design will let you code your first MAKERphone app in mere minutes!
MAKERphone loves Arduino
YES, we love Arduino!
Oh, Arduino, you’ve taught us to code and we’ve delved into the word of electronics thanks to your board. 
This product and our company was made possible thanks to Arduino’s open-sourcefulness and community.
Albert: “If Arduino was a lady, I’d take her to a fine dinner… with my GF’s permission, of course!”
Therefore, MAKERphone is based on Arduino-compatible ESP32 microcontroller and can be programmed in Arduino IDE (based on C/C++) - the most popular programming environment for makers and hardware enthusiasts.
MAKERphone is compatible with numerous Arduino related examples of manipulating various hardware and software components. 
In fact, it's compatible with most Arduino software libraries available online and will work with many Arduino shields and modules with minimal or no library code modifications.
MAKERphone takes you from Padawan to Jedi Master
You’ve never coded before? 
You also don’t know a thing about hardware? 
Absolutely no problemo as MAKERphone will take you from learning how to wield a soldering iron through assembling your very own fully functional mobile phone all the way to coding your very own app or game for your very own DIY mobile phone.
We’ve segmented the learning process into levels (like in a video game):
MAKERphone does games and apps
MAKERphone comes with a 128MB SD card preinstalled with dozens of useful applications, tools and games.
It comes with all the basic mobile phone-ish apps such as contacts, SMS, phone dialer, music player, as well as a collection of neat GameBoy-inspired games. 
MAKERphone is MAKERbuino-compatible
MAKERbuino games can be played on MAKERphone and they’re in full color this time!
MAKE your own apps and games!
YES! 
MAKERphone is DIY in its every aspect. 
Assemble the bits and pieces together in order to create a fully functional phone and get down to coding your own games and apps.
Our comprehensive tutorials will lead you through every step of your creative process.
There are three main ways to create a game/app for your MAKERphone:
 Scratch! 
A.k.a. colorful blocks that you drag and drop together in order to make your first app.
 Python! 
Use one of the most popular programming languages used in almost every educational institution or school that teaches people coding. 
Arduino (C/C++)
The most popular programming platform for makers and DIY-ers is MAKERphone-compatible and we like it a lot.
After coding your app, you can compile it to an “executable” binary file and put it on your MAKERphone’s SD card.
Apps located on the SD card are accessed through MAKERphone’s main menu via the “Apps” icon.
We’ve coded a programming library with sets of commands that let you easily:
develop in-app menus and other GUI-related content
play and develop sound FX and background music
draw, display and animate bitmaps
control MAKERphone’s hardware (i.e. make calls, read files from SD card, flash LEDs)
CircuitMess world
CircuitMess world is a place for MAKERphone users to share their creations, exchange knowledge, and download programs made by others as well as a collection of tutorials, guides and MAKERphone-related documentation.
Every game or app in CircuitMess world is open-source and available with a downloadable source code along with a compiled binary file that you can load directly on your device’s SD card.
To put it simply, you can take a look at the code of every MAKERphone compatible game or app, learn something new, change the code and implement parts of the code in your own project.
Our tutorials collection consists of two main parts:
1) Official tutorials and guides written by the MAKERphone team
2) User-created tutorials that everyone can write and share a bit of knowledge with other creators
Customize your MAKERphone's UI 
MAKERphone is customizable.
Express yourself by customizing your phone's UI.
This can be done through MAKERphone's settings or editing a setup file on MAKERphone's SD card. 
MAKERphone does multimedia
MAKERphone plays music, shows photos and runs videos.
MAKERphone does multimedia!
It supports mp3 files and you can set your favorite song as a ringtone by simply dragging and dropping it on MAKERphone’s SD card and selecting it in the menu.
MAKERphone GLOWS!
8 individually controllable RGB LEDs with 60FPS refresh rate make your MAKERphone glow (it’s literally glowing).
Control LEDs for neat in-game or in-app effects.
Make your MAKERphone turn red when you’re low on health or shooting projectiles in your mobile game.
Use RGB LEDs as a giant flashlight or just as a giant notification light. 
MAKERphone has (wicked) specs
Oh, so you’re that smarty pants that talks about teraflops and other imaginary words?
Well, here you go. Here’s a detailed explanation of MAKERhone’s hardware:
 Microcontroller (the chip that does smart stuff):

 ESP32 with Xtensa dual-core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor, operating at 160MHz and performing at up to 600 DMIPS.

 4MB of built-in flash memory + 520kB of SRAM.

 I2c interface, i2s interface, UARTs, PWM, ultra low power consumption and what not.
 Display: 1.8", 160*128px full color (RGB 16bit)

 25FPS refresh rate by default, up to 50FPS.

 Digitally controllable backlight level.
 Battery: LiPo 3.7V 600mAh, charged through micro USB B port.

 Sufficient for approximately 3 days of normal use.
   Sound: 10bit dedicated DAC (PCM5102)

 multi-channel MP3 playback

 2W class-D audio amp, audio jack 3.5mm, 1W speaker, dedicated EVC (electronic volume controller - PT2257)
   Back lights: 8 independently addressable and controllable RGB LEDs for light effects in your palms!
 Buttons: 4-way mechanical joystick, 12-button numeric keypad, A (confirm), B (back), 4 multi-purpose addressable buttons (C, D, E, F)
   Micro SD card socket: FAT and FAT32 compatible.

 Every console comes with an 128MB SD card with dozens of MAKERphone-compatible games and apps preloaded!

 Change between games and apps on the go, no computer required!
 RTC (real time clock): DS3231 Extremely Accurate I²C-Integrated RTC with temperature compensation - this thing keeps time and takes care of alarms
   Force feedback: eccentric rotating mass vibration motor (ERM) a.k.a. tiny motor that vibrates the phone 
*disclaimer: lizard not included in the basic version of the kit
 Network: Built in Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n and Bluetooth v4.2 BR/EDR and BLE

 SIM800L GSM chipset (the thing that calls other people) with built in Quad-band 850/900/1800/1900MHz.

 Micro SIM card slot.
Get your name on a custom MAKERphone!
Help us turn consumers into creators and spread the word about MAKERphone among your family and friends. 
We will randomly choose 100 (!) of you that shared our campaign on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter and thank you with a free personalisation of your new MAKERphone 
*EXCITED & BREATHING HEAVILY*

          The shared post needs to be set to public so that we can see it too! You'll also be asked to submit a link to your shared post in the survey at the end of the Kickstarter campaign. 
Personalisation is made by using a laser cutter.
MAKERphone <3 open-source
We love open-source.

            We’ve learned how to code and design electronic devices thanks to internet and open-source technology.
Thus, we want to push our work back into the community.
MAKERphone's software is fully open-source and available for you to download.
MAKERphone's hardware's schematics along with the bill of materials are also open-source and available online.
  That means that you can use our documentation to experiment with our hardware design using the provided documentation and schematics and create your own MAKERphone compatible boards and modules.
Oh, and implement our code in your other projects too!
MAKERphone has colors
HOLY COW! TUTTI FRUTTI!
MAEKRphone’s aesthetic design comes in many color options:
Elegant black 
I’M BATMAN, pick this one if you’re a tough guy/girl 
Hipsterish wood
Genuine wood… even smells like wood 
Plain white
White… just that
Yucky yellow   
YUCK! Looks like cheese, though... 
 Adriatic blue 
Blue as the Croatian sea
 Radioactive orange 
Made out of freshly squeezed radioactive oranges
Cherry red
No cherries were harmed in making of this case 
You’ll be able to pick your desired style in a survey sent after the campaign ends (that’s how Kickstarter works, DUH!)
MAKERphone has stretch goals
MAKERphone has rewards
MAKERphone has a timeline
Follow us on social media 
We’ve got all of them:
TWITTER
FACEBOOK
INSTAGRAM
even YOUTUBE
The story of MAKERphone (and CircuitMess)
Albert here! Let me tell you a story of CircuitMess and MAKERbuino.
 
          CircuitMess is a technology startup founded a year and a half ago after a successful Kickstarter campaign for MAKERbuino (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/makerbuino-a-diy-game-console/updates). 
The name of our startup stems from two words:
Circuit (we make electronic circuits) + Mess (our company is a mess) 
After successfully delivering MAKERbuino, we were collecting feedback from thousands of users and have started thinking about our next big step.

          An idea of a DIY mobile phone came in and we had so much fun brainstorming, developing and goofing around whilst preparing this amazing product and this exciting campaign :)
Thank you!
Our company was founded over a year ago thanks to generous Kickstarter supporters just like you.
As a result of your help, our lives have changed and our hobbies turned into full time jobs.
This wonderful experience allowed us to spread positive influence, open jobs and learn A LOT.
This shaped and defined us as people that we are today. 
If you ever come to Karlovac - Croatia, we’re buying you a drink!
MAKERphone has a “gang”
This whole story was started by Albert, his brother and a few friends back when he was in high school.
They were all working on it after school/work as much as they could.
Since then, a lot has changed.
We've rented a real workplace and started employing people (job interviews yay!).
CircuitMess has grown to 7 full time employees and a few part-timers and we've successfully converted this small hype-driven business to a self-sustainable startup.
Oh, and we have a microwave oven now too! 
Special thanks to: Matija Fućek, Tena Marčac, Degordian, Miron Bedić, Bruno Staroveški, Matea Tepić, Borna Bedić, Laura Rožić, Emil Gajšak, Antonio Valentić, Fran Božidar Prahić, Ana Car, Tomislav Car, Eric the Dog, Infinum, Luka Travas, Darko Kontin, Flavorific, Mediatoolkit, Bornfight, FabLab Hrvatska, Roberto Vdović.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $250MM raised between them.
http://jellopcrowdfunding.com/?utm_source=MAKERphone
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having a hardware startup can sometimes be harsh. 
 
Mass production risks are real and we’ve taken every precaution to prepare for them:

-MAKERphone uses common, easy to get components that can be easily purchased in large quantities.

-Hired workers and helpers will be doing the production of kits at our headquarters. We will directly control the manufacturing process and the quality of the finished kits

-We already have certain experience with producing similar kits and a production line set up as we’ve already successfully delivered a total of 6000 MAKERbuino kits sold via Kickstarter, our webshop and more than 25 of our distributors worldwide

- We’re a team of hard-working young technology enthusiasts living for what we do and believing in what we live for
 
We promise we'll keep you updated about any issues that may arise.
 
Keep making!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Give us some love… and coffee of course
support.descp:
Coffee keeps our minds clear and hearts warm and you’ll contribute to this project by giving us an extra shot of caffeine and support.
You’ll get thanks and love in return as well as a free CircuitMess HQ tour. Give us a buzz when you’re in the hood :)
We’ll also put your name in MAKERphone’s source code and on our webpage under the special “thank you” section (YAY!)

support.title: MAKERphone kit
support.descp:
“OH NO, I WAS LATE AGAIN”
You didn’t get an early bird kit? Boo-hoo… but WAIT, we have a very special price for a very special person (because Albert gets you my friend, he’s late all the time).
And did we mention STICKERS??? Yes! You’ll also get some snazzy stickers for showing off.
INCLUDES:
1 x MAKERphone DIY mobile phone kit

support.title: Assembled MAKERphone
support.descp:
A wise man once said: "AIN'T NOBODY GOT TIME FOR THAT“.
Building a MAKERphone is a fun and useful experience and we highly recommend it.
Despite that, we understand that not everybody loves soldering and would like a MAKERphone just to program games and apps for it... we respect that.
That's why we'll send you a fully assembled MAKERphone unit ready for you to make calls, play games and code apps.
INCLUDES:
1 x Assembled MAKERphone

Or if you have a lazy cousin.
Or if you want to have two MAKERphones but just do not have the time for assembling them both.
2 boxes. 1 kit. 1 assembled MAKERphone. Endless possibilities.
Yes, we truly are amazing.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 

It's been a while since our last update here, but we're alive and still going strong! 

After MAKERphone, we've released Nibble - a revamped version of MAKERbuino, and Spencer, a DIY voice assistant that was first released as a part of our STEM Box subscription service that we launched through a as well.

updates.update_userinfo: STEM Box's Kickstarter is coming to an amazing end, all thanks to you folks!
updates.update_content:
With our Kickstarter campaign approaching its end after a wild 50 days, I wanted to say a special little thank you to some of you folks.
STEM Box is a huge success on Kickstarter and I couldn’t be happier:

updates.update_userinfo: Sharing is caring: Get 20% cashback by helping us share the news about our new campaign
updates.update_content:
Hi folks, we really appreciate all of you sharing our new campaign and helping us take this project to the next level <3    We wanted to give back a little extra love (and cash) for all your support:
We’ve created a referral program on a page called Kickbooster where you can earn 20% cashback from every pledge you bring in to our campaign (from your shares with your family, friends, and digital network).

Hey folks, after launching MAKERbuino and MAKERphone, we have been working even harder on a whole new line of DIY electronic projects and we are very excited to share the news with you: 
STEM Box is finally here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/circuitmess-stem-box

updates.update_userinfo: Error: If you didn’t receive your phone, reach out!
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody,
I hope everyone is well during these uncertain times!
We’d like to keep our promise of delivering MAKERphones to all of our backers, but a tiny portion of our backers still didn’t receive their phones because they’ve never responded to our surveys or emails and we do not have their shipping addresses.

updates.update_userinfo: If you haven't received your phone yet, please get in touch!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I want to thank you for your support throughout the project! The feedback you’ve given us really means a lot!

updates.update_userinfo: MINI COMPETITION - Who can take the best photo of MAKERphone?
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
We have a couple of exciting news and we need your help to make something happen. :D
Soon we'll be moving into our new office in Zagreb (the capital of Croatia) which would mean a lot more possibilities for cooperation with other young and promising investors, which we hope, will ultimately lead to new exciting products.

updates.update_userinfo: I HAVE A SMALL FAVOUR TO ASK - Please review us on Trustpilot!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,

Every day we are getting a lot of questions about the phone and everything related to it.

We’re trying our best to reply as soon as we can, but sometimes the days are way too short (we would need at least 40 hours a day)!

It is a place where all the conversation regarding our products takes place.

It is one very active community, with people posting regularly, on a daily basis.

Hey everyone,

Now that most of the MAKERphones got shipped it’s time to get down to business.

While assembling the phone is one part of the journey, programming it is a completely new experience.

campaign.story:
You can not manage to grow beautiful flowers? Then a smart watering reminder is perfect for you.
PlantRay - smart plant watering reminder
Nature, vegetation, clean and fresh air are just some of the benefits brought to us by the company of plants. Nature is a part of us and it is right that we have a part of nature also in our homes and at our workplace. Plants liven up our surroundings. Numerous studies show that plants lessen the stress and improve our concentration, productivity and wellbeing. Beside that, they also purify and humidify the air. 
We hear too often that if a plant dies, we should just buy a new one. But, is this really the way we want to act? No, we do not! We want plants to last for years, not just months or weeks.
With PlantRay there will be no wilted plants anymore
To water or not to water the plants?  Sometimes we simply forget to water the indoor plants. Or we water them too much and they drown. PlantRay is perfectly suitable for home or office use.
With PlantRay everyone in the office will know the right time to water the plants
It's simple to use. PlanRay will remind you when the time to water the plant is perfect.
"When was the last time I watered that flower in the corner?" 
PlantRay helps us grow plants. It will remind you to water the plants - so simple and useful.
Everybody knows that the most important part of growing plants is correct watering. The majority of plants cannot grow well precisely because of too much or too little water. Often, when caring for plants, the most common issue is that we simply forget to water the indoor plants, or we water them too often. PlantRay is a device that measures the humidity of soil. When the soil is dry enough, the device warns us that the plant needs to be watered. In this way the plants do not get under stress and they grow beautifully. Whoever notices that the PlantRay beside the plant is pulsating red, he or she should simply water the plant.
Water the plant when the PlantRay blinks red! PlantRay will turn back to blue when the plant gets enough water.
Plantray is a very nice gift.
How to use PlantRay?
PlantRay has 4 programmes for different types of plants: for plants that prefer dry climate, need regular watering and swampy soil and for special program for orchids.
You can change the programme by pressing the button.
Insert the battery and choose the programme. Put the PlantRay into the soil up to the mark. The device has to stand firmly in the soil. Water the plant so that the device sets up correctly. From then on, PlantRay constantly measures the humidity of the soil and when needed its red LED light will remind you to water the plant.
How does PlantRay work?
PlantRay – the smart moisture reminder measures humidity by means of an advanced capacitive humidity sensor, which knows how to measure the effect of the minerals in the soil. The collected data is saved in the memory and processed so that it can get adjusted simultaneously. Every time the plant is watered, the device adjusts to the new conditions. This is why PlantRay will always remind you at the right time when the plant needs to be watered. 
PlantrRay graph shows how much water is in the soil (weight), data from the sensor, and colour of blinking
Meaning of the lightning (the lightning turns off during the night)
When PlnatRay blinks red, it is time to water your plant.
What is inside?
 Why is PlantRay a technically advanced product?
The sensor operates at high frequencies to eliminate the influence of minerals to the measurement, therefore the measurement is very accurate
The sensor contains an algorithm that determines the point of saturation of soil with water, and continuously calculates the limit levels for “watered” (blue LED), “normal” (green LED) and “dry” soil (red LED)
PlantRay’s sound signal warns us of the critical dryness of the soil
The light sensor deactivates visual and sound signals at night
The brightness of the LED flashing is adjusted to the light of the surroundings.
The sensor is able to adapt to some changes in the soil (soil gets denser)
Software-optimized operation allows the battery to function even 2 years and more
How far are we with the development?
We have been developing PlantRay for over a year and a half. We invested in the engineering of the equipment for injecting plastic parts. We also made some test devices for promotional intent. We developed the version 1.2, which is now being offered on the Kickstarter platform. The new version has an entirely new electronic circuit system, which is more precise, resisting to temperature and insensitive to conductivity of soil.
PlantRay development, prototypes, and evaluation of sensor moisture sensor
Why do we need funds?
We have developed the device with our own resources and produced and tested it in limited quantities. Now we need you – backers – to help us with the very last step – raising funds. Raised funds would give our project additional impetus to bring the device in your homes. With raised funds we would finance the production on a larger scale, so that we could achieve an affordable price. We would also buy additional equipment for manufacturing our products. 
Rewards for supporters:
  PlantRay will come in bunch of different colours. You will select the colour in the survey after the campaign ends.
Delivery time rewards
  We will deliver first 3000 units in December 2018.
About the team
Andrej Nastran – Mastermind of the PlantRay project. "In my free time I like to develop different kinds of electronic gadgets, most of them are in connection with different plants. Generally speaking I like to grow plants and this is why I would like to make things easier. My role in the PlantRay Project was developing the PCB circuit; I did the 3D model design of the hygrometer, wrote the FW and did all of the required tests. My previous successful crowd funding project is http://daisy.si/
Uroš Gomboc – "I joined the project because I like the idea of it. Entrepreneurship is my hobby. Years of experiences, which I gained when I was head of sales in different multinational corporations, will help launching the product on the market. Primarily, my responsibilities are sales, marketing and organisation".
Hinko Golias – "I like innovative and interesting projects, which is why I joined the team. I have a manufacturing and services company for laboratory technology. I support this project financially, technically and I also offer help in the production".
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To reduce the risks, we developed the product to the stage that we already made a prototype series of the version 1.0. Kickstarter supporters will receive an upgraded version 1.2. To sum up; we have already made all the equipment for injecting plastic parts, the circuit is finished and so is the software. All the expenses have been carefully calculated (the price of material, packaging, packets, taxes and costs of shipment). We are well aware of our responsibilities to our supporters that we finish the project and deliver the product to your homes. We will inform you regularly of the status and production of the device and we will also inform you of any changes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi, dear Backers,  
We would like to thank you for your support to our project.  
Our team works hard to gain traction on our project. We decide to invest our own funds for initial limited production, so that all supporters can receive the requested number of Plantray units. This means you will be one of the first persons able to use Plantray for the lush growth of your plants.

campaign.story:
Joe McPhee & Peter Brötzmann, Ljubljana / Slovenia
“Žiga is a “Muse-ician,” one who make magic with the muses. With his mind’s eye, he has the ability, to move faster than the speed of light, to capture moments in time and through his photographs, share those moments with the world. The camera in his hands, transforms shadow and light from the common place into truly extraordinary human experiences. He is an improviser, a chronicler of life in real time, a poet, a philosopher, a free spirit, a song in anticipation of being sung. These are the very disciplines which are the essence of my musical world.” 
Joe McPhee (excerpt from the text, featured in the book)
Book specification: 
- 376 pages printed in a combination of duotone and full color on Garda Premium Natural paper
- Sewn-bound in hardcover
- Printed in Slovenia- Size in cm: 25x30 (spine cca. 3.2) in one of best European printing houses Gorenjski Tisk
- Weight in kg: cca 2.6
- The book is practically ready for production!(some minor deviations are possible) 
Miles Davis, Belgrade, Serbia
Everything started in 1986 at a Miles Davis concert in Belgrade. 
I decided, then and there, I would explore the world of music and photograph its details. I also took a picture which appears on the cover of the Slovenian edition of Miles Davis’s autobiography.  
“Cloud Arrangers” is the destination of my 33 years on the road as a music photographer. This book is for music, which is so important to me. But it is a book for the new generation, a shout out to everybody involved in music. We need to proceed on our mission, we need to continue with our work. We need to help the scene stay alive. “Cloud Arrangers” is the work of my lifetime.
It is also my first sole publication after “Jazzy-ga!”, a catalogue which accompanied my first international exhibition at the 1996 Saalfelden Jazz Festival in Austria, one of the most important festivals in Europe.
Now that 22 years have passed since I last published a book of music photography – the most recent eight of them spent on planning “Cloud Arrangers” – it is finally time to release my work into the open. On 376 pages, the book depicts almost all musical genres, from the mainstream all the way to free improvised music. Different genres of photography are also on display, from reportage-style catching-the-moment, both onstage and behind the scenes, to portraits of individuals or groups.
Outer sleeve of the book, portrait of mine done by Mats Äleklint
 And here you can see few designed pages from the book:
Inner cover of the book
page 6 and 7, Concert at Capo Testa / Sardinia, Italy
page 40, Montreal jazz Festival, Canada
   page 32 and 33, Stanley Clarke at Skopje Jazz Festival, Macedonia; Hugh Masekela at Valamar Jazz festival , Croatia
Sonny Rollins, Zagreb / Croatia, 3009
page 158 and 159 - Anthony Braxton in Ljubljana, 2000
page 199 - Enzo Favata in Fonni / Sardinia, Italy, 2006
page 224 and 225, King Ayisoba, Druga Godba 2017; Ray Charles, Skopje JazzFestival, Macedonia, 1996
page 372 and 373, my text and Joëlle Léandre's text
Last inner pages
                The legends Mats Gustafsson, Joëlle Léandre, Joe McPhee, Ken Vandermark, and John Kelman have all contributed forewords.
It was hell to make a selection out of a huge archive. In the end I decided on those images I felt were the most vibrating, which recalled unforgettable memories, or those in which I had managed to transfer the deepest feelings of the event. I didn't want to include any picture in which the people depicted would not have liked themselves. The book presents the work closest to me, my best pictures, mostly shot in black-and-white with a few exceptions in color. Some of the earliest photos are right from the beginning of my path – like the 1986 Miles Davis concert in Belgrade. I started out working with analog cameras and have only recently switched to digital. But I still take the occasional portrait with an analog 6x7 medium-format camera.
Cesaria Evora, Ljubljana / Slovenia
All the feelings generated during the listening to the music I love, I transfer onto the photographs I am making. This is the magic I love so much, and which is presented in the book. I hope this will become apparent to you, too. My intentions with the book? To chronicle the happenings in the world of music during a stretch of time (namely, that of my lifetime), and to make sure these concerts will not be forgotten so easily. I hope this book will show the world how important musicians are, and how boundless their creativity.

I feel privileged for having had the chance of meeting so many wonderful people, of hearing so much good music, and of having seen a bit of the world. I am happy, and I certainly don't regret, that I have chosen the world of music as the main subject of my photography. Many have helped with my photography and with the making of this book. My immense thanks go to musicians and to concert promoters.

  Tom Waits, Florence, Italy, 1999
I am grateful and proud to report that Tom Waits and his management gave their kind permission to include a picture of him in the book.
A big Thank You to all of you who believe in my work, helping me with financial support or by spreading the word about the crowdfunding.

Paul Lovens / cover of the book
Most of the funds raised will be spent on actual ink and paper and the like. I also need to pay all the talented specialists involved in book production, from graphic designers to printers and binders and for production of rewards. The remainder will partly cover postage for sending copies of the book to all my backers.
PLAY

Schedule: 
-beginning of  october, after campaign or immediately, after we get over the pledged amount, we finish design and start print preparations 
-beginning or middle of november 
- printing-beginning of december 2018, january 2019 - distributing
I hope, will do my best, that book will be ready at the beginning of december. In case something goes wrong, supporters will get it latest at the end of January 2019.

Mats Gustafsson, Nickelsdorf / Austria
Mats Gustafsson's signature on a postcard

Mats Gustafsson (excerpt from the text, featured in the book):
     “Thanks to artists like Žiga we have a chance to remember those crucial moments that are valid to us. In our music. In our art. In our life. Because he captured them. He was there. And his sense of timing is so unbelievably musical. Pure music. That I can say. Music in black and white. Black and white music. I love the details. The compositions. The form. The density. The flow. The energy. It is all there. Inside of the images. And yes … I can also put it simple: Žiga is for sure the most amazing, sensitive and creative photographer alive when it comes to capturing the moment of MUSIC. In MUSIC. When it is done. Live. Alive. When it is being created. When the instant NOW appears. BANG! Wam bam BANG – CLICK! CLICK! “ 
Han Bennink, Maribor / Slovenia
Michael Zerang, Hamid Drake, Tim Daisy, Krakow / Poland
Ken Vandermark (excerpt from the text, featured in the book):
"Ziga's black & white images are unique for a variety of reasons.  For one thing, he has the rare ability to take highly effective portraits which capture the different personalities of the musicians involved (for example, compare the photographs of Anthony Braxton, Han Bennink, Paul Lovens, and Joe McPhee; or how Ziga's timing reveals the different spirits of three drummers in his picture of Michael Zerang, Hamid Drake, and Tim Daisy- all happy to be together, all themselves).  Ziga also takes highly effective performance and candid shots (for example, contrast the images of Muhal Richard Abrams, Kaja Draksler, Elvin Jones, Toshinori Kondo, and Akira Sakata). "
Raciel Torres, Santa Teresa Di Galura, Sardinia / Italy
Joëlle Léandre, St.Johann in Tirol / Austria
Joëlle Léandre:
“He simply knows the body gestures, the lights and feelings, the risk taking an adventure, I think that he is an improviser who improvise in real time !! His camera in his hands becomes "Music".  
Musica Sulle Bocche, Capo Testa, Sardinia / Italy

Music is the best!
Last day of Tonic club in New York / U.S.A.
Jan Granlie / Salt-peanuts.eu: 
"When I first met Ziga, in Stavanger, Norway, at the Jazz Norway in a Nutshell, some years ago, I soon realized that I had got a new photograpic hero. And after that first meeting, I have been following him and his fantastic photos on the internet and on jazz festivals all around Europe, and even in Penang, Malaysia. I have watched him when he has been the festival photographer at a festival in Santa Teresa Di Galura, Sardinia, and when he has been crawling in front of a lot of different stages, trying to get the best photos. And every time his pictures are so beautiful. We have been on the same concerts, taking photos, but afterwards, when we look at the pictures, it looks like he has been to another, and much better concert than me! Because his pictures are pure magic!" 
One of the rewards / Postcards
One of the rewards / Postcards
One of the rewards / Postcards
PLAY

Book is designed by Marek Wajda, born July 5, 1956 in Kraków.
Marek Wajda @ my home finishing design; July 2018
Polish freelance graphic designer based in Warsaw, graduated with honours from Henryk Tomaszewski’s Faculty of Graphic Arts’ master studio at the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw in 1984.
In his work he is striving to combine the outstanding achievements of the Polish School of Posters (which is his professor’s legacy) with the experiences from a long-term professional cooperation with various publishing houses, cultural institutions, advertising agencies and international companies, such as student weekly ITD (which was in the eighties very important illustrated Polish publication including a lot of works of famous Polish photographers), SAD/Apple IMC Poland (as a specialist of graphic design) and BBDO Advertising Agency (where he also held an Art Director managing position).
Along his career path he has been involved in both commercial and independent projects, mostly focused on designing logos, book and book cover layouts, but also the exhibitions using photographs as a medium. He shows a keen interest in photography applying it in his professional work and as a leisure activity. This has resulted in multiple exhibitions in art galleries across Poland.
Lately, due to his life-long passion for music he has been mostly focusing on designing posters for various musical events and festivals, and music CDs/LPs cover layouts. Cooperation with NotTwo Records, Polnisches Institut Wien / Polish Institute in Vienna / Austria, and Warsaw music venue Pardon, To Tu resulted in last 11 years in more than 80 CDs/LPs cover layouts and nearly 200 posters for jazz and improvised music events of musicians such as Ken Vandermark, Peter Brötzmann, Charles Gayle, Joe McPhee, Evan Parker, Alexander von Schlippenbach, William Parker, Hamid Drake, Mats Gustafsson, Dave Rempis, Peter Evans, Marc Ribot, Paal Nilssen-Love, Ingebrigt Håker-Flaten, Mikołaj Trzaska, Michael Gira, Thurston Moore, KONONO No 2, Ebo Taylor, and many, many others.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges when publishing a photo book include the possibility of delay, however my collaborators are very experienced at dealing with the production and printing challenges involved in making exceptional photography books. If this campaign is successful, I will do everything possible to make sure the book is published and shipped by the end of January 2019. Everybody involved is informed about my plans, waiting for the green light, to go on with the work.
After pledging your support, please help spread the word about this project by sharing this page with your friends. Thank you for your help in making this book possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear all
book is printed! Yeah! What I am showing you is short footage of one of the final steps i the printing house that we / they started working on today.And you can see for the first time how real  book will look like. My next steps, after I get books is organise myself in the way of sending books around. I actually made already few of them, but this final is still waiting for me. Packaging and going to the post office. As I am until Christmas fully occupied,  with selling my pictures at Christmas Artmarket in Ljubljana (starting on 17th of December), will start sending books at the beginning of January, when post offices won't have so much work anymore. Was really hoping getting books week earlier, but it was not possible. Those based in Slovenia and If you would like to get it as soon as possible, I invite to visit me at Artmarket ( just let me know before if you are coming) and you can pick it up there. Hugs and greetings!

updates.update_userinfo: Cloud Arrangers / just another point of no return
updates.update_content: Showing you few pictures from last three days spent in the printing house:

Dear backers,
FYI...ozalid / almost real test print on my table. Last corrections for  book are prepared. Everything goes as planned and  hopefully will stay like that. Book is going into print at the end of month. 
stay tuned!

Hello dear supporters,
everything is under control. Book is going to be printed in a while. I am preparing pictures for printing. We made some tests. Soon we gonna import high resolution photos into our PDF  and almost everything else, considering content of the book is in the layout. Dates for printing are known - we are waiting for the paper. Hopefully it will arrived as promised. Here I am showing you short footage of the test prints.

campaign.story:
Key master is the best single-piece multi-tool with more practical features than traditional tools while still being able to fit comfortably in your pocket. One of the smallest everyday carry tools combines several tools in one. 
There are so many types of multi-tools on the market.
But not everything is for everyone. There may be no single multi-tool that’s perfect for everyone, but there should be one that’s almost perfect for anyone’s particular situation. Everyone has an occasional need to cut a line, tighten a screw or open a box. It is a must-have for all cyclists, campers, skiers, hikers and outdoor enthusiasts. That’s why Key master is perfect for every day carry. Just have it on your keychain and you are ready to go. No extra bulk in your pants ;)
Our focus for Key master multitool was to create a tool that is cool, small, strong and most importantly functional. We focused on the importance of everyday usage. Key master design incorporates everyday habits and tools that we use on a daily basis.
"You can do what with Key master? That is clever." That is the usual response that we get when we show Key master. You probably don’t even think that you can have a tool with so many functionalities. We will show you how you can use Key master and test it yourself! Have it on a keychain to be available for use. It’s simple, small and highly functional master for your pocket, it’s Key master.
Material: To deliver a long lasting experience, we decided to use Grade 5 Titanium. It has highest strength-to-weight ratio of any metal, outstanding corrosion resistance and it is lightweight. Titanium is perfect material due to its durability, its resistance to seawater and chlorine in swimming pools and as it is non-toxic. The fact that titanium is so strong, light and non-toxic it makes perfect metal of choice for our Key master production.
Key master is simple and highly functional tool that will change the way you do things every day! With its combinations of functionalities it's going to excite you and make your everyday tasks easier. Take a look below to see all the features and functions that Key master offers!
Check out the tips how to use Key master, incorporated in everyday life.
1. Lightweight – titanium is lighter than steel
2. Strong – titanium has a highest strength-to-density ratio of any metallic element. Titanium has strength and hardness comparable to carbon steel.
3. Durable – titanium is one of the most durable metals on the planet, which is why it’s used in aerospace and military
4. Multi functional – functional tool that can help get you out of a jam
5. Small – small as a Key, ideal for your keychain
6. Pocket friendly – perfect for everyday carry in your pocket
7. Excellent corrosion resistance - titanium is more resistant than any other metal.Titanium is highly resistant to most types of corrosion. It will hold for years without succumbing to the effects of rust and corrosion.
8. Non-toxicity - titanium is used as a material for surgical implants and dental plates attesting to the non-toxicity of titanium. Also titanium can be used within the human body due to its bio-inert qualities.
9. It’s master for your pocket - Key master
10. MUST-HAVE for outdoor enthusiasts
See the variety of rewards we offer below and let us know if you have any question or special request.
Our campaign starts in Avgust. Hopefully it will finish successfully funded in October. In that case we will start the production in December. As our suppliers are on standby we hope to start the first shipments end of December/beginning of January.
Thank you for taking the time to learn about our project Key master and we sincerely can’t thank you enough for the supporting our dream. THANK YOU!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are more than capable of delivering "Key master multi-tool" to the market.
We proved our competence with our Kickstarter projects "MyPocketMaster" reaching over 5,000$ in backing and "JO- Titanium bottle opener" reaching over 3800$(feel free to check it out)

Although we don't foresee any major problems, we understand that there is always a chance of small delays. We have lowered the risk of failure by making "Key master" production process as simple as possible. Our business partners are fully informed about the launch of "Key master" and are waiting for the first production orders. The only thing remaining is waiting for your support to help us to meet the goal that we require to bring "Key master" to life. Rest assured we'll be updating all backers frequently on our progress.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
