campaign.story:
The Nourish app is a new wellbeing app - the first of its kind - specifically tailored to mothers and the emotions and challenges they face. 
An accessible, multi-disciplinary toolkit, full of practical, evidenece-based, bite-sized inspiration and support on emotional wellbeing and self-care. 
Helping mothers love and nourish themselves, so they can ride the storms and maximise the magic of motherhood.
Helping mothers access their best selves. Not only for themselves, but also for their families, their workplace and for our society. 
Motherhood is an emotional roller-coaster that can leave you feeling battered and bruised.  
Ever wish you had a little helper, cheering you on from the side-lines? Helping you navigate those turbulent waves, lifting you out of the dark waters? Helping you find a little more balance, a little more calm, a little more joy in each and every day? 
Our new mobile app will be just that – your pocket rocket of nourishment and connection – supporting, motivating and inspiring you to not only survive, but thrive in your motherhood journey.
Designed by mums for mums
The Nourish App is the brainchild of Sara Campin, an Oxford University graduate, strategy consultant and a personal development coach. After struggling with her emotional wellbeing after the birth of both her kids and in juggling the pressures of a stressful job and modern mothering, Sara spotted a huge gap in the market for a simple, accessible, ‘go-to’ resource to support mothers in their emotional wellbeing.
Sara has brought together a team of leading well-being experts, who all have first-hand experience of how turbulent the motherhood ride can be, plus the knowledge tools and expertise to make a significant difference to other mothers and their families.
We’re revolutionising motherhood
We're on a mission to make good mental health and positive wellbeing easy and accessible to ALL mothers. 
We believe maternal mental health matters  
Perinatal maternal mental health is an under diagnosed and under-treated public health issue. Many woman suffer on alone, without support, often because of the stigma associated with mental health, and the fear of being labelled a ‘failure’ or a ‘bad mother’.
Despite the figures there is still limited emphasis on preparing woman for the birth of a mother – the most significant physical and psychological transition a woman will ever experience. Plus, only limited support or ‘go-to’ resources exist to help mothers in their emotional wellbeing throughout their journey.
We’re on a mission to create a brighter future for mothers and their families.
Imagine a world where no mother is ever alone on her motherhood journey. 
Instead every mother has a personal support team in her pocket, helping her love and nourish herself, and ride those turbulent waves of motherhood. 
Where all mothers have access to their best selves. Not only for themselves, but also for their families, their communities, their workplaces and for our society as a whole. 
We believe self-care is healthcare. 
We believe self-care isn’t selfish. We believe it's the best thing a mother can do for herself and for her kids. We believe self-care is healthcare for our physical, emotional, energetic and mental health.
In prioritising self-care and mental wellbeing we can protect the mind and body from the impact of life’s stresses and traumatic events, and enable the adoption of healthy lifestyles.
Mental wellbeing is associated with better interpersonal relationships and socially healthier societies.   
It helps people achieve their potential, realise their ambitions, cope with adversity, work productively and contribute effectively to their communities and to society.
We believe that with access to the right tools & support, all mothers can find greater joy in their path. We want to make this a reality for all mothers. 
Because every mother deserves the right to enjoy motherhood! 
The Nourish app will be…..  
Your personal champion  
Our app will send you inspiring, uplifting and supportive messages to encourage you to be kind to yourself and nourish your mind.
Your support team  
Our design and content will have an interactive feel and interactive features, to give you a personal and human touch. All our content will be created by a team of passionate mums, who also happen to include some of the leading UK experts in maternal wellbeing. 
 All our content will be linked to its contributor, so that you get the sense of the real people behind it and so that you can find more of the things that you love, should you wish.   
Your daily dose of nourishment  
Our design and user experience will be both calming and uplifting – a dose of nourishment in itself. We want you to come away feeling nurtured, nourished, motivated or uplifted, depending on your needs and preferences in that moment.  
Uniquely designed to support the needs of mothers  
Our content will be tailored to mothers and the specific emotions and challenges they face at different stages in the motherhood journey.
Version 1, our Minimal Viable Product (MVP), will include some initial content that will benefit all mums at every stage, some specific content tailored for new mums and some specific content for working mums.
As we grow, our hope is to create and share content to support the typical emotions and challenges across ALL stages of the motherhood journey and maybe one day for dads too.
A broad range of tools depending on your needs and preferences in that moment  
Everyone’s self-care needs, interests, preferences and goals are different. So what one person finds nourishing differs from another and even our own needs will change over time. 
Our app will include a range of evidence-based tools and strategies for you to explore, depending on your preferences and needs in that moment. We are not just a mama meditation app. You will be able to access practical, bite-sized content across a broad range of disciplines from yoga, to mindfulness, to breathing, to CBT techniques and nutrition, grouped under Mind, Body and Breath.   
Content will also be available in a range of different formats from text, to audio, to video. 
Tips and tools to not only survive, but thrive  
The most effective kind of self-care is a proactive approach. By regularly topping up your energy bank balance you will be more resilient in the face of life’s inevitable challenges. 
The Nourish app will also contain a library of inspiration on self-care for use in any moment, based on Suzy Reading’s Vitality Framework.
An app to support, motivate and inspire EVERY mother  
Our app will be for ALL mums. For new mums, for pregnant mums, for working mums, for stay at home mums, for mentally well mums, for mentally ill mums, for single mums, for married mums. For every single mother.   
We’re all about social impact  
We’re a group of mums with the life experience and the expertise to make a real difference to mother and their families. This is our shared passion. This is what matters to us – spreading love, kindness and the tools and benefits of self-care.  
Our focus is social impact and not financial return. In an ideal world we would make our app free so that we can help everyone. However, we will need to charge a small subscription fee to make the Nourish App sustainable and ensure that we are able to deliver enhanced content and functionality overtime. But, we really want to keep the costs to the user as low as possible, and definitely less than the price of a single coffee a month (!), so that we can make it accessible to as many people as possible. 
We also want to avoid advertising as we believe it creates additional unwanted stimuli that is detrimental to our mental wellbeing and doesn’t fit with our brand ethos.
We’re taking a holistic approach to maternal mental health  
We are all about prioritising mental wellbeing to protect our mental health. But we also know that every one of us has the capacity to suffer from a mental health problem. We’re therefore taking a holistic approach and the majority of any profits we make will be donated to mental health charities.
We need your help!  
Because our focus is social impact and because we’re a social enterprise, we’re less attractive to typical commercial investors, and even impact investors, who all want to know where their big bucks are going to come from.  
Almost everyone involved in the project so far has donated their time, expertise and passion for free. However, to build the technology and create high quality content, we need a bit of hard cash.  
We’ve got an important mission, bags of passion, a fantastic team and a great design. But we need your money to help build the technology and launch our Minimal Viable Product so that we can start spreading the love and helping mums.
We will use the money we raise on Kickstarter to finalise the detailed tech design and build our Minimal Viable Product (MVP) in iOS. The subsequent development of the app on the Android platform and the recording and editing of content will be self-funded. We hope to use this MVP to not only start helping mothers immediately but also to attract further financing to expand our reach through marketing, PR & strategic partnerships.
Check out our fabulous rewards!  
We’ve created an info-graphic so you can see what’s on offer in return for your support. We realise there's lots to choose from so sorry about that. Hopefully though something for everyone!
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
The Nourish Team  
Sara Campin, Founder of Nourish is an Oxford University graduate, strategy consultant and a personal development coach. Sara has spent the last 15 years managing and delivering complex, multi-disciplinary projects and programmes in the life-sciences and charitable sectors. She began her career at Accenture, where she led the design and development of a number of custom development products.  
Our founding team of experts cover a wide range of specialist areas including psychology, mindfulness, yoga, hypnobirthing, Pilates and personal training. However, our ambition is to continue to grow the team and expertise involved, so we can deliver an even broader range of evidence-based tips and tools, including tips on nutrition, to help mothers thrive.  
Suzy Reading author of The Selfcare Revolution, psychologist & yoga teacher  
Dr Rebecca Moore perinatal psychiatrist, birth trauma expert  
Emma Svanberg (The Mumologist) perinatal  psychologist, Make Birth Better campaigner  
Anya Hayes (Mother’s Wellness Toolkit) author of The Super Mum Myth, wellness & Pilates expert  
Olivia Horne happiness coach, meditation mentor & Relax Kids coach
Elizabeth Davies (The Mummy Coach) pre/postnatal personal trainer & postnatal doula  
Jo Kaye (The Breathe Academy) accredited mindfulness coach, trained at London Meditation  
Dr Catherine Marshall - General Practitioner with special interest in woman’s health  
Our team includes robust clinical expertise, to ensure we have appropriate oversight and signposting within the app.  
We’ve partnered with Kamino, an experienced and reputable mobile app development agency. Kamino’s core focus is in building high quality mobile applications that offer users a seamless experience that just works. Their portfolio covers a wide range of sectors including health. They have a wealth of experience within the team to deliver a robust and comprehensive solution.
We’d love to hear from you!  
This is a woman-founded start-up and a social-enterprise and we are extremely grateful for the support and enthusiasm we've met with thus far. If you have any questions about this campaign, suggestions, or ideas for collaborations, please get in touch.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Product evolution: we’re unique – one of a kind that has not been done before. We’re really excited about bringing it to market, but until we’ve launched our first version (our MVP) we won't be able to validate exactly what resonates with users and what doesn’t. To help mitigate this risk we will be running an alpha trial process through the MVP development phase and will also run beta testing with an expanded group. We will use the feedback received to course correct as and when necessary.

Social impact focus: as we’ve said, our focus is impact and not financial return which does make us less attractive to investors. But we believe by charging a small fee for the app, we can make it not only affordable for all mothers, but also support a sustainable business model. 

Only the start: the money we’re raising will help us build our Minimal Viable Product. We’ll need more cash to build all the enhanced features we’d love to build, including a community dimension to the app. We’ll also need more cash to create and publish even more relevant content across all stages of the motherhood journey. Finally, we’ll need more cash to expand our reach and get our app in front of more mums. However, our MVP will be a central pillar for future funding conversations and a successful crowd funding campaign will help us demonstrate the purpose and need. 

Multi-platform: because we want to make our app accessible to each and every mother. We need to develop it on both iOS and Android platforms. This makes it more complex and costly to build and manage both the initial product and future enhancements. We considered using a cross platform development framework, but our view is that the higher quality of user experience achievable using native development justifies the increased cost of this approach.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Introducing the extraordinary uber-light yet incredibly sturdy artwear bags made by award winning artists worldwide on a mission to co-create, artify, stylize and revitalize our daily lives and art-starved hearts. One little bag at a time.
To our friends, fellow art-lovers and goofballers:
You’re our daily inspiration marching down the street. Our Stiglo is your Stiglo. Make our canvas your Backpack, your head turning Tote, your mood lifting Pouch. Let our artists become your personal style reviving, edge sharpening, whimsically nutrious adulting joy bag. 
If you're new to navigating Kickstarter, here's a cheat sheet.
We’ve come together from a variety of places and creative industries. Milos has a habit of building and leading internationally awarded creative and design teams across 3 continents. He’s both a seasoned Executive Creative Director and artist himself. Milan is a veteran Software Engineer behind the code that runs VR, CGI and other things that make gamers and creatives drool. Maria’s a Stylist with a design background, using fashion to creating unique worlds on commercial and blockbuster film sets. As a Producer in international art, design and media, Danica runs International Relations for the Faculty of Applied Arts in Belgrade with a history of activating young people to shape Youth and Education Policy in Serbia and the EU. Cindy’s a Creative Director and Writer in international advertising and content, curating the brands you’re wearing, driving, lusting (and hopefully not hating). Masha’s a rising illustrator, muralist, animator and artist liaison. And finally, Susan’s an experienced Fashion Designer and Consultant based in San Francisco to help keep us informed and on track as Stiglo marches forward.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have made sure that our material suppliers are aware of our needs, but there is always a small risk of them being late to deliver.

Another potential risk is during transport to our fulfillment centers in EU & USA. Shipping will be insured, but if anything happens to a shipment it will take us additional time to collect the insurance and remake and re-ship the products.

Import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control. On the bright side, our campaign is EU and USA friendly - we have fulfillment partners and ship from EU and USA to minimize transport costs for our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: #10 Stiglo commandment: Thau shalt wear Stiglo!
updates.update_content:
Hi there for one last time, within this Kickstarter campaign.
Thanks for joining Stiglo's biblical rollercoaster ride. All shipments have been sent out by now. Hope you are wearing your Stiglo pieces with joy or at least you've got your shipment tracking number (in case not, holler).
Thanks to all of you who believed in Stiglo, recognizing its value in these overcrowded crowdfunding times. Your push was an invaluable inspiration for us to keep on doing what we strongly believe in.

We remember times when we used to love customs officers more… but in any case our shipments to both Europe and America are there. Our logistic centre in Europe has already shipped packages to you and in US we’re still fighting paperwork battle to get Stiglo to our USA backers as fast as possible. Again, we’re so absolutely grateful for your patience.
And we are completely humbled by the positive reactions we’re getting from the parts of the world where our shipment has reached the backers. That alone was worth the effort.

updates.update_userinfo: that's right, the sound of boxes, barcodes, labels and airplanes
updates.update_content:
Stiglo is on it's way to you dear people.
it kinda feels like we're packing presents for many, many friends around the world - so, yasss, the feeling is good.
it also feels like a humble beginning of something. it's not corporate and not industrial. it's small, fragile and surprisingly personal. all those names and addresses from around the world piled at our desk.

Dear people,
Recently we’ve read a post by Kim Powers, Director of Experience at IDEO, one of our favourite companies in the world, where she describes five important points when starting a business and one of them was “Everything will go wrong”. It made us giggle nervously, which was a good thing, because not everything went wrong during our process but yes, there usually are stupid little things that slow us down that were almost impossible to predict.

Looks like we get to make some bags! We're so thankful & thrilled that Stiglo’s not only funded, but funded with a much larger production run than our initial goal. Thanks to you guys! Now the fun begins, and we’re so happy you’re on board to join us on the journey. By now, you’ve probably seen your payment go through, and a few of you have been asking...
What’s next: When, Where, and How do I pick my art? Around July 20th we’ll be emailing out a survey through Kickstarter, that goes to all of our backers. This will provide a link where you can select your designs, tell us your shipping address (and you’ll be able to add on additional Stiglo items too, if you like.)

updates.update_userinfo: Dressing up for that campaign closing party - get your Stiglo and join in!
updates.update_content:
With less than 40 hours to go and so many backers, Stiglo is a fantastic success already. Thank you! We are truly humbled by your support.
We can't wait to see you wearing your brand new Stiglo. 
Less than two days left people. In case you're one of the happy new owners of a Stiglo pet already, please spread the word to that friendly neighbour, secret crush, or that art gallery down the street... share with them your foresight and sense of style - it's not like anyone can be a trailblazer.

updates.update_userinfo: It’s the final countdown and we’re feelin’ AAAAARRRRTY!
updates.update_content:
You’re probably starting to think about the art you’ll chose for your bags. (we think about it constantly, so it’s not surprising.) Here’s some fun facts about a few of our contributing artists in the kickstarter collection:
The Alien has nine different collaborating artists from five countries. One of which is our very own Masha Avramović– a wildly talented animator, illustrator and street artist with murals across Belgrade and Spain. She’s illustrated children’s books, magazines, short story collections and a recent campaign helping refugees understand their rights.

updates.update_userinfo: Is it hawt in here, or did we just nail our first goal?
Update #2: It’s time to take it up a notch.
updates.update_content: In just under a week, we’ve been featured on Gadget Flow and Trendhunter. AND we’re nearly 80% to our goal. This is fantastic, because it means we’re about to start marching towards our stretch goal, which would allow us to add some incredible art from Katerina Dubovik and Sheng Chen, Ultimately want to offer you guys as many inspiring art options as possible when we’re greenlit. With your help the sky’s the limit.

campaign.story:
Gamebook is a hybrid, both an interactive book and a collection of board games.
Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich gaming heritage that represents human history, our intelligence, wit, strategy and appetite for fun, play and socialising - all gathered in one uniquely designed interactive book, for you to see, to read and most importantly - to play. 
Unlike most board games, Gamebook does not come in a box. Our quest was to think outside the box, pushing boundaries away from both traditional board game packaging and traditional book design. We aim to create a highly unique collection of board games for an international audience using high-quality design and production standards.
Gamebook is not like most books—it’s interactive. People have been playing games for all of recorded history, and there is evidence to indicate we played them before recorded history, too. We believe that games have always been an important tool for human social interaction, and Gamebook is designed to encourage this. Each game included in the Gamebook has multiple variations requiring different strategies and approaches, making each game yours to play and explore in your own unique way.
Gamebook is a collection of ancient abstract strategy board games: Surakarta, Tablut, Pachisi, Alquerque, Mu Torere, Senet, Nine Men’s Morris and Stern-halma.
We have searched the rich history of board games for untold stories. Gamebook contains eight abstract strategy board games, carefully selected from the rich world gaming heritage. Gamebook encompasses history, theory and practice of selected board games.
Assemble four boards of the Gamebook to create a new board game specially designed and developed for this edition!
Who is Gamebook for?
Gamebook contains board games ranging from two to six players. The board games were chosen based on their difficulty, from basic board games to ones requiring more complex strategies. Gamebook is appropriate for many different ages, so don't worry about who you invite to game night! :)
On the left side Hana and on the right side Ema Jesih are playing board game Alquerque.
Aesthetics and Design
All selected games are re-designed to a unified graphic language, built of basic geometrical forms by a limited range of colours. Each game has been refined to include only the essential elements necessary for gameplay, and each game board is treated as abstract art based on the textures of different drawing materials.
Magic Binding
Gamebook features two innovative designs - the box for game pieces is also the book's backbone that holds the pages together with simple and very effective magnetic binding. Every page is simply plucked out when you want to play, and put back in; you can arrange the book as you like.
Figures, sticks and a dice
Gamebook includes everything you need to start playing any of the board games. The backbone of the book contains a concealed department for all small figures, six two-sided sticks and a dice. Before the invention of dice, most board games were played with sticks, stones or cowrie shells. The flat side of the stick is the “heads up” side. Different combinations give different scores, giving a totally different dynamic to certain games.
Booklet of History and Rules
Where did board games come from? How did our ancestors play board games? Which abstract strategy board games concepts have spread around the world? The answers to these questions can be found in the booklet of History & Rules. The booklet is included on the back page of the book. You can pluck it out and read it separately so it won’t disturb the game flow of the game you're playing.
Rewards
Stretch goals
Gamebook trilogy
Research about board games has revealed a whole new world. The history of board games is full of mysteries, myths and secrets. We have created a collection of forgotten board game classics. These games are the foundation of so many modern board games. We have chosen eight board games for the first edition of Gamebook, but we would love to continue our investigation and search for lost board games around the world. There are so many more games to find, explore, study and publish. We want to make a Gamebook collection — possibly a Gamebook trilogy.
Hibird Books
Our goal is to establish our own publish company called Hibird Books. Our vision is to publish extraordinary books and to connect unseen combinations of media and materials. Hibird Books main interests are special editions, interactive books, book-objects and artist’s books. Help us bring our Gamebook project to life and many more unusual books will follow. Only time will tell where the path will end. Join us! Back us up. :)
Book Specification
Book dimensions: 32 x 28 x 2,2 cm (12.6"x11"x0.86") 
Game boards dimensions: 28 x 28 cm (11"x11") 
Weight: 1,2 kg (2.64 Ibs)
Making Gamebook prototypes
PLAY

Gamebook is mostly handcrafted. We have made several prototypes to find the best materials and a suitable shape for the book. Almost the entire book is made using recycled materials. The core of the pages and box are cardboard, and we used recycled paper for the pages and for the History & Rules booklet. The figures and dice are made of wood. The rest is a secret! If you are interested in the story of Gamebook’s creation, especially the making of Gamebook prototypes you can follow us (Hibird Books) on Instagram or Facebook.
People behind the project 
 Founders:
Hana Jesih (founder of Gamebook) is a book designer & illustrator who loves to make mind-maps, travel and is taller than Peter. You can see her other book design projects on her website or you can take a look at her gallery space on her Instagram page.
Peter Plantan (cofounder of Gamebook) is an architect who hates and loves everything at the same time and is a fan of Anthony Bourdain. You can get to know his world view on his Instagram page.
Video Credits:
Nejc Gazvoda is a film director and writer. He was in charge of the script and directing the video. He wanted to use slider in the video, we made his wish come true.
Marko Pirc takes credit for photography and shooting the presentation video. His favourite sandwich is chips with sausage and chips on the top.
Voice over: Michael Manske
Song: "Jadranje", from the original soundtrack for the film "Pot v raj" composed by Andi Koglot and Laren Polic Zdravič.
Special thanks to NEJC GAZVODA, friend no.1. Big thanks to STAŠ STANKOVIČ and MARKO PIRC from LUMULABS for all advices. They also let us work on the presentation in their office and lent us their equipment and gadgets. MARUŠA HREN for all her tips and help with bookbinding, MILENA JAKOVLJEVIČ from MEDIODROM for tips in mediamarketing, JURE TURK for IT support, NIKO KLANŠEK for business support, GREGA PLANTAN for legal advice, SAMO KRALJ for producing wooden playing sticks, IVO VESELIČ for his own versions of texts and our FAMILY for moral support and food. Thanks also to all other friends who helped us in any kind of way. ;)
Timetable
We have spent the last year researching board game history and designing and testing our Gamebook. All aspects of our designs have been thoroughly considered at each stage of the product creation process, from concept design, materials and technical aspects to numerous prototypes. It’s been a wonderful journey, and now we’re almost ready for the manufacturing stage. Only with the help of Kickstarter and, most importantly, our backers will we finally be able to bring our Gamebook project to life. If you know any friends, family, colleagues or random strangers who may be interested in our project, please help us spread the word! You can expect to receive your order by November 2018.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
During the process of making the Gamebook prototypes, we collaborated with different print shops and book manufacturers. On a technical level, the pages and binding, even though they are innovative, shouldn't present any major manufacturing difficulties. The final look and materials may change a little bit in the production process, but only to improve the durability and sustainability of the product. The main task will be to manufacture a box for figures and dice that satisfies the level of craftsmanship we stand for. Considering all the facts, we believe that everything is possible if you stand by your goals and believe in your product. We believe in ours. We will try to keep the process as simple as possible. Support our project, and in return we'll send you your own edition of Gamebook. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to post them in the comment or FAQ sections below.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

If this ends up being the case here, I highly recommend ensuring that there is clear communication... I may not speak for everyone here, but I am pledging to support you...not the time-table!
@Hana Jesih I took a photo of the game. The long 4 or 6 sided dice are interesting! Posted to Flickr here - https://flic.kr/p/281xNXN
Hi! What’s the difference between the “early bird” and the “faster than early bird” first edition game books? They both deliver in November, and the “faster than” version is $4 more.

I was visiting the Museum of Fine Arts Houston today and at the "Peacock of the Desert" exhibit they had a Chaupar game set with long dice and pawns from Western India, late 19th century. Made me think about this project. :)
I am a big fan of Minimalism arts and this book is just what I love ! Simple geometry, simple props, simple color, simple rules...
Like said Greatlitch : beautiful book + boardgame = yeahhhhhhhh (with just 8 h because ∞ will took some time)
Actually, the book itself is a piece of art !
I really like how the book is presented! The book itself looks awesome! I hope things work out well for you guys ;3
This is what Kickstarter is about. Good job! Thanks!
Backing immediately and fingers crossed for nines mens morris. Love that game!
I love book arts and I love Boardgame so there is no reason not to back this project !
I was always under the impression that customs and shipping can be a big hassle with strong magnets involved. I tried to ship a fridge magnet into the EU one time, and the USPS wouldn't let me - oy!

campaign.story:
It's about this one of a kind computer footrest. We'd love to invite every creative computer user to STEP ON IT. 
The usage of ActiveFootrest could not be easier - just move your feet to reach the four foot switches for the tasks you use the most often, like scrolling a page up and down. It is that easy.
Why you need one
Sitting too long in front of a computer? We know, everyone is tempted to slouch, or to cross their legs while sitting. Doing this day in day out is not healthy.
However, it would all be different if we could use our legs to interact with a computer.
Two years ago, we decided to make the best ergonomic, comfortable and useful footrest we possibly can. With a Bluetooth connection to a computer to make it future proof and to avoid having more cables under the desk.
A surprisingly new way to use your feet while working
Now here it is. An innovative computer footrest that will assist you to sit comfortably in a neutral position, and will encourage you to use your leg muscles while you sit. So how about hands-free scrolling a page up and down while reading the news and enjoying a cup of coffee?
You can remap the foot-keys to whatever you like. Imagine having shortcuts like Undo, Print, Copy, Paste, Run, alt/TAB, etc. at your feet. If you keep reading, we believe that you will soon find plenty of creative ideas to use this awesome device. We have interviewed writers, designers, analysts, gamers, architects, engineers, musicians, programmers .. and they we all very enthusiastic and quite eager to get their feet on it.
Keep moving! Use your legs to boost your productivity and improve blood circulation. Our ActiveFootrest can be a better alternative to a standing desk.
ActiveFootrest will instantly improve your sitting posture, while the movement of your legs will improve blood circulation. By elevating the feet, it takes stress off the upper legs during extended operating periods.
It takes a few minutes - not days - to get used to it! "I'm not giving it back!" was the usual response from our early test users.
Hands-free reading? No problem.
Give some credit to your legs and veins. By moving your feet just a bit, which is exactly what you should be doing often while sitting, you can easily reach the four foot-switches for the tasks that you use often. 
Why not use our legs to interact with a computer?
Invest in your health and boost your productivity. With ActiveFootrest, you will feel better and be more efficient at the same time. You won’t need to worry about your sitting posture, and your legs will stay active while sitting.  Using it is so easy and a great fun, too.
Customise it and be creative
The default operation works great. It is the UP and DOWN navigation with the outer switches, and HOME and END keys with the inner ones. This relaxes your wrists considerably and saves you a lot of time. Just think about how fast you can select from the list of possible values in those Completion mode drop down lists as you program. Another reason for choosing the common navigation commands for default behaviour is clear - there's no harm if you just fidget and stomp on the switches unintentionally. 
But hey, you can be creative, the ActiveFootrest is fully adjustable. Use it for any shortcut keystroke combination you use often, like UNDO, COPY, PASTE etc. Modifier keys are supported for advanced settings.
Define any shortcut you need. Simple or advanced key remapping is supported.
ActiveFootrest comes in three leg colors
Modern office footrest reinvented
Take a break
We propose a great leg exercise for taking breaks during a workday. Play our daily one-minute-challenge game to relax, get your blood circulation going and train your feet reflexes. You will be able set the daily reminder to alert you when it is time for a break. 
Design and Build Quality
We have succeeded in solving the problem of ergonomic feet positioning. This led to a design that is a joy to use. We decided to use only the best quiet mechanical foots switches, solid wood and best materials throughout the design. 
Natural solid beechwood and thick natural American walnut veneer were selected and pressed together for best comfort and exquisite looks. We are proud to share with you this unique blend of design with modern craftsmanship.
The upper wood surface is CNC milled to give it a unique 3D pattern. It is then hand sanded and varnished. Wait until you get your reward to appreciate just how good it feels to rest your feet on this thing. 
Natural beechwood and American walnut for best comfort. Robust foot switches are borrowed from guitar effects-pedals.
Smaller buttons won our functional testing. They allow for minimum foot movements to reach the switches. This ensures fast response and no unnecessary strain on your knees.
Detailed Specifications
W: 500 mm (19.7 inch)   D: 280 mm (11.0 inch)   H: 50 mm (1.97 inch)   Weight: 3.2 kg (7.05 pounds)
4 mechanical quiet momentary foot switches
Bluetooth 4.0 technology
Battery: 2 x AA (LR6)
Supported computers and operating systems: Windows and macOS. Computer with a Bluetooth receiver or USB Bluetooth adapter.
Default key mapping (no drivers needed): outer foot switches - arrow up, arrow down / inner switches - Home, End
Key remapping software: included for Windows; supports free third-party key remapping apps for macOS
Foot support and housing for electronics: American walnut veneer pressed to both sides of a 18mm thick plate of solid beech wood. Hand oiling and varnishing combination to preserve the wood's organic characteristics
Metal legs: Cut by a computer guided plasma cutter. Powder painted. Rubber grips to protect flooring
Shipping Plan
We have been working on the ActiveFootrest project for two years now. The production prototypes work great and the manufacturers are standing by for production of all necessary parts. Hand finishing, testing and assembly will be done by us.
Sašo and Andrej in the lab. We are very excited to bring you the most unusual and yet the most useful computer footrest.

support.title: Shoutout on Social Media
support.descp: We'll humble-brag for you by thanking you on our social media pages for supporting technology by artists. That's 31,000 followers on Facebook and over 25,000 followers on Twitter who will know you care about us!

support.title: Opening Party There-In-Spirit
support.descp: Can't make our opening event? You can still be a part of it! Enjoy exclusive access to our livestream of the Opening Party and be there in spirit. November 30th, 8pm onward.

support.title: Digital Art to your Inbox
support.descp:
Have digital artworks by Eyebeam alums sent directly to your email.
Choose one from works by:
-Colin Self
-Addie Wagenknecht
-Joshue Ott
-Kenneth Kirschner
-Morehshin Allahyari
-Mattia Casalegno
-Mushon Zer-Aviv
-Marina Zurkow
See image options in text story. We'll send you a survey after the campaign ends for you to select your artwork. Respond promptly as certain works are limited supply.

support.title: Event Supporter
support.descp: Express invitations and entry to our public events in our new space for one year. You'll also receive a ticket to our Opening Party on November 30th including tote filled with goodies.

support.title: Visit our Studios
support.descp:
Invitation to meet some of our residents or an Eyebeam staff member (your choice). Your visit will include snacks and can be done over Skype or in person at our new space. Studio visits will happen in 2018.
You'll also receive a ticket to our Opening Party on November 30th.

support.title: Tour the Space
support.descp:
Want to know everything about Eyebeam? You and three guests are invited to a personalized behind-the-scenes tour of our new space and some time with our artists. Tours will happen in 2018.
You'll also receive a ticket to our Opening Party on November 30th. Opening Party includes artworks curated by Eyebeam alums, MSHR, and free refreshments the whole night through.

support.title: Resident for an Evening
support.descp:
Stop Work! is a monthly gathering for Eyebeam residents to present work in progress for testing and feedback in a semi-private critique. You're invited to present on your own work and get feedback from Eyebeam residents, alumni and networks. Critique will be for one hour and happen in 2018.
You'll also receive a ticket to our Opening Party on November 30th.

support.title: Get Recognized
support.descp: As a major supporter your name will be added to our Eyebeam donor page. You'll also receive VIP entry to our Opening Party. If you can't make it you can still be there in spirit through our exclusive livestream and we'll publicly acknowledge your support at the party. November 30th.

support.title: Name on a 'Beam
support.descp: You'll have the opportunity to sign your name on our physical Eyebeam Supporter Beam in the new space at our Opening Party. Your name will also live on our Eyebeam donor page and you'll get to enjoy VIP privileges to the Opening Party. November 30th.

support.title: Program Partner
support.descp: You can be one of the Founding Partners for our events in the new space for 2018, you could sponsor all resident events for a year, or our summer Digital Day Camp education program. You'll be recognized on all publications and on our website as a Partner for our programs. You'll also receive VIP entry to our Opening Party. If you can't make it you can still be there in spirit through our exclusive livestream and we'll publicly acknowledge your support at the party. November 30th.

support.title: Opening Party Ticket
support.descp: Come join us in celebrating our new home! Ticket to our Opening Party includes artworks curated by Eyebeam alums, MSHR, and free refreshments the whole night through. November 30th, 8pm onward.

support.title: Opening Party + Swag
support.descp: Come join us in celebrating our new home! Ticket to our Opening Party includes artworks curated by Eyebeam alums, MSHR, and free refreshments the whole night through. Additionally you'll receive an Eyebeam tote bag with goodies inside when you arrive. November 30th, 8pm onward.

campaign.story:
A PROBLEM
Having breakfast with your family or preparing pancakes party with your friends. Most of the time the Nutella, jams and other spreads are found in the middle of the table. In this case, you can organize a ‘’table’’ in several ways.
Everyone has his own knife
The downside of using one knife is that spreads tend to become mixed. Nobody wants to see a strawberry jam in the Nutella.
spread mixing is great, but not in a jar
Every spread has its own knife
If the knife is left in the spread, it usually sinks in and the handle gets dirty and sticky. You could use extra plates, but that usually clutters the table and then you can’t pass the spread in one go.
we all know how this story ends
THE SOLUTION - SPOONELLA
In order to tackle inconvenience at the breakfast table, or during any other meal, I have developed a simple and cost effective solution. The Spoonella ring is a streamline utensil holder that can also “clean” the knife afterwards.
Spoonella - simple and cost efficient solution
HOW TO USE IT?
After buying Nutella simply unscrew the original cap and screw the Spoonella lid on. The user has to attach Spoonella only once. When the jar is empty, the Spoonella can be washed in the dishwasher and is ready for the next jar.
Spoonella is a two-part cover. When you want to use it, just unscrew the upper cap.
two-part
After spreading the Nutella on your bread, pancakes or any other food just put the knife in to designed attachment of the cover.
no more dirty hands
The knife will rest there until you or your buddy needs it again. When needed you need to pull it upwards from the attachment.
After finished with spreading, you simply pull the knife from attachment and screw back the top lid.
Oh wait, what about those who uses spoon for spreading? Just unscrew the whole two-part lid together like the original one.
spoon me
This is why Spoonella is so great. It DOES NOT take almost anything from original. Size is the same, appearance is the same, material is the same (PP), only weight is a little higher (25 grams total).
it's like an original with extra functionality
Spoonella is suited for all Nutella variants from 650g – 1000g jars (26,5 Oz - 35,3 Oz).
BUT WHY PARTLY?!
so you can still lick it
BENEFITS
No more chocolate spread on knife’s handle
No more chocolate mess where you put off the knife
No more knife sinking into spread
No more spread mixing in the jar
No more washing more than one knife per jar
And you get a new experience with 50 years old Nutella!
MY STORY
ups and downs
MY PLAN
I hope you will make the right decision
3D - MODEL
           IMPORTANT CLAIM
Spoonella shown in this campaign is fully functional prototype which was printed on a 3D printer
Nutella® is a trademark of Ferrero Group company which is trademark of them self
In case you receive a defective piece, please contact me. I will be happy to figure out the problems. If Return Material Authorization is granted, you can send the defective piece back and you will receive a new piece
Spoonella is a prototype, changes can be applied. The final appearance will be revealed at least before shipping
CONTACT ME
email: andraz.flis@gmail.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/Spoonella
Instagram: www.instagram.com/andrazflis
FOLLOW PROGRESS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Time is important and it’s also a risk. To minimize the risk, we are cooperating with an experienced contract manufacturer who specializes in mass production. We are confident all our early bird backers will receive rewards on given time. There might be uncertainty in customs and logistics in certain countries. While we do not expect any changes in delivery dates, that possibility does exist. If it happens, we will keep backers informed and try our best to solve the problem.

The product can become useless after some time of usage. The exact life time of a product cannot be given. We recommend backers to choose pack of at least two Sponellas.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Gotoky in The News ... Look down for articles
Poor mobile network coverage in secluded and remote areas, high costs of communication when traveling, breakdowns of the existing mobile networks in the cases of manmade or natural disasters; these are just a few of the challenges that conventional mobile networks face all the time. In such situations the communication is crucial but impossible. 
Our personal experience with this problem drove us to develop our:
GOTOKY - World’s most advanced secure 100% off-grid communication device that enables smartphones, iOS and Android, to operate and create Mesh Network in areas where service is either nonexistent, unstable or excessively expensive.  
Gotoky's Features
When Gotoky is paired with a smartphone you can securely Talk (1-to-1 and group), send Texts (1-to-1 and group), activate the “Emergency” Location Beacon if in distress, use Navigation, Direction and distance to other Gotoky(s), share GPS locations with other Gotoky users on the detailed off-line topographic maps, as well use Real time Tracking, Route recording, creating events, Location Pinging etc. With Gotoky you can also create your own off-grid network.
The custom-designed mobile application for smartphone wraps up all the complexity Gotoky offers in an simple, easy-to-use and beautiful to look user experience. All data transfer is highly end-to end encrypted.
Chats -Voice communication and Text Messaging combined in a feature Chats
By using the Chats mobile application, you can send or receive Voice recordings, Text messages and you can even send Event locations with Points of Interest. 
All Voice recordings are immediately streamed. In the case that your Voice recording has been missed your Voice message can be played again as many times as you like.
In some cases when the frequency band is too congested our smart protocols wait for a free window and send Voice messages with hardly any noticeable delay. This is not an issue with Text messages and location data, as these are much smaller packages of data.
With Gotoky you can have private 1-to-1 or Group Chats with anyone from your Gotoky’s app Contact list. For Group Chats just create a Group and add people contacts  to the Group. You can even start communication from the navigation screen.
All chats and data transfers are private and secured, meaning whatever you say or send can be heard or read only by your selected counterpart.
Gotoky enables up to 40 private 1-to-1 Voice Chats and more than 300 private Text Chats at the same time.
"Emergency"Location Beacon Feature
The “Emergency” Location Beacon is a “just-in-case” feature - when activated your call for help is being automatically and repeatedly broadcasted and relayed over the Gotoky network - so each Gotoky, including those beyond your range, will receive your distress call.
User with activated "Emergency" Location Beacon visible on the map, with all his data
When other Gotokys receive the “Emergency” Location Beacon a big full-screen orange alert window appears to notify Gotoky users that someone is in distress. By clicking on the distressed person's information Gotoky users can easily check the location of the person or even start a conversation.
This particular feature can be activated by Gotoky itself- if the smartphone’s battery is being empty or even when the smartphone is broken - more on this in the section below “Gotoky can work without smartphone”.
Navigation Feature
The Gotoky mobile app provides very easy to use and informative Navigation. Each Gotoky around you regularly sends its own GPS location to other Gotokys, so all Gotokys in the area know of each other even if you don’t know them personally.  GPS location broadcasting can be also manually turned off, if the user doesn't want to be visible or tracked.
You can view all Gotokys around you on the FREE off-line preloaded maps. When you are somewhere off-grid in the wild it is good to know that somebody is nearby even if you can’t see them.
Route recording: start and end points, naming the route, adding points of interest
The Gotoky Navigation app also comes also with a Route recording feature. You can easily record all your movements from start to finish. And it’s easy to add some notes to the route as well. 
Gotoky acts as an autonomous relay device
Used as an autonomous relay device: Create your own mesh network or double your communication range. 
Activation of “Emergency” Location Beacon: Just press the button, even in the case that your phone is out of the battery. The device stores the last GPS location received from your smartphone (the device itself doesn't have a dedicated GPS module).
PLAY

It can autonomously receive and store up to 1000 text messages without being connected to your smartphone.
With the Gotoky Relay function you can create a Mesh Network and double the range of your communication: Gotoky automatically and securely relays your Text Messages over other Gotokys in your area - your range can be extended beyond point-to-point, and you can make your own network. 
PLAY

To ensure that your message really gets to your friends who are usually moving we have developed very smart protocol with intelligent algorithms which double-check network delivering potential. 
We are also working hard to provide this feature for Voice Chats. 
Gotoky connects to your iOS or Android Smartphone wirelessly via Bluetooth-LE (Low Energy, 4.2). The device must be within an 8m or 25ft range of the smartphone. When connected, use the installed mobile app to communicate with other Gotoky users.
PLAY

Gotoky works over a licence-free standard UHF frequency band and the range is limited by the law of the country you are operating in.
It is a dual band device meaning that it works in the EU regulated frequency band of 868 MHz and on US regulated frequency band 915 MHz. 
Range and extended range values
The range really depends on number of obstacles around you - the more the obstacles - less of the range. The device will auto-tune itself to the appropriate frequency band and power output based on location where it’s being used.
All data is end-to-end encrypted and its technology patent pending. 
Our solution is CE certified, in accordance with European legislation; FCC certification is in process.
                                                           NATURAL DISASTER
Gotoky is a perfect “just in case device” if /when natural disaster strikes, which can often leave cell services crippled and unreliable for days, weeks.
 OUTDOOR ADVENTURES
Skiers, campers, trekkers, climbers, hikers and other nature enthusiasts are now able to connect and feel safe in places where they used to be completely isolated.
 TRAVELERS
Gotoky can be extremely useful for travelers - being abroad and wanting to communicate for free rather than paying exorbitant roaming charges.
FUNCTIONAL BUSINESS TOOL
Gotoky is also useful as a functional business tool for certain occupations where workers need to stay in constant group communication in remote working environments.
Gotoky is a dual band device; It is powered by long lasting battery of 72 hours of usage, charged over micro USB port.
0.5 W AND 1 WATT OUTPUT POWER 
INTERNAL MEMORY - Gotoky can store up to 1000 messages without being connected to your smartphone 
BLUETOOTH LE 4.2 - Gotoky connects to your smartphone over Low Energy Bluetooth 
COMPATIBLE with iOS and Android devices
LED LIGHT RING as an indicator
WATER AND DUST RESISTANCE - Gotoky is built with IP56 water and dust resistance 
SAFE COMMUNICATION - Gotoky has end-to-end encryption 
DUAL BAND Gotoky works on both 868 MHz and 915 MHz frequencies
INTEGRATED ANTENNA - The antenna is integrated into the Gotoky, Break-proof design
MICRO-USB CONNECTOR - Charge Gotoky over the most popular USB connector
HIGH VOLUME BATTERY - Rechargeable 2500 mAh battery. Charged over micro-USB. Battery can last up to 72 hours
DOUBLE YOUR RANGE - Gotoky can work autonomously to double your communication range
DIMENSIONS - 120x46x16 mm | 4.72x1.81x0.63 in  
WEIGHT - 90 g | 3.17 oz
SILICONE STRAP in 3 different colours: Red, Turquoise and Lime
Light ring signalisation
The design concept is based on the idea of a wave (radio) captured by a product Gotoky. 
The front surface represents the wave as a communication element - it is a shining surface; a clear, pure drop of a wave which creates more waves gathered around one circled form (the button), symbolising the touch of a human finger as the touch of communication.
The matte vessel of the surrounding and back surface of Gotoky signifies the strong base of the product: its quality, stability and perfection; its strength as a tool for off-grid communication.  
Gotoky is a pocket-sized device, both waterproof and dust-resistant.
IP56 water and dust resistance
Silicone strap comes in three colours: Red, Turquoise and Lime.
It has a special loop so that it can be hung from a belt, a bag or even somewhere on a tree or other object in order to get a better signal.
It can be hung
It comes in a box of 2 Gotokys (Red and Turquoise strap ) and in a box of 1 (Lime strap).
In a box of 2 Gotokys, added 2 charging cables. In a box of 1 Gotoky, one charging cable. + 1 year warranty
The box
MEDIA MARKT INNOVATIE LAB
Gotoky is presented for showcasing this September in Media Markt (Europe’s largest retailer for consumer electronics) store in Eindhoven, Netherlands and in October in Wilrijk, Belgium within their Innovative Lab.
3 variation of Gotoky T-shirts you can choose from
 CHILLY’S BOTTLES
The Chilly’s Bottle is a revolutionary reusable bottle that can keep your water ice cold for up to 24 hours and your tea hot for up to 12 hours. 
OFF IS THE NEW ON Gotoky bottle
Collection of 15 beautiful Gotoky Graphics for smartphone
Gotoky Facebook page
Gotoky Instagram page
Gotoky Kickstarter project Share
Gotoky Kickstarter project Share
Published in Yahoo News. Click and read more ...
Published in Digital Trends. Click and read more ...
Published on NBC12. Click and read more ...
Published in Geeky Gadgets. Click and read more ...
Our story begins with total-mountain-lover Denis’s personal experience (Denis - CEO) of getting hurt while hiking one winter day in the Alps. Although he was of course carrying his smartphone – compulsory equipment when up in the mountains - he suddenly found himself in serious trouble when he realized that his smartphone had no signal, and he couldn’t call or reach anyone. Ultimately, the story has a doubly happy ending: Denis was eventually rescued by random passers-by, and a great idea was born.
Soon after Katja (CMO and Sales) and Bostjan (Main Hardware Engineer) joined and created Gotoky.
Over the past two years our team of excellent engineers, designers and marketing experts has been working nonstop to develop revolutionary technology which will improve communication capabilities. 
Our work has been focused on the HW and SW upgrades needed for a stable, robust, digital, mesh-capable device; on network capacity with encrypted communication; and making the most of the available radio frequency spectrum. 
Our mission doesn't stop with this device: we would love to in a huge range of real-life scenarios where constant communication is an essential or even life- saving feature create even more improved systems independent from existing large ones and it is affordable for anyone.
We are truly a kick-ass team: In 2015 we were selected to be in the elite hardware accelerator HighTech XL in Eindhoven Netherlands, where we were recognised as the most promising startup of a generation. We were Finalists of the Central European Startup award 2016 and a year later recognised as one of the top 100 startups of Central Europe.
Main Team Gotoky

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
first off, in this unprecedented pandemic period, we do hope that you and your loved ones are well.
Due to all business instability and slower working process also Gotoky has faced some of the challenges; however, we have managed to develop hardware prototype, new mobile application, and our own off-line map server happily being totally independent from other maps providers.

Dear Backers,
It’s been awhile since we post any news. The reason is that we have been quite busy adjusting timelines and preparing documents for new investments.
Just yesterday we had last meeting to confirm final timeline and I’m happy to announce that we’ll go in production in the beginning of November this year.

Dear Backers,
We are sorry for this communication gap from our side, but we have been working hard to bring you some good news about Gotoky. And I must say we succeeded :) We have good news for you - Gotoky goes on! Gotoky is back! Gotosk is alive again!
After a long time of status quo we finally got an agreement from all (new) partners to bring Gotoky to market and therefore to you. This kind of technology is demanding to develop and requires a lot of funds.

Hi everybody, 
happy to announce some cool updates: 
Hardware 
We have reached our pre-production process milestone - we made more than 10 fully functioning prototypes with a carefully 3D printed casing with precise measures which will be used as a good basis for making the mold for plastic injection which will be used for the manufacture of casings.

Hi guys!
Our campaign is already over, and we again thank you for all amazing support and trust in us!
We have already two really great updates:
Our RF communication protocol for FCC certification is ready for testing. Before giving Gotoky to the certification process we need to do plenty of tests to be 100% sure to meet all the requirements of the legislation which is hoping over 64 channels and not to sit on each channel more than 400 ms. For now, test are going ok. We’ll give you more test results with next update.

It should be obvious where I am going with this. I can buy a UHF radio anywhere, and I could care less about location data. campaign.story:
Do you feel overwhelmed by work and need to find your balance?
Good news - we have the perfect solution:
In front of you is the Focus Journal – a tool designed to make your work more efficient, productive and feel better. It’s a task journal created on the premise that planning something shouldn't take longer than actually doing it. It helps you make the most out of your work hours while balancing productivity and well-being. It is not meant to be used in place of your digital calendars or other digital tools, but instead as a complement to them.
 Featured In
Increasing Productivity
The Focus Journal helps you define daily and long term goals by dividing them into manageable tasks. This gives structure to your day and a good overview of the work that needs to be done. Tasks can be prioritized, timed and tracked for progress. Having a clear structure means being more organized and efficient.
To keep your brain sharp and focused the Focus Journal has brain activities that were approved by DynamicBrain.
Minimal Design
The Focus Journal is a decluttered daily journal and was designed according to the premise of minimalism. This means the layout is very clean and only has graphic elements that are really needed. It also doesn’t impose rigid systems, methods or frames of thought. Its structure allows you to plan and execute according to your own way of thinking.
The layout of the "journal pages"with descriptions of each section
The pages are not dated which allows you to use the journal whenever. There is also a lot of free space for notes and sketches.
Balancing Well-being and Work
Work should feel good and gratifying. This is why fun and well-being tasks are included in the Focus Journal. Their purpose is to help you plan for fun breaks or healthy activities while working. The summary at the end of each day helps you reflect and evaluate the day’s work.
Testimonials
"I like how it doesn't force you to plan more than you need to." – Nadya Pecherskaya, Nutritionist and Founder of EHF Vancouver
"I'd really recommend it to people in the creative fields because you have your tasks on one side but on the other side you have room for doodling your ideas and it gives you the freedom to play, love that!" – Steven Sal Debus, Product Designer 
"It's a great integration of work, well-being, and fun, all in one journal." –Faris Khalifeh, Quiet Leadership Coach
How to use it
The design elements and layout of the journal are a result of researching and testing. They act as guides for your thought process while giving you the freedom to use the planner in a way that fits your way of thinking and planning.
Checkpoints - Use these pages to set and keep track of your monthly goals or projects.
Layout - The daily journal pages consist of two pages side by side with goals and tasks on the left and a dotted notes page on the right for all your ideas and sketches. 
Dates - The journal is undated. A blank line lets you write down the date and place any way you want.
Goals/Priorities - Write down daily goals or priorities to keep your focus on the bigger picture.
Tasks - Break down your goals/priorities into tasks to create a clear path to achieve or work on them.
Task line - Prioritize tasks and set deadlines by using the underscore in front of the split circle.
Split circle - This is a visual clue to track your progress. If the task is not finished or has to be continued at a later time, fill out one half. When it is completed, fill out the whole circle.
Well-being and Fun tasks - A set of tasks you set yourself to balance work. If you need inspiration, check the back of the journal.
Notes - Use the dotted notes pages however you see fit. Write down phone numbers, sketch airplanes, calculate revenue or even make it your diary. In addition to the notes section on the daily pages, we will be including extra notes pages at the end of the journal. 
Summary - Reflect on your day and fill out the circles. With time, you’ll be able to see trends and better understand how to balance productivity and well-being.
Brain exercises - Designed to keep your brain sharp and give you a break from the daily routine.
Design Features
When we were designing the journal we wanted it to be portable, light, durable and functional. Here are the design features of the Focus Journal. (Some of them are not implemented in the prototype shown on this page. It's because it was absurdly expensive to have them for the run of ten copies we've made to test the journal.)
Elastic - to prevent the journal from opening in your bag.
Back Pocket - to keep stuff you need at hand.
Soft Covers - to make the journal light and portable.
Rounded Edges - to prevent the edges from folding.
Time Span Label on the spine - to keep track of your past work.
Two Colours - to match your style.
Lay Flat Binding - The prototypes seen in these pictures have a book binding. However, the Focus Journal will have a lay flat binding so you can more easily write in it!  
The Story
The Focus Journal is a product created by L’Atelier Coworking Vancouver where Sabrina and Matej work with multiple freelancers, contract workers and solopreneurs. After observing, researching and experiencing the new realities of work life, they discovered a need for a journal that increases productivity while balancing well-being and fun at the same time.
Sabrina Chammas and Matej Rodela
This product wouldn't be possible without the support from the coworking community at L'Atelier. Members were involved in the design process and their feedback was crucial in making the journal functional and user friendly.
Members of the L'Atelier coworking discussing the Focus Journal after using it for 10 days.
A group of 25 entrepreneurs and freelancers used it for 10 days and gave us their feedback on the layout, graphics, usability and effectiveness of the journal.
We all had pizza.
Helping out the Neighbourhood
Canada is one of the wealthiest countries in the world, and British Columbia is one of the wealthiest Canadian provinces. Surprisingly, every fifth child in BC lives in poverty. At L’Atelier we see this problem every day walking down E Hastings street with a large population of homeless people. This is why we’ve partnered with Covenant House Vancouver - an organization that helps struggling youth. As one of the reward tiers, we’ll be donating a free journal to every youth that is in their “Rights of Passage” program.
Timeline
September 7th: campaign launch
October 7th: Confirm production with printer and review final prototype
November: Receive Focus Journals from the printer and begin shipping process
December: Estimated delivery time
Team
Sabrina Chammas - creator of the Focus Journal, owner of L'Atelier Coworking
Matej Rodela - creator of the Focus Journal, project manager
Olivia Sari Goerlach - photography
Darko Sikman - videography
Alicia Carvalho - graphic design
Iryna Borzilova - talent
Dan Crow - talent
The coworkers at L’Atelier - support, feedback and testing
The song is by Anitek under CC license. 
About L'Atelier Coworking
L’Atelier Vancouver is a coworking and networking hub in the Vancouver neighbourhood of Gastown with a focus on creativity and innovation for entrepreneurs, startups and freelancers. It provides a comfortable and inspiring space for individuals and small businesses to bring to life their unique projects and connect with a community of like-minded, forward thinking creators.
It was voted as one of the best coworking spaces in Canada and Vancouver. 
Featured in 
Partners 
Reach out to us of follow us
For any questions or press inquiries feel free to email us at info@thefocusjournal.co.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have experience leading crowdfunding campaigns and following through to the last reward delivery. For the Focus Journal, we took extra care with choosing the best possible partners to bring this journal to life and into your hands. We’ve decided to go with a well reputed printing shop that will be able to supply high quality materials.

The challenge is to get the orders to the printing shop before the Christmas madness hits production capacities and clutters shipping routes. As soon as we reach our goal, we will order the journals to be printed to get them shipped as soon as possible. The lead time for the print job is 5 to 7 weeks.

A higher number of pledges than anticipated would also be a challenge. It will demand a re-shift of the production schedule and cause a delay in delivering rewards. This means reaching our goal sooner will actually speed things up.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dear backers, today is the last day of our campaign, and we are truly thankful for the community that was built on this Kickstarter. But sadly, we have not achieved our goal, so we are forced to terminate. But you can expect a new Safy campaign in the next months, with a few surprises that will surely enthuse you. We would like to tell you that the Safy team is working on production, which is why we are sure to finish our next campaign on time, so that you can receive your own Safy bag before the summer holidays. The feedback we received received us surprised, yet we made a crucial mistake by neglecting PR. We believe that was our fall. As we move forward on this journey, please join us on our mission, share your thoughts, and stay involved. We'll keep an eye on Kickstarter, and may send an update from time to time. But if you want more frequent updates, as we hope you do, we encourage you to join our mailing list at info@safybag.com. As an added bonus, everyone who has supported our first campaign will receive a 20% discount(cash back) in the next one. 
You can expect the next campaign by the end of January 2018. In the meantime, the Safy team is already working to ensure its success. Let yourself be surprised! If you liked Safy so far, then you will not be let down our second time around. 
 Thank you and until next time! Safy team
Safy is a beautifully designed SAFE BAG for everyday use.
Safy can not only be used at the beach, while travelling, or for any other scenario, but also features multiple levels of protection to provide the owner with peace of mind. You can use it during everyday activities such as going to work, school, errands, etc. It is practically designed so you’ll want to use it wherever you go and at the same time, your valuables will BE SAFE!
               The  SAFY BAG™ is currently patent pending (Utility+Design+Brand)
FEAUTURED ON
                                          Aluminum Frame & Polycarbonate
Safy is extremely lightweight thanks to the injected polycarbonate core, which is reinforced with a laminated aluminum frame. Another distinctive feature of the innovative polycarbonate material is its tremendous flexibility. The bag will yield to pressure, but will immediately return to its original form afterwards. Safy is heat and cold resistant with a temperate range of +160°C to -100°C (+260°F to -150°F), and it can withstand exposure to UV radiation.
3 Digit Combination Lock
As long as you don’t change the code, it is free opening and very quick to access.
If you change only one digit, it is locked.
When you shuffle 2 or 3 digits, it is securely locked.
Durable Cut Resistant Strap
Simple – pull it, lock it and leave it. The secret is a patent-pending durable locking strap, made of cotton and thin steel ropes, which enable you to lock your bag and attach the cut-resistant strap to any fixed object (beach chair, suitcase, fence, etc.). It only requires you to open the bag and press the button for strap release. Then you tie it around a fixed object and lock your Safy!
   Motion Alarm (110db)
When activated, the motion sensor on the inside of the bag triggers an alarm within five seconds of being picked up to notify the owner if their bag is being stolen. To ensure the alarm is always operational, there is a built-in power bank, which always reserves 20 percent of its capacity in order to power itself.
Alarm Button
While carrying the bag, the motion alarm has to be turned off, otherwise it would go off due to motion as we move. Arming or disarming it is as simple as the push of a button.
Fingerprint Module
The biometric fingerprint module can store more than 10 authorized fingerprints. To access this device, your fingerprint is needed for authentication. When you purchase a Safy bag with this module, you will need to register your fingerprints in order to open it. Afterwards, the bag will open when you place your finger on the scanning device. Easy operation – you need to hold the alarm button until you hear a beep, then slowly press your finger to the sensor 5 times, this will in turn register your fingerprint. The first registration must be done with the help of a computer in three easy steps:
Connect the bag to the computer.
Type in the 3-digit code.
Slowly press your finger to the sensor 5 times.
You can always unlock the bag with your computer, by entering the 3-digit code you chose at first registration.
Powerbank
Never run out of battery. Safy has a built-in battery with two USB ports.
Safy model S has 5.000 mAh and can charge your phone for a minimum of two times.
Safy model S+ has 10.000 mAh and can charge your phone for a minimum of four times.
Quick Pockets with RFID Blocking 
Easy to access, allowing you to instantly access your cards and cash. Safy also features a radio-frequency identification (RFID) safe pocket, with RFID blocking technology, which protects the owner from passive skimming of RFID enabled cards or passports.
 What Fits Inside?
The inner dimensions of the Safy Bag are max. L x W x H = 178 mm X 130 mm X 40 mm. Due to the exceptional design curves, the dimensions on the curves are reduced. There is a place for:
Up to 3 Phones max. dimensions L x W x H (6,5 inch/165mm x 4,15 inch/105 mm x 0,5 inch/13mm)
Up to 3 Passports (RFID safe pocket)
Up to 5 Bank Cards (RFID safe pocket)
Money (extra pocket)
Wallet, Watches, Keys, Headphones & More
   Don’t miss out on these special deals! Choose your reward and come a step closer to having your valuables safe.
       Safy is available in 3 different models
    You do not have to worry about your valuables with the Safy bag. It can be used every day, as its exceptional design makes it the perfect bag for any occasion.
   Safy is currently available in two colors: black carbon and snow white.
 If the 400k goal is reached, you will be able to pick your own Safy color.
          Safy was created by Nataša and Andrej Brumec. Nataša has a passion for art, while Andrej has a passion for technology. They both have extensive experience designing innovative products and brands. The idea for Safy was born when they were the unfortunate victims of pickpocketing, a crime all too common around the world. A thief stole their phones while they were at the beach. This of course ruined their vacation, so they decided to create a portable safe.
First Andrej created a portable safe, which can be locked to a beach chair, but soon figured out that if we have nowhere to lock it to, then it is not safe. So, he added the motion sensor and alarm. However, it is still only a featureless box. Nataša then comes forward with a great idea – make it look like bag, so it can be used every day. She goes straight to work, pouring all her passion for art into it and voila! Safy is born. The first Safe and Smart bag for everyday use.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The development of the safy bag is finished. Before us is a challenge to prepare development and production, so that we can start shipping out the first Safy bags. We have a strong plan to manufacture Safy in Slovenia (EU). We have also gained an investor, who will produce Safy electronics for us. It is one of the biggest Slovenian companies for research and development of electronics, which operates in more than 40 countries across the globe.
With additional support, we can guarantee to develop Safy in better than expected, and to send it on time. This is why we set realistic goals for us, so that there are no delays.
We will constantly post advancements in progress. The excitement over Safy, that we have received so far, gives us the needed energy to continue, so believe us when we say, that we will not rest anywhere short of success. Together with your support and our 20 years of experience, we will surely succeed!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
