campaign.story:
Why is this book important?
The story helps children understand separation without feeling guilty and ultimately help them realize that they are loved. They come to understand that they all have their own unique light, regardless of what family they live in.
Divorce and separation is a reality that more and more children are facing. Perhaps they lived thorough it themselves with their own family, or maybe their best friend from kindergarten is dealing with such trials. It's a difficult subject to address at any age, in any culture, especially at the tender young age of childhood. 
So we started this project to help kids all around the world understand the difficult adult word in their own language – through a storybook.

A word from the author: Why I wrote this book...
“Mommy, Daddy, why don’t you two live together anymore?” is a question that we, separated parents, aren’t really fully ready to answer. How can we tell our child, whose dearest wish is for their family to be whole again, that their dream won’t come true? It was a question posed to me by my own 7-year-old daughter.
At the same time, she wanted to explain to her why they could no longer live together. So she started to tell her a story about the Sun Prince and the Moon Fairy. It's a story about two beings, both with their own unique light, a story about a love that sometimes – no matter how much effort is put in – cannot overcome all obstacles, and a story about a love that remains forever – their love for their Little Star, their child.
I didn’t want to tell her all the details of our separation. At the same time, I wanted to explain to her why we could no longer live together. So I started to tell her a story about the Sun Prince and the Moon Fairy. It's a story about two beings, both with their own unique light, a story about a love, that sometimes cannot overcome all the obstacles, and a story about a love that remains forever – love for their Little Star, their child.
 Polona Kisovec, author
 Why we need you backers?   
Our aim is to raise funds for the worldwide release of the accompanying audiobook. The hardcover has already been translated into flowing, readable English, and we would like children all around the planet to be able to hear their bedtime story of acceptance and of love and maybe even read along.
The Book's Message 
This book makes children and their parents understand that each person is unique and wonderful in their own way. Every one of us has our own charm, our own light.
Sometimes two people like each other very much, but it’s better for their inner light and everyone around them that they don’t stay together. This doesn’t make either of them a bad person.
And it definitely doesn’t mean that the separation is the child’s fault or that they should be deprived of love.
Be proud of your flaws because they make you perfect just the way you are. Create your own world in the universe of different worlds – stars that shine with the same light the same as your own. The one thing we have in common is the fact that we are all different.
  About the author  
Polona Kisovec is a businesswoman,  a mother who is devoted with all her heart, the author of the book "Why Don’t Sun Prince and Moon Fairy Live Together?", and the founder of WOUSTAR.COM, a website that encourages people to realize their unique potential.
After a painful divorce and defeat, Polona was able to create victory for herself. She experienced the changes brought on by divorce both as a child and as a parent. This compelled her to write a book for children and adults that explains divorce to a child as no book has so far. 
She also speaks openly about her experiences and her story through WOUSTAR.COM (World Of Uniqueness). 
She wants to help others, no matter their situation, to stay true to themselves, to create balance for themselves and their children, and to enable their children to glow with happiness. 
  Why you should hear about and read this book?
Storytelling can be a rewarding but also a painful process. Every word about the Moon Fairy and Sun Prince was carefully chosen to bring people together, not to widen the cracks in the already existing beginnings of a divide. This divide that can be devastating in the eyes of our children. This book in no way, shape, or form promotes divorce or separation, but acknowledges that sometimes there is no other way. 
This unique storybook was born when the creative process met with words of advice from professionals and was enriched with beautiful illustrations.
Emotional stories can sometimes be difficult for a newly divorced parent to read out loud. Although filled with positive messaging of love, this storybook's heartfelt words might stir up parents' own raw emotions and make their voice shake. This beautiful story can be enjoyed in the form of audiobook while listening to the soothing voice of the professional narrator and later discussed, together with one's child. The audiobook offers a great "on-the-go" solution as well, as it can be played on long road trips, short car rides to school, on portable devices while walking the dog, or even in the privacy of a child's bedroom.
Early reviews on the book are in... and they are overwhelmingly encouraging: 
This book was first released in the author's home country, in the Slovenian language. Its release surpassed every expectation - it was a bestseller and an instant hit! Slovenian kids and parents, as well as members of the professional public, all loved it. But don't just trust our words, read theirs:
Marko Juhant, an education expert:
The most difficult part in the tragedy of a family breakdown is how to explain to children why their parents will no longer live together. A child feels that their family is falling apart but is  unable to understand it rationally. The confusion in their feelings and behavior is therefore inevitable. The story from the book can be really helpful in this confusion because it does not favor either of the parents, but emphasizes the role and the circumstances leading to the parents’ separation. Every child ponders to what extent it is their fault that their parents fought and separated. Children take on so much guilt with no reason! In the story about the Moon Fairy and Sun Prince, the child learns that the Little Star is not responsible for everything that goes wrong. This brings them hope that what is happening in their family is not their fault. The fairytale is the perfect opportunity for children to hear that both parents love them and that they will always be their mom and dad. They can tell the child that they tried their best but that they can no longer live together.
Katja Fortun, social pedagogue and systemic psychotherapy specialist:
The Moon Fairy book is ready to come to life in families that are separating. Separation brings a lot of burden and stress into any family. Parents want to protect their children from the pain and many avoid conversations or make them quick and superficial, simply informing the child of the facts. However, children are very sensitive beings and have a great sense of family dynamics. The subtle and sensitive content of the book touches the reader or the listener, regardless of their age. The story also has soft and beautiful illustrations that help small children understand the world of adults and stimulate their imagination. I think the Moon Fairy should be read in all separated families and especially in those in the process of separation. 
Ivona Kysselef, divorced mother:
I read the book cover to cover and had real goose bumps while reading it. A wonderful fairy tale, really beautiful and real! We experienced the same situation and our Star is shining brighter every day. In my opinion, this story is not just for children, but for parents as well, especially for those who are afraid to get separated because of the children. They are not aware they can give much more to their child and make them happier if they separate and are both happy by themselves.
Meta Vedenik, grandmother:
I have read this wonderful book from cover to cover. It was a gift for my grandson, who now browses through it couple of times per day. It’s his favorite story to read before bedtime. He said he likes it because he sees himself as the little star, his mom as the Moon Fairy, and his dad as the Sun Prince. We discuss the story’s message regularly, regardless of his favorite topic of the moment.

Just a little sidenote:
Our main mission is to bring this story of love to all the children who need it. We don't want to promote divorce at all, but we realize that the harsh reality of separation is sadly part of more and more children's lives.     
We want to extend a helping hand to them and their parents who are faced with one of the hardest conversations they will ever have to have. So we offer them a unique perspective and chance to tell their kids all that matters is that they are eternally loved.  
The story is also meant for kids who don't come from separated or blended families. Sometimes it can be hard for them to understand what is happening to their friends, and this book will lift the curtain to the unknown world in the gentlest way possible.

Presentation of the book
PLAY

 Timeline  
 
Now the children need YOU! 
The words have been painstakingly chosen, every illustration meticulously colored, the narrator's script ready to be performed... after two years this story of love is ready to sooth children's fears and start off conversations on the right foot, all around the world.
We are confident that all children will see themselves as a Little Star, born out of love, and that they will be able to understand their parents' decisions better after having this story read to them.
But now we need your help. We need help to raise the funds to spread these words around the world, to change it the world into the World of Uniqueness, to help every Star find their light to shine. 

Team
   

Rewards 
 Get in touch
If you have a question about the project or you just want to give us your feedback, please don’t hesitate to drop us a line! Interested in writing about us? Our press kit is available for download here.
Tags: #woustar #worldofuniqueness #moonfairy #sunprince #moonfairyandsunprince 

On Social Media:
Twitter
Facebook 
Instagram 
Woustar.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The hardcover version of "Why Don't Moon Fairy and Sun Prince Live Together?" is all set up and meets all publishing legal requirements. All illustrations, created by Mark Jordan, are finished and rendered. The English translation and proofreading is finished as well. 

The main challenge we face is to provide the right narrator for the audiobook, backed with the original soundtrack and jingles, and to fund the production of the audiobook. 

Our ambition is to produce high-quality audiobook that will soothe and comfort children with its narrator's smooth voice, compelling to both boys and girl. 

We will update our respected backers on a regular basis and make sure that their chosen packages will arrive as soon as possible. 

Since we are immensely grateful to each and every one of you for believing in our project, we want to offer you a chance to be a part of it as well. Besides providing constant behind the scenes peeks, we will invite you to partake in some of our final decisions about audiobook production. 

THANK YOU for believing in the World of Uniqueness!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
THANK YOU!
We are so grateful for all of your support in helping us reach our $35,000 goal! With your help, the Never Built New York exhibition will be on view from September 17, 2017 to February 18, 2018. We cannot thank you enough!
$50K STRETCH GOAL
Now we are thrilled to announce a stretch goal of $50,000 to help us realize a few particularly ambitious aspects of our exhibition as envisioned by Studio Christian Wassmann. If we reach our stretch goal, we plan to build an inflatable bouncy castle modeled after the never built Westinghouse Pavilion for the '64 World's Fair designed by the legendary Eliot Noyes.
Studio Christian Wassmann
With the additional funding, we can also realize our incredible plan to build a glowing LED-powered "sun" that will illuminate the Panorama of the City of New York. And we will be able to give you the ultimate 3D experience of seeing Never Built New York through animations by Shimahara Illustration, one of the nation’s most accomplished architectural renderers.
Drawing of Sun light installation by Urs Schönebaum
Help Never Built New York fulfill its greatest potential! Make this ambitious exhibition a reality!
ABOUT THE EXHIBITION
The Queens Museum invites you to step into an alternate Gotham where the boldest, most daring, and most far-reaching urban designs are realized.
Curated by Sam Lubell and Greg Goldin, and designed by Christian Wassmann, Never Built New York—opening September 2017—presents 200 years of visionary architectural and urban designs that never came to be, all brought to life for the first time with original drawings, renderings, newly commissioned models, and 3D visualizations.
Testing a model on the Panorama of the City of New York
We invite you to be part of this monumental exhibition by helping us reach our goal of $35,000. Funding will support the installation of a gallery dedicated to stunning, rarely seen models, sketches, drawings, and more than 70 models to be installed on the Museum’s renowned Panorama of the City of New York. These miniature models are currently being purpose-built by students in Columbia University's Graduate School of Architecture, Planning, and Preservation. Select models will be sent to contributors who donate to our campaign. While these projects never came to be, you can own a model all to yourself! 
Join us and together, let’s discover a New York that was never built...until now. 
ABOUT THE EXHIBITION
By showcasing visionary yet un-built architectural and urban planning projects, Never Built New York explores the backstory behind how and why New York City came to look the way it does, expanding our understanding of the city we know and love. The contents of this exhibition—culled from public and private archives—will also spotlight some of the most visionary concepts for New York City, giving visitors an unprecedented look at the design process, the rich depth of ingenious schemes, and the power of innovative ideas to propel the City forward into an uncharted future. 
Exhibition models by Christian Wassmann
WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT?
What lessons can we learn from forgotten or neglected ideas? Through Never Built New York, the Queens Museum will not only exhibit many daring designs that were never realized, but also encourage discourse around how some of the most pressing issues of our time—ecological sustainability, population displacement, and economic inequity—are inextricably linked to our built environment. With the support of the Kickstarter community, we will demonstrate how the architectural insights of the past can help us plan for a stronger future.
NEVER BUILT NEW YORK HIGHLIGHTS
Buckminster Fuller – Dome Over Manhattan (1961)
It is hard to imagine a glass dome over midtown Manhattan, but R. Buckminster Fuller conceived just that: a two-mile-diameter dome over mid-Manhattan that spanned the width of the island and was three times the height of the Empire State Building. Why? The purpose of the temperature-controlled aluminum and glass dome was to provide Midtowners with a perfect climate year-round!
I.M. Pei – Hyperboloid (1954)
Robert Young, the newly elected chairman of the New York Central Railroad chose I.M. Pei for the redevelopment of Grand Central. I.M. Pei’s Hyperboloid was proposed to be a 1,497-foot-tall office tower and transit hub. The 108-story, $100 million edifice, spanning a nine-acre site, would have been the world’s tallest and most costly structure. But after Young’s passing, the project fizzled.
Rufus Gilbert – Pneumatic Railway (1880)
Dr. Rufus Henry Gilbert proposed a railway powered by pneumatic air that would carry commuters in tubes 24 feet above the streets, a project that ground to a halt due to the 1873 financial crisis. The proposal's Gothic arches and Corinthian columns made for a stylish design to adorn New York City, however the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line eventually occupied the space on which they were meant to stand.
Wallace K. Harrison, Aymar Embury II, Louis Skidmore, W. Earl Andrews, and others – United Nations, Flushing Meadows (1952)
Before Robert Moses foresaw a new Dodger Stadium or a World’s Fair in Flushing Meadows, he imagined a much larger prize for his highway-laced park: the United Nations. The conceptual plan for the site included a domed assembly hall, three low-rise office buildings, and 51 sunken pylons representing the founding nations of the U.N. Around these buildings and symbols, there was also to be a long reflecting pool, a low-lying rectangular entrance court and terrace, and a central lagoon.
Frank Lloyd Wright – Key Project for Ellis Island (1959)
“Causal, inspired living, minus the usual big-city clamor.” Frank Lloyd Wright’s Key Project for Ellis Island was imagined as a completely self-contained city of the future. This futuristic, car-free utopia would shelter 7,500 residents beneath air-conditioned domes housing theaters, hospitals, churches, schools, a library, and a sports arena, all linked by moving sidewalks. It would look like “a jewel suspended over the water and surrounded by it, free of congestion and noise.” Wright’s Key Project was rejected and Ellis Island was declared a national monument in 1965.
REWARDS
  Carry Never Built New York with you wherever you go with this Kickstarter exclusive digital wallpaper for your phone, tablet, or computer! Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
Receive a very special Never Built New York GIF for you to post, text, and tweet to your heart's delight! All you have to do is decide how to pronounce "gif." Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
Show off your support with a set of three Never Built New York pin-back buttons. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
We will mail you a limited edition unframed exhibition print (11x17in.) for your collection. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
 Snag this limited edition tote designed by Studio Christian Wassmann!
You will receive an invitation to an exclusive preview hour of the exhibition at the Queens Museum before it opens to the public in September 2017. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
As part of the Queens Museum's Adopt-A-Building program, we will send you a digital "lease agreement" for a Never Built site that will be installed on the Panorama of the City of New York during the exhibition. Your virtual fixed tenancy will last from September 2017 to February 2018, but you can print and frame the "lease" for posterity! We will also acknowledge you on our Adopt-A-Building website. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
For the print lover: We will send you an autographed copy of Never Built New York by co-authors and curators Greg Goldin and Sam Lubell with a foreword by Daniel Libeskind and published by Metropolis Books. Plus the exhibition print, and your name on our website's thank you wall.
Put on some white gloves and enjoy a behind-the-scenes look at the production of the historic Worlds Fairs and the Panorama with our in-house expert, archivist, registrar, and curator, Louise Weinberg. Louise will reveal little-known artifacts and souvenirs drawn from the Museum's collection–as well as some juicy anecdotes of proposals that were never built! If you can't join us in person, there will be a live-streaming option made available to you. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
Limited edition prints of the blueprint of the Perisphere built for the '39 New York World's Fair in Flushing Meadows Corona Park. Accompanied by the Trylon, the Perisphere was a monumental modernistic structure designed by architects Wallace Harrison and J. Andre Fouilhoux and kept with the Fair's theme, "World of Tomorrow." Razed after the Fair, the materials of both structures were used in World War II armaments. Today, the Unisphere now sits in the Persiphere's original location. The Queens Museum is reproducing limited edition prints (18x24in.) from the original blueprints, which are part of our collection. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.
You and up to 5 of your guests will be given a private tour of the exhibition at the Queens Museum, as well as a Never Built New York souvenir. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall. 
Ranging from 1–20 inches in height, select 3D-printed models, which will be exhibited in Never Built New York, are available to contributors to own. These models reflect years of research, planning, and design by not only master architects, but by the project's curators and exhibition designers as well. While the original architectural concepts never came to be, you can have a very special, one of a kind model all to yourself! Your name on our web site's thank you wall or acknowledgement in our exhibition credit line in all print, online and in gallery materials.
You and one guest are invited to the Queens Museum for the opening day of the exhibition, where we will introduce you to the curators, take you on a tour of the key highlights of the Museum, and give you your own signed copy of the book! Then, join us for a private exhibition opening dinner celebration with artists, curators, and other special friends of the Museum. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line on our website.
Get ready to take off your shoes! After receiving proper training, we will take you for a tour ON the Panorama for an up-close view of the Never Built New York installation. And don't forget to say "Cheese!"—no trip to New York City, even in miniature form, is complete without a souvenir photograph. We also invite you to come to the exhibition and meet our Executive Director, Laura Raicovich. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.
Treat up to 15 future urban dreamers to a day of model making with a Queens Museum Educator and special guest Christian Wassmann at the Queens Museum...(pizza included!) DYK? Queens Museum's education programs are nationally renowned! We recommend this workshop for children 5-12 years old. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online and in-gallery materials.
You and a guest are invited to an intimate dinner party with world-renowned architect Daniel Libeskind. Libeskind is an international figure in architecture and urban design. As Principal Design Architect for Studio Libeskind, Mr. Libeskind speaks widely on the art of architecture in universities and professional summits. The Studio has completed buildings that range from museums and concert halls to convention centers, university buildings, hotels, shopping centers, and residential towers. His architecture and ideas have been the subject of countless articles and exhibitions, influencing the field of architecture and the development of cities and culture. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.
Models by Studio Christian Wassmann
HOW DID THIS PROJECT COME ABOUT?
In 2013, co-curators Greg Goldin and Sam Lubell, installed Never Built Los Angeles, an exhibition at the A+D Architecture and Design Museum in Los Angeles, and published a book with the same title. This hugely successful project caught the eye of the Queens Museum, an arts institution whose socially engaged and community-based programming includes urbanism, urban planning, and architecture.
ABOUT THE QUEENS MUSEUM
We are a public museum situated within Flushing Meadows Corona Park in New York City. Since our founding in 1972, the Museum has been a home for the production and presentation of great art, intimately connected to its community and to the history of its site. At the core of the Queens Museum’s diverse initiatives are artist and community-led projects, some of the most radical and engaged museum education and public programs in the country, and groundbreaking exhibitions.
ABOUT THE PANORAMA
The Panorama of the City of New York is the jewel in the crown of the collection of the Queens Museum and a locus of memory for visitors from all over the globe. Commissioned by urban mastermind and World’s Fair President Robert Moses for the 1964 Fair, it served as a celebration of the City’s municipal infrastructure. The Panorama was built by a team of more than 100 people working for the great architectural model makers Raymond Lester & Associates over the course of three years. Today, it continues to wow hundreds of thousands of visitors annually, including 30,000 New York City school children, and inspires new interventions and installations by artists and curators. 
Queens Museum and Panorama photos by Max Touhey
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Never Built New York offers a look into an alternate reality for New York. With the City’s iconic skyline known all over the world, the possibility of New York being anything other than what it is today is endlessly fascinating. We are thrilled to use Kickstarter to engage with architecture buffs, lovers of New York City, and dreamers across the globe to bring this treasure trove of designs, plans, and schemes to life.
ABOUT OUR COLLABORATORS
Sam Lubell is a Staff Writer at Wired and a Contributing Editor at The Architect’s Newspaper. He has written seven books about architecture for Monacelli Press, Rizzoli, Metropolis Books, and Phaidon. He also writes for The New York Times, The Los Angeles Times, Los Angeles Magazine, Architect, Architectural Record, Architectural Review, Wallpaper*, Contract, and other publications. He co-curated the A+D Architecture and Design Museum exhibitions Never Built Los Angeles (2013) and Shelter: Rethinking How We Live in Los Angeles (2015).
Never Built New York co-curator Greg Goldin was the architecture critic at Los Angeles Magazine from 1999 to 2011. In 2011, he was awarded a Getty Institute Research Grant, which led to his exhibition Windshield Perspective at Architecture and Design Museum in Los Angeles (2013), a study of vernacular L.A. architecture. He co-curated and co-authored Never Built Los Angeles in summer 2013, and co-authored Never Built New York in 2016. Goldin was a contributing curator to the Getty Museum’s No Further West (2014), an exhibition about the making of Los Angeles’ Union Station. His writing has appeared in The Los Angeles Times, Architectural Record, The Architect’s Newspaper, and Zocalo, among many others.
Christian Wassmann is an architectural designer and the exhibition designer of Never Built New York. Studio Christian Wassmann develops designs influenced by art, geometry, and the cosmos. Projects range from buildings, interiors, site-specific installations, exhibitions, furniture, and lamps. The studio has designed projects such as East Village Radio, Lisson Gallery New York, and the Sun Path House in Miami Beach. Wassmann’s career began as an architectural draftsman in Switzerland at age 15 and since 1997 he has collaborated with like-minded artists and architects. In 2010, Wassmann received the Swiss Art Award in architecture, and in 2012 the studio won the AIA New York New Practice Award.
This project has been selected for inclusion on Art Basel's curated page on Kickstarter. Check out out their curated page to learn about other great cultural projects.
VIDEO CREDITS
Video by Jay Buim; Queens Museum photo by Scott Rudd; Buckminster Fuller, Dome over Manhattan, Stanford University Special Collections; William Zeckendorf, Rooftop Airport, Life Magazine; Eric Gugler, Obelisk, Library of Congress, Architecture, Design & Engineering Drawings; I.M. Pei, Hyperboloid, Pei Cobb Freed; Rodman Wanamaker, National American Indian Memorial, Library of Congress Architecture, Design & Engineering Drawings; Matthew Nowicki, Columbus Circle Shopping Center, Cornell University Special Collections; Exhibition sketches courtesy Studio Christian Wassmann; Wallace K. Harrison, X-City, Avery Architectural & Fine Arts Library; Frank Gehry, Guggenheim Museum; Frank Lloyd Wright, Key Project for Ellis Island, Avery Architectural & Fine Arts Library; Bertrand Goldberg, ABC Headquarters, Art Institute of Chicago Ryerson & Burnham Archives; Coney Island Globe; Rufus Gilbert, Pneumatic Railway, New York Public Library
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project that involves creative collaboration, elements of "Never Built New York" may need to shift and evolve. The potential for this exhibition is as high as a skyscraper! If we don’t reach our goal, our highly skilled curatorial team will have to reassess the exhibition’s elaborate production and design. Having mounted critically-acclaimed exhibitions, including “Hey! Ho! Let's Go: Ramones and the Birth of Punk”, “Mierle Laderman Ukeles: Maintenance Art”, and “13 Most Wanted Men: Andy Warhol and the 1964 World’s Fair”, the Queens Museum is well-equipped to face potential hurdles and will keep our community of supporters informed no matter what. There are many moving parts, but we are up for the challenge, and are confident that your help will make it happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: For Your Desktop
support.descp: Carry Never Built New York with you wherever you go with this Kickarter exclusive digital wallpaper for your phone, tablet, or computer! Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Our GIF to you!
support.descp: Receive a very special Never Built New York GIF for you to post, text, and tweet to your heart's delight! All you have to do is decide how to pronounce "gif." Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Button Up!
support.descp: Show off your support with a set of three Never Built New York pin-back buttons. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Exhibition Print
support.descp: We will mail you a limited edition unframed exhibition print (11x14in.) for your collection. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Limited Edition NBNY Designed Tote Bag
support.descp: Snag this limited edition tote designed by Studio Christian Wassmann!

support.title: Special Access
support.descp: You will receive an invitation to an exclusive preview hour of the exhibition at the Queens Museum right before it opens to the public in September 2017. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Lease a Never Built Property!
support.descp: As part of the Queens Museum's Adopt-A-Building program, we will send you a digital "lease agreement" for a Never Built site that will be installed on the Panorama of the City of New York during the exhibition. Your virtual fixed tenancy will last from September 2017 to February 2018, but you can print and frame the "lease" for posterity! We will also acknowledge you on our Adopt-A-Building website. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Architect, Jr.
support.descp: Treat up to 15 future urban dreamers to a day of model making with a Queens Museum Educator and special guest Christian Wassmann at the Queens Museum...(pizza included!) DYK? Queens Museum's education programs are nationally renowned! We recommend this workshop for children 5-12 years old. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online and in-gallery materials.

support.title: The Westinghouse Bouncy Pavilion
support.descp: One-of-a-kind, bouncy castle reproduction of Eliot Noyes' (1910-1977) design of the Westinghouse Pavilion at the 1964 New York World's Fair that was never built. The bouncy castle will be enjoyed during the Never Built New York exhibition and then be all yours! In addition, for your support you will be prominently acknowledged for one year on the Queens Museum's Major Donor Wall.

support.title: Never Built New York: The Book
support.descp: Add this beautiful book to your library! We will send you an autographed copy of Never Built New York by co-authors and curators Greg Goldin and Sam Lubell with a foreword by Daniel Libeskind and published by Metropolis Books. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Print Isn't Dead!
support.descp: For the print lover! We will send you an autographed copy of Never Built New York by co-authors and curators Greg Goldin and Sam Lubell with a foreword by Daniel Libeskind and published by Metropolis Books. Plus the exhibition print, and your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Lift the Curtain Tour
support.descp: Put on some white gloves and enjoy a behind the scenes look at the production of the historic Worlds Fairs and the Panorama with our in-house expert, archivist, registrar, and curator, Louise Weinberg. Louise will reveal little known artifacts and souvenirs drawn from the Museum's collection—as well as some juicy anecdotes of proposals that were never built! If you can't join us in person, there will be a live-streaming option made available to you. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Built, but never seen again...
support.descp: Limited edition prints of the blueprint of the Perisphere built for the '39 New York World's Fair in Flushing Meadows Corona Park. Accompanied by the Trylon, the Perisphere was a monumental modernistic structure designed by architects Wallace Harrison and J. Andre Fouilhoux and kept with the Fair's theme, "World of Tomorrow." Razed after the Fair, the materials of both structures were used in World War II armaments. Today, the Unisphere now sits in the Persiphere's original location. The Queens Museum is reproducing limited edition prints (18x24in.) from the original blueprints, which are part of our collection. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Westinghouse Pavilion 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D-printed model of Eliot Noyes' Westinghouse Pavilion that was designed for the 1964 New York World's Fair and exhibited in Never Built New York. We will also acknowledge you on our website. Noyes’ initial design for the Westinghouse Pavilion consisted of eight huge spheres, each 45 feet across. This was unrealized and Westinghouse scaled back to a time capsule project. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Opera House 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D model of Metropolitan Opera House (1955) designed by Wallace K. Harrison and exhibited in Never Built New York. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: ABC Headquarters 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D model of ABC Headquarters (1963) designed by Bertrand Goldberg and exhibited in Never Built New York. Goldberg designed an intricate 60-story site with its exterior walls curving inward and outward. ABC liked the idea, but money woes left the building on the drawing boards. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Metropolitan Life North Annex 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D model of Metropolitan Life North Annex (1929) designed by Harvey Wiley Corbett and Daniel Everett Waid and exhibited in Never Built New York. The architects' idea for the Annex was to be a towering 100 story building to serve as the extension of the Metropolitan Life Insurance building across the street. The Great Depression reduced the tower to a mere 30 stories, leaving the truncated base that stands today across from Madison Square. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Private Curator-Led Tour
support.descp: You and up to 5 of your guests will be given a private tour of the exhibition at the Queens Museum, as well as a Never Built New York souvenir. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Columbus Circle Shopping Center 3D Model
support.descp: Bring home a one of a kind, 3D-printed model, approximately 1.5 inches tall and 2 inches wide, of Columbus Circle Shopping Center (1948) designed by Matthew Nowicki and exhibited in Never Built New York. Nowicki designed the shopping center as an elevated loop as a means to safeguard pedestrians from the perilous traffic congestion in the circle. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Coney Island Globe 3D Model
support.descp: Bring home a one of a kind, 3D-printed model, approximately 7.5 inches tall and 4.5 inches wide, of Coney Island Globe (1906) designed by Samuel Friede and exhibited in Never Built New York. Friede wanted the Coney Island Globe to be 300 feet in diameter and 750 feet tall. It was to include 11 levels with a theater, roller skating rink, dance hall, circus, palm garden, weather observatory, several restaurants, and a roof garden. Friede was unable to convince a landowner to lease him the Coney Island land, which in the end deflated plans for the globe. We invite you to come to the exhibition, meet our Executive Director Laura Raicovich, and see your one-and-only model on exhibit! You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.

support.title: Hyperboloid 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D-printed model of Hyperboloid (1954) designed by I.M. Pei and exhibited in Never Built New York. The 108-story structure, spanning a nine-acre site, would have been the city's tallest and most costly building, besting the Empire State Building. The transportation center for trains, buses, cars, and subways was unique in that it narrowed as it rose skyward. The project never moved forward. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: Parallax Towers 3D Model
support.descp: Bring home a one of a kind, 3D model, approximately 18.5 inches tall, of the Parallax Towers (1989) designed by Steven Holl and exhibited in Never Built New York. Holl's design aimed to extend 72nd Street into the Hudson River and explored the idea of three-dimensionality. We invite you to come to the exhibition, meet our Executive Director Laura Raicovich, and see your one-and-only model on exhibit! You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.

support.title: Key Project for Ellis Island 3D Model
support.descp: Own the one-of-a-kind 3D model of Key Project of Ellis Island (1959) designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and exhibited in Never Built New York. The idea for Ellis Island was for it to be a "completely self-contained city of the future." It was the last commission Wright accepted before his death in April 1959. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: 23 East 22nd Street 3D Model
support.descp: Bring home a one of a kind, 3D-printed model, approximately 3.5 inches tall, of 23 East 22nd Street (2008) designed by Office of Metropolitan Architecture and exhibited in Never Built New York. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: VIP Experience
support.descp: You and one guest are invited to the Queens Museum for the opening day of the exhibition, where we will introduce you to the curators, take you on a tour of the key highlights of the Museum, and give you your own signed copy of the book! Then, join us for a private exhibition opening dinner celebration with artists, curators, and other special friends of the Museum. Plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

support.title: The Ultimate Experience
support.descp: Get ready to take off your shoes! After receiving proper training, we will take you for a tour ON the Panorama for an up close view of the Never Built New York installation. And don't forget to say "Cheese!" —no trip to New York City, even in miniature form, is complete without a souvenir photograph. We also invite you to come to the exhibition and meet our Executive Director Laura Raicovich. You will be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.

support.title: Dinner with a Master!
support.descp: You and a guest are invited to an intimate dinner party with world-renowned architect, Daniel Libeskind. Libeskind is an international figure in architecture and urban design. As Principal Design Architect for Studio Libeskind, Mr. Libeskind speaks widely on the art of architecture in universities and professional summits. The Studio has completed buildings that range from museums and concert halls to convention centers, university buildings, hotels, shopping centers and residential towers. His architecture and ideas have been the subject of countless articles and exhibitions, influencing the field of architecture and the development of cities and culture. You will also be acknowledged in our exhibition credit line in all print, online, and in-gallery materials.

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks to you, we are building what was never built!
updates.update_content:
We are counting down to the end of the campaign but it's not over yet—We are just shy of our stretch goal with just three days to go! We hope you consider helping out by tweeting, 'gramming, and sharing the campaign. And if you haven't pledged yet, there are some fabulous rewards still available.
Thank you so much for your support in bringing this incredible project to life!

We are so grateful for your support in helping us achieve our Kickstarter goal! Now we have nine days to reach our stretch goal to bring a bouncy castle, 3D animations, and LED "sun" that will illuminate the Panorama of the City of New York to the Queens Museum. We've got some exciting new rewards that we hope you share with that tote-ally awesome person in your life, and your favorite archi-parent too!
New Rewards
Happy Friday! As we enter the weekend we had a few great updates to share with you all.

Frank Lloyd Wright was born 150 years ago today and to celebrate we have just released a brand new reward! The Key Project for Ellis Island 3D Model.
Own the one-of-a-kind 3D model of Key Project of Ellis Island (1959) designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and exhibited in Never Built New York. The idea for Ellis Island was for it to be a "completely self-contained city of the future." It was the last commission Wright accepted before his death in April 1959. Grab it for $300 plus your name on our website's thank you wall.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy 150th Birthday to Frank Lloyd Wright!
updates.update_content:
Thanks to your support, we have already raised $35,000 for Never Built New York!
We couldn't be more grateful for your enthusiastic messages and inquiries, as well as all of the press coverage we’ve received from around the nation and the globe!

campaign.story:
Kefirko Cheese Maker is specifically designed glass jar for a simple homemade preparation of cheese.
Use homemade kefir to prepare probiotic kefir cheese, with no cheese starters or additives necessary or use this kitchen tool to prepare a variety of other cheeses. 
  Only 4 steps are needed to prepare fresh and healthy kefir cheese full of probiotics and flavoured the way you like it. 
  Kefir cheese contains all the probiotic micro-organisms that are so beneficial in kefir. 
  Straining one batch of kefir made in Kefirko (600 ml - 20 oz) makes approximately 200-300g of soft kefir cream cheese. 
The longer the kefir strains, drier and thicker it becomes:
Few hours for a thicker kefir that can be used for dips. 
 Overnight for creamy cheese. 
 1-2 day to get semi-hard cheese.

Flavour your cheese by adding dry or fresh fruit, nuts, herbs or spices of your choice. Choose your ingredients and prepare fresh cheese the way you like it.

Kefirko Cheese Maker design allows you to make various types of delicious Cheeses and cheese dishes!
Kefir cheese is not the only cheese you can make in Kefirko Cheese Maker. By using cheese additives and rennets you can prepare any cheese dish you desire. Why not try to prepare homemade mascarpone, mozzarella, greek yogurt,...? 
Books of recipes included in Kefirko Cheese Maker!
Inspired by a variety of cheese dishes made with Kefirko Cheese Maker we created this recipe book full of ideas for tasty cheese meals.
As a side product of cheese making, there is whey, which is a big source of proteins. Helps regenerate muscles and boost your immunity.

Alternative Use
Want to take a little break from tasty fresh cheese? There are always alternatives on how to use Kefirko Cheese Maker. With some creativity you can easily make fresh ice tea, ice coffee or almond milk. The sky is the limit. :)
Testimonials
                      Kefirko Cheese Maker Explained
        Colours
Different options to bring some color into your kitchen. Choose from colorful palette the special color that brings out the happy cook in you. 
You will choose the color of Kefirko Cheese Maker after this campaign ends.
  New and improved Kefirko 2!
Specifically designed glass jar for easier making of milk or water kefir at home. What is changed? It has better grip of the lid and improved airflow. We also added the Scrapper - a tool for mixing kefir grains during straining to make sure they easily separate from kefir drink. By covering the hole on the Kefirko lid with Scrapper the straining of kefir also becomes more practical and fast.

  Stretch Goals   
    The Development 
We have been working on Kefirko Cheese Maker for almost two years to make this product as easy to use and as clean and safe to work with as possible. With our team of experts in their respective fields we have developed something new and beautiful, a product that will change your food preparation tremendously.
The Team
Since 2015 Marko Borko and Andrej Glažar and their team were working on this new kitchen tool. The ultimate goal was to make cheese preparation simple as possible, clean and efficient to enable everyone to do it at home.
Now we want to share this project with people who not just enjoy making kefir but love homemade cheese with no additives.
The Kefirko team is based in Maribor (Slovenia) and connects a group of DIY healthy food and kefir enthusiasts that range from product and visual designers, software engineers, developers to marketers.

Why we need you
Incorporation of homemade food into your lifestyle enables you to eat nutritious and healthy organic food on everyday basis. With Kefirko Cheese Maker you will make a step forward to a healthy lifestyle for you and your family.
We believe that you play an integral role in the development of Kefirko products. and that you, too, will enjoy preparing and consuming your own cheese thanks to KEFIRKO Cheese Maker. 
With your support we will be able to produce the molds needed to manufacture the final product. 
If you are ready to join this exciting journey with us, please support our campaign and spread the word! Become a backer and help us bring this new product to life. You will be the first to receive the product before anyone else. 
A few clicks for you can make a big difference for us.
Thanks in advance for your support!
Supported by:

Presskit Here!

Production Schedule

Rewards
Don’t miss out on special deals. Choose your reward and come a step closer to home preparation of cheese. Later Kefirko Cheese maker will retail for $31,59.
  This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've successfully completed and fulfilled Kickstarter project KEFIRKO Kefir Maker in the past. In 2014 people like you, who shared our vision, helped us fund a project Kefirko. Our campaign ended in December 2014 and we shipped the orders by the end of September 2015. Since then we’ve fulfilled orders for over 20.000 Kefirko jars worldwide. 

We understand the challenges that are to be expected when putting a new product into production. We have established partnership deals with our suppliers who have many years of experience with any risks that can occur in the production process. The molds for the products are already designed and ready to be formed. If for any reason we should switch suppliers it can take a bit more time to adjust, but with our resources, determination and know-how we promise to deliver an exceptional product!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

@abraham Irish, based on experience. If you cook probiotics, you will kill them. Kefir is fermented milk or fermented sugar. Water Kefir grains can be used to make "Soft drinks" and Milk Kefir grains can be used for Milk Kefir. Coconut Milk Kefir cannot be made regularly because milk kefir requires lactose to eat and survive. Most people alternate from milk to coconut milk to keep the grains happy. Although Milk and Water Kefir eat sugar, they might not fully consume them and retain the flavour you want. If you are looking to do soft drinks, generally the Kefirko is a great place to do the first fermentation. After the 1st fermentation, add the liquid only to a flip lid beer bottle and add juice to the mixture. Probiotics will consume the sugar to create carbonation. Google and you will find many recipes. If you look, there are some Vegan Yogurt Cultures.

campaign.story:
Surprised? We are.  So what happens, when you go to the grocery store for milk because it ran out in the middle of the week? I bet you come out with a salami and cheese, oranges that were on sale, and several other items, but probably without milk?!  Am I right? When you go shopping without a list, it’s really easy to go crazy.
                                                                    To avoid buying things you don’t need, you’ve got to dig deep. Using Smart Basket helps you focus on your needs and not to all the extra emotional and psychological »junk«. We created Smart Basket to help you start writing down only the things you need and stick only to that list when shopping. 
It is your best companion because it helps you improve your shopping habits and organize your free time. I don’t have time! Wrong! There are people who are achieving amazing things every day in the same 24 hours that we all have available. So what do they know that most people don’t? They organize their life to maximize productivity – and that’s the aim of Smart Basket: to help you organize your free time, everyday routine and life habits.
        We all have different ways of making notes and organizing our daily purchases, but none of them are environment-friendly, durable, affordable and handy at the same time.  Smart Basket has also a faithful and reliable pen that always writes when you pull it out to jot down a note.
Teach Slovenian with us: mleko=milk, jajca=eggs, jabolka=apples :)
       A6 FORMAT (10,5 cm x 14,8 cm). 
14 PAGES (pages for different notes: 4 pages for shopping notes, extra pages for discounts and saving memos, meal planning notes, and some empty pages for every day: a memo, a meeting, an appointment or a date). 
EXTRA POCKET for saving discounts coupons, cards and bills.
PEN INCLUDED (easily put it into the spiral). 
 TWO THEMES (cherry and cupcake).
     We're raising funds here in order to print our initial English run of a planner, and the money shall be used for the production and delivery of Smart Basket planners. By pledging for our planner you're not only helping us bring this project to life but also helping us build our company and create other products which are staying only on paper for now. 
       A mom, wife, friend, blogger and Alaskan Malamute lover, in love with nature and good food, and an entrepreneur of course. :)  I was looking for a job for quite a long time and could not find one, despite sending out numerous job applications. I wondered why nobody wanted to leverage my potentials. I knew I would do every work the best I can, therefore disappointment was pretty great. At a certain point, I decided not to waste any more time and started my career as an entrepreneur.
The idea of a shopping planner came quite unexpected – from my own experience. I knew I had to create a new product that would charm me with its usability and special features, and that I would love using. After months of testing and collecting ideas, the Smart Basket planner came to life. It has all the properties that a mom, woman and at the same time a geographer could wish for: it is affordable, reusable and therefore environmentally friendly, and very simple to use. I hope it will charm you as well!
There is not much time just for us, but we are really struggling that we don't forget about each other. :)
   Blaž Sluga, Nik Jevšnik and all actors for making a video. 
Boris & Mojca from Fotografiraj.se for amazing photos.
Bumblebee themes&Ampak.net for unique graphic design and other help. 
To all my friends and family who encourage me and help me to bring this project alive. 
                                                                               Thank you all,  Nina

campaign.story:
Rolkaz hemp skateboards - quality, performance and sustainability.
Our hemp skateboards are a complete change and innovation in the way skateboards are made. We crafted our boards with the belief that skateboarding and the care for our planet should go hand in hand. Discovering great properties of hemp and flax fibers we challenged ourselves to create a skateboard with that extra feel good quality. Nature is at the core of our philosophy - empowering all of us to drive positive change.
                                                Whether you’re a serious sunset shredder, a daily street nomad, or one that simply loves to cruise the earth, we’ve carefully crafted the boards to fit you all. We present our Rolka hemp series; two cruiser shapes with slightly different characteristics, both with the same construction and high end components.
           Drifter takes you places you've never been. It's an all-round cruiser with many characters hidden within. Ride it around the city, push it to your favorite skatepark, carve down any line or just charge it hard. Ride for the future!
The 28 inch Drifter combines features like mellow concave, kick on both ends and slightly wider shape that make this board multi functional, fun and easy to ride.
                               The mini-cruiser has never been greener and more progressive. Meet Mala! This 24 inch mini boasts snappy performance due to a mellow concave and shorter wheelbase, ideal for carving, cruising, and commuting. It shares all the performance genes with her bigger brother, while still being easily portable.
           Pick a shape. Pick a colour. Pick your reward! Don’t miss this special opportunity to be one of the first to own and ride a hemp skateboard!
    
    We use solely natural and sustainable materials from renewable resources, 100% natural hemp and flax fibers as well as high performance plant based resin. The combination of raw materials with superior mechanical properties makes our board completely different from anything you’ve ridden before, yet it looks and feels like a regular skateboard. All the materials are locally grown and processed in Europe.
We love hemp! As one of the earliest known cultivated crops grown by mankind, hemp has had an important role in social and economic growth. Revival of its production and use can help care for the planet.
Hemp is a renewable, fast growing and recyclable material. It also happens to be one of the strongest natural fibers. Hemp production is a zero waste, low energy process, where all byproducts are used.
This drought resistant plant requires no chemicals, fertilisers and pesticides to grow, cleans the air we breath and enriches rather than depletes the soil. Even better, hemp can yield up to four times of dry fiber per acre compared to forest.
Fibers twisted in yarn provide increased resistance to bending and hold the flex over time, while preserving excellent skateboard performance.
The addition of flax fibers increases damping properties for shock absorption and a smooth ride.
Its huge potential in sports industry has already been proven. Flax fibres have the highest specific stiffness of all natural fibres. They add to the strength-to-weight ratio, natural aesthetic and provide great fit and finish for our boards.
Fibers are bound together with high performance durable plant based resin derived from sustainable sources. The raw materials for plant based resin are produced by green chemistry techniques employed in biorefineries. The resin comes from oil distillation with no deforestation traces. Biomass material used as a source does not compete with food sources or displace food-based agriculture.
The result is a unique skateboard construction with awesome characteristics and enhanced performance, which proves there is a sustainable and responsible choice.
    Trees take around 60 years to mature before they can be cut down to make skateboards. Growing hemp only takes 12-14 weeks.
Natural fibers • Plant based resin • Sustainable resources • Locally sourced • Environmentally friendly • Conscious design • Water based colors • Minimal waste and emission • Smaller carbon footprint • Responsible manufacturing • Care for the planet • Positive impact •
Sustainable in both design and manufacturing in order to reduce the environmental impact and to ensure highest quality.
For us at Rolkaz, being less destructive to nature with every decision we make is what makes everything more simple and more relevant.
                                            Many months in the making, we are stoked to finally present our hemp skateboards. Inspired by nature and designed for the future, our goal was to combine high-quality natural materials with modern design and a heavy dose of performance. From day one, the main goal was to experiment and innovate through freedom of creating with adventure in mind.
Rolkaz hemp skateboards are an innovation in terms of processes and materials researched, tools invented, technologies used and design perfected to create the kind of unique skateboard that we created. We worked really hard to replace traditional skateboard materials with their sustainable alternatives to design the construction that we envisioned.
We tested as many different skateboards as we were able to find, which helped us set and define qualities we wanted our new boards to have. Following test, reviews and discussions we determined the best characteristics of our favorite rides, optimized the shape and refined its construction. All in order to deliver a cruiser skateboard with premium riding experience.
At the beginning we were working on one shape but soon we realized we want to create a cruiser series. We called it Rolka Hemp Series (rolka meaning literally skateboard). Drifter got a smaller more stashable sister Mala (mala meaning small).
The huge breakthrough was proving that innovative alternatives to standard materials can maintain the highest level of performance. Our research showed that hemp fibers were incredibly strong and have all the desired mechanical properties.
Finding the right local supplier with quality materials was a challenging process. Sustainable local sourcing and manufacturing is something we are all very passionate about. Therefore we chose materials and processes that are the best in the industry from the environmental perspective.
Our boards are ready! The funds we are raising will go directly to material orders, tooling and upfront manufacturing costs.
Now that we have ridden and tested our prototypes thoroughly and proven our best supply and manufacturing preferences, we invite you to support the production of our hemp skateboards and become part of our story.
                The 60 mm regular shape wheels combine longboard wheel softness with traditional skate wheel shape. Made of soft 78A urethane with super high rebound formula that provides excellent grip and is perfect for cruising, carving and freeriding. The wheels are stone ground with round edges for super slides right away.
      Paired with Paris Street trucks, one of the most versatile trucks out there, they take our board to new levels. They carve great, can be set to handle high speeds and you can even grind them. The board in combination with loose trucks gives a surf feel to the ride, while tighter trucks offer more control for tricks and speed.
All our completes are pre-gripped with Jessup clear grip that gives you a stable platform for ultimate control. Ordering just a deck you’ll receive a griptape sheet to apply it yourself. Natural fiber surface texture of our decks provides an adequate amount of grip for those who like to ride barefoot.
  Hey! We've already received so many requests for other shapes. To help us decide what shape to make next, please let us know.
        Rolkaz Collective was created to raise awareness that more sustainable materials and responsible processes could and should be used to make great skateboards.
Deep-rooted passion for board sports and our environment taught us how to push ourselves beyond our limits and develop projects that matter.
Our ideas are brought to life by creatives and designers, artists and activists, outdoor enthusiasts, skaters and surfers but most importantly true believers.
Thanks a ton: Alfredo, Amelia, Carlos, Elvis, Hugu Studio, Ivo, Lenart, Longboard Famara, Marko, Nestor, Niko, Ondu, Rafael, Sebastian, Špela, Toni, Val, Waterman Lanzarote and Zoran.
Join us on this journey... And ride for the future!
            Don’t miss this special opportunity to be one of the first to own and ride a hemp skateboard!  
   Pick a shape. Pick a colour. Pick your reward!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve set ourselves on a really ambitious plan to create a skateboard with the materials and processes we believe in. Our goal is accomplished. Now we are reaching out to the Kickstarter community to fund our first major production run. Manufacturing a new product is the riskiest and most expensive phase.

Through intensive preparation, knowledge exchange, successful communication with our suppliers and manufacturers, we have done everything we could to lower the risks of unpredictable events. It must be noted, though, that a larger production than expected might require a longer time to complete.

We believe your new ride will only be experienced and enjoyed once under your feet so we will work our best to meet our proposed timeline. Rolkaz hemp skateboards will be locally manufactured and assembled in Europe. 

We are looking forward to share all news, updates and fresh media content we are constantly creating. We’re excited to widen our collective and community, to boost the creativity and release our new products soon.

All details like shipping information and color preference will be collected via survey after this campaign has ended.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everybody!
We have some good news. Hemp skateboards will be available in our online store much sooner then marked in our timeline. Talking about weeks!
Due to a quiet Kickstarter community response we decided to cancel the campaign and make hemp skateboards available in our online store at https://rolkaz.co. That means slower growth pace but more sustainable project development. But don't worry, our two cruiser shapes Mala and Drifter are waiting for you and new shapes are already being tested. Thanks to the amazing support from many board sports individuals and media. We're ready to bring you guys much anticipated hemp skateboards, fresh visuals, new videos, reviews and much more.

campaign.story:
EXPRESSIVE WRITING
Expressive writing is a process of verbalizing your thoughts, emotions, intuitions and desires with the intention to give them some structure and organization with the help of rational mind. It brings on the feelings of release, power, peace... and often triggers the Eureka moment
Wikipedia: Writing therapy
www.psychologytoday.com: Expressive Writing
∞
    THINK OUTSIDE OF THE BOX
When writing words and logical sentences, you immediately turn on your rational part of the brain and deepen your focus to solve complex problems and come up with creative solutions.
∞
  BUILD EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE
The key to deal with emotions is to put them in concrete words so that the rational mind (that thinks with words) can understand what do you actually feel, why do you feel that way and what can you do to feel better.
That is how you become emotionally literate and able to handle emotions in a way that improves your personal power and quality of life around you.
∞
  STRESS RELIEVE
By simply putting in word what stresses you out, your inner tensions start to relieve, and you start to observe yourself from distance, keep calm and focus on "what you can do".
∞
  GREAT DECISION & GUT FEELING
Expressive writing is all about observing your gut feeling and listen to precious information that helps you to make a great decision.
You build a close connection with your inner vibrant core and trust in yourself so you can successfully follow your dreams.
∞

EVOKING MINDFULNESS
Expressive writing brings you into present moment; past frustrations and future anxieties hence lose their power over you. You can focus on the current situation, without invasive thoughts that would interrupt your mind.
∞
  EUREKA MOMENT & PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT
With expressive writing, you start connecting the dots and see a big picture of your life, that helps you to stick with an attitude: "I am in charge of my life." and successfully navigate you to win your goals.
∞
    ARCHAIC DESIGN
The pure archaic design of Eureka represents freedom and clarity of our mind, that we achieve when true writing, we connect our self with our pure, wild, inner core of emotions, intuition, and desires.
∞
  CHARMING DESKTOP TOTEM
Eureka is a desktop art piece with a fountain pen, that quietly stands on your desk inviting you to write.
When Eureka rests in its pen stand, you can see nothing but the charming aesthetics of wood.
∞
  ONE SECOND TO WRITE
When positioned on the table, it is always easily reachable and invites the user to get creative. The handy magnetic closing system makes the access to writing quick and simple, ensuring an effortless meeting of paper and ink
∞
    EXPANDING AWARENESS
The slightly expanding conical shape of the pen represents the process of expanding one’s consciousness which takes place during self-reflective writing.
∞
 
UN-HIDING SUBCONSCIOUS PATTERNS
Every time we chose to write, we pull the pen from its base and un-hide the metal mouthpiece with engraved patterns - endless loops.
This move symbolizes the process of discovering our limiting subconscious patterns with self-reflective writing.
∞
  WE ATTRACT FAMILIAR SITUATIONS
The magnetic joining of the stand and pen depicts the nature of our subconscious behavioral patterns, which work like a magnet in our lives, repeatedly attracting situations which limits us to experience feelings we were accustomed to in our childhood.
Every time we finish writing and put a pen back on its stand, we feel a magnetic attraction and hear the “Click” sound that reminds us that with writing we might just break our limiting subconscious pattern and start to attract the life we actually want.
∞
  HAPPINESS & PEACE
Jolly rocking and the calming to its upright position describes, peace, freedom, and joy, which through writing about oneself and one’s own self-discovery, they become ever present fellow-travellers in our lives.
∞
    GET IN TOUCH WITH ONESELF
Upon coming into contact with the wood, the luxuriously pleasant and warm touch, we get reminded of the intimacy when, while writing, we merge with our vibrant inner selves.
∞
               DIVINE BEAUTY
I gained a divine beauty in Eureka with the use of old design principles and phenomenon found in nature, mathematics, and geometry. Every detail is carefully constructed and interconnected with a whole entire product.
I wanted to create something that is not just beautiful at first look but allows an observer to research and discover more of a beauty incorporated in a design of the product.
∞
  INSIDE THE SPHERE
The spherical bottom of the base shows the capture, use, representation and segment of imaginary spheres which encapsulate the entire product.
∞
  THE BEAUTY OF MATHEMATICS
The dimensions of the heights of the Eureka have been planned in accordance with the multiplication of the module 9mm. Sum of digits of any dimension is 9.
∞
  CONICAL SHAPE OF THE PEN
At 0.5° degrees, the conical pen has the same angle, as the starting point from our perspective when encompassing the size of the sun.
∞
  FIBONACCI SEQUENCE
The Fibonacci sequence is a part of the pen stand, providing it with a visually calming presence.
∞
  GOLDEN SECTION
We, humans subconsciously consider golden section as familiar, because we see it everywhere in nature. It seems beautiful to us.
∞
  EQUAL SILHOUETTE AREA
The silhouettes of wooden parts of the pen and the stand seems to have congruent visual weight. They equally measure 12cm2.
∞
    FOUNTAIN PEN WRITING MECHANISM
Eureka uses superior writing mechanism Vivapen. Gliding on the basis creates silky vibrations, pleasantly effervescent sound and gentle friction, which allows the creation of a letter and effortless writing with only slight pressure.
∞
SMOOTH TIP
The rounded and brushed iridium tip ensures long-lasting life and smooth writing (suitable for left-handed people).
TWO IN ONE
The tip of the pen enables entries to be recorded with a thick or thin line, dependent on whether the upper or lower side of the tip is used.
INK FLOW
The ink feeding system ensures a continual flow of ink to the paper, even after multiple rapid movements of the pen on paper.
DRY & CLEAN
The more-than-substantial capacity of the feeder’s collector enables the pen to remain dry and clean.
NIB WIDTHS
The nib comes in F (fine), M (medium), B (broad) width. Eureka standard is F but you can choose M or B width (in a survey)
∞
  INK CARTRIDGE AND CONVERTERS
Eureka uses standard Pelikan (short or long) ink cartridge and Schmidt or Bock ink converters.
∞
  INSERT THE INK CARTRIDGE
Unscrew the wooden barrel from the mouthpiece. Firmly push the cartridge into mouthpiece nozzle and screw the wooden barrel back into the mouthpiece.
∞
    TOUCH & FEEL
A natural material gives a nice and sophisticated touch. Eureka is made out of walnut wood and protected with a water-based coating and wax.
∞
    ZEN EGG 2.0 - REDESIGNED & RE-ENGINEERED
Zen Egg is back on Kickstarter, redesigned and re-engineered. It looks more compact (all black) because bottom bunk is now made out of the same wood as the body of an egg. The shape and the weight system at the base are improved to ensure more slow and elegant rocking. It has a more silky touch and better protection that accomplishes by coating with wax instead of oil.
∞
  Zen Egg is currently available only in walnut wood.
   TIMELINE
June - pick and buy the materials & ordering tools
July - start the production
August - samples testing, optimizing fabrication
September - production
October - test
November - shipping :)
MY WISH
“I wish you a lot of eureka moments while writing things down."
Gašper Premože
∞
MY TEAM
I appreciate my fellow coworkers for all the hard work and for believing in Eureka project. Thank you guys: Project Manager: Aiša Premože / Press: Žiga Godina / Product Manager: Darko Šabič / Translation: Kurt Wilkesman / Production: Bojan Zajc, Matej Panjan / Film: Darko Sinko, Mitja Ličen, Saša Janjič, Matic Drakulič, Peter Premože, Nebojša Gajič, Barbara Gajič, Aiša Premože, Alen Audić, Neja Pavlič, Nina Pavlič, Nika Pavlič, Diana Pavlič, Nina Saqiri, Alex DeMiranda, Luka DeMiranda, Barbara Wilkesman / Photo: Urša Culiberg / Website: Miha Ojsteršek / Advisory, help and moral support: Janez Uplaznik, Maja Uplaznik, Marko Stijepič, Bogdan Jež / Kind words and little hints: Miha Možina, Marko Orel, Mirče Mladenov, Rok Andoljšek, Maksimiljan Volk, Tanja Štajdohar and others.
  PLACES

I am heartily thankful for all the knowledge that authors of these publications put in their work:
Dr. Sue Johnson: Hold Me Tight; Love Sense
Echart Tolle: The Power Of Now
Susan Forward: Emotional Blackmail; Toxic Parents
Thomas A. Harris: I'm Ok, You're Ok
David Eagleman: The Secret Lives of the Brain
James W. Pennebaker & Joshua M. Smyth: Opening Up by Writing It Down
Catherine Ann Jones: Heal Yourself with Writing
Jacqui Malpass: Writing to Heal
I warmly recommend reading any of these books. They will help you to get a deep insight into your inner word, understand and change your subconscious limiting patterns.

updates.update_content:
Hey there
I would like to share some news about Eureka pen production. We have woodturned the upper body of the pen and starting the waxing & polishing process. Here are some making of photos.
Gluing togeather: wood and brass construction.

updates.update_userinfo: Manufacturing issues solved, first few products looks fine
updates.update_content:
Hey there,
I have great news! We solved the manufacturing issues with Eureka pen and started a final production last week. The first few manufactured products work fine and the production process is going smoothly. It is a huge load off my mind. I feel vividly happy and relieved about that. Here are the first 75 pen bases glued together, wood-turned, polished and ready to be impregnated with oils. The magnetic mechanism works like charm :) We are close to finishing and shipping the products.

Hey there
Yesterday I was at the woodturner's workshop and we resolve some problems, that occurs. It surprises me how many delicate details require rethinking and resolving. Serial production is very different from prototyping. For example, There are about 18 operations needed for just one part of the pen - stand. Cutting wood, woodturning the main shape, woodturning the bottom cork, implementing the weight, sealing and magnetic mechanism, gluing together, abrasing the bottom where the corks and main shape glued together, abrasing upper funnel, polishing, oiling, fine polishing. At a first glance it looks like a linear process but in the manufacturing procedure it reveals additional problems, e.g. how to fasten the piece in to make an additional funnel; is it possible to do it earlier; if I do it earlier, how can I surely measure the distance that should be exact? And so on... Combining machined and handcrafted processes can sometimes be really hard.

Hey there
I apologize for delaying Eureka Pen project for such a long time. I have waited for so long for the metal construction parts for the body of the pen. They have finally arrived in January. And the metal mouthpieces are in the process of manufacturing right now as I am typing this post.
Why the delay?

Hey there
I want to make an update about the production process. I've been waiting for a long time to fabricate the metal parts and I was nervous because of a huge delay. But today when I look back, I realized that a delay was actually a good thing that just had to happen. In the meantime, I was testing the pen a lot and I discovered a weak point of the magnetic closing and sealing mechanism of the pen which I managed to improve.

updates.update_userinfo: Your support was stunning - thank you.
updates.update_content:
Dear Eureka Pen community
I appreciate your joining the Eureka Pen project. I enjoyed your kind words, warm compliments, and support ... I felt strong belonging. Thank you.
I will be spending next months to prepare the manufacturing process and select the materials. I will do my best to make you a proud owner of a great pen.

Hey there
You were among the first 50 Eureka backers. You backed it even if there were no early birds price. It was a strong move and I appreciate what you did. I am giving you a gift. For 50 backers that backed Eureka till now i will add one Zen Egg as a gift in your KS package. Thank you for your trust in me and congratulations for being bold.
