campaign.story:
With Teodoor, your smartphone becomes your new door key. It installs easily on the inside of your existing lock on a wide variety of doors, providing you with a complete, personal smart lock experience – in truly hands-free fashion. Using state of the art security, user-friendly installation and a well-thought app, while at the same time having a compact footprint with a sleek design.
       
Teodoor is designed to complement and complete your main entrance. It’s powered by replaceable lithium batteries and employs the latest Bluetooth technology to deliver a smart and secure home life solution. Teodoor unlocks your door  – all by himself.
  You can still use your key, your door retains its prime function. But now you have tons of options to go along.
    
    
We found the perfect formula while investing over 2 years of our time on research and development and by witnessing the current smart lock experience first hand.
   
   
Teodoor delivers truly hands-free service (unlike many that boast the same yet fail to deliver). Using a complex set of specific algorithms it determines when you’re approaching your door to unlock it, and does it for you. And just like a good doorman, it also locks the door behind you.
 
   
   
Teodoor senses any door movement when it’s locked and should be secure. You’ll receive a notification anywhere in the world (with the optional Wi-Fi adapter) if anyone tries to force your door open. And when it’s set to Vacation Mode, you’re notified of any activity whatsoever. 
   
   
The Teodoor app will be available for free on the App Store and Google Play Store. It allows you to give others access rights quickly and easily (regular or restricted access, you decide). The detailed scheduled access functions can be applied in a variety of situations: daily nanny, weekly cleaner, one-time visits and more. And it's highly convenient for bed and breakfast proprietors.
   
    
Teodoor is flexible, and perfectly happy with a human touch, so it can be turned manually, just like any regular doorknob. In case you ignored that pesky low-battery notification (or just forgot your phone) you can still use the lock. Pretty handy, right?
You can always use your existing keys to unlock your door in case you don't have your smartphone with you.
         
Teodoor is designed to be contemporary yet timeless, refined yet subdued, so it pairs well with any door it’s matched up with. The battery cover and the inner/mounting ring are precisely milled to perfection from aluminium or brass, next to the grooved, easy-grip shaft. 
   
Teodoor is available in three color finishes: Pebble Silver, Midnight Black, and Luxor Gold.
    
 
      
Teodoor was designed to be modular and easy to install. Setup is straightforward and takes only minutes (European installation is even faster, and done in seconds). It simply fits on the inside of your front (or other) door, right on your existing door hardware.  
  UPDATE: Teodoor now supports Swiss cylinders!
This smart lock is compatible with most single cylinder deadbolts (common in North America) and all European cylinder locks. If you’re not sure about compatibility, leave a comment (or send us an email) and include with your lock model (an image is always a plus) and we’ll help you out. 
We’ve tested Teodoor with deadbolts from the following manufacturers: Schlage, Kwikset, Baldwin, Defiant, Weiser, Omnia, and Emtek.
    Here's a Teodoor installation demo, done in a couple of seconds. 
   
 
  Teodoor uses the latest military grade encryption technologies which are also commonly used in online banking transactions. Our Bluetooth 5 capable chip (compatible with Bluetooth 4) has an additional cryptographic co-processor to enable usage of more sophisticated and safer encryption algorithms while using less processing time.
By doing that it also lowers energy consumption, so Teodoor can keep locking and unlocking your door for longer.
We are not using a central based storage system (the shared encryption key never hits our servers), so even we (or malicious hackers) cannot unlock your door.
Only Teodoor and your phone app have access to your lock.
  
 
   
You can select the way Teodoor works for your home. Locally, being in close proximity, or globally from anywhere in the world using our specially designed Wi-Fi adapter.
   
The optional Wi-Fi adapter enables you to access Teodoor safely via the internet any time. Teodoor works perfectly without, and you can always upgrade later. The Wi-Fi adapter requires a wireless internet connection, a power source, and must be in the general proximity of Teodoor in order to communicate properly (approx. 30 ft or 10 m).
   
The Wi-Fi Adapter is available with two different socket plugs: type A (widely used in North and Central America), and type C (rest of the world). 
 
 
   
Listed beneath are all the available packages you are able to get through our Kickstarter campaign. Teodoor will retail for $179 and the Wi-Fi Adapter for $69.
   
   
 
 
     
 
Along with Teodoor, you will receive a set batteries (CR123A - commonly sold worldwide) that will last for over a year. Teodoor sends you a notification when they are almost empty. Swapping them is a breeze.
    
      We’ve developed several prototypes over the past two years to ensure we can deliver the best experience possible, before coming to Kickstarter. No empty promises!
   
Below is a demo of our prototypes, showing locking/unlocking via the testing app, then manually unlocking and locking. The second video shows hands-free unlocking.
PLAY


  PLAY

   
     
 
   
We're a young team of experts, a collective of developers and creatives, who trusts to have built the best and most sophisticated smart lock on the market. We trust to deliver what the costumer needs. Through hard work and long working hours we managed to get to this point
 
Our vision is to bring Teodoor on every front door, in spite of all different locking standards out there.
Kind thanks to our advisors and partners.
The team:
Martin Koterle, Kristjan Ugrin, Žiga Godina, Rok Kozel, Nejc Matjaž, Miha Prijatelj, Jan Jagodič, Rok Pernus, Grega Logar, Radovan Obal, Melana Kreslin, Samo Novinšek, Rikardo Komen.
Special thanks to:
Marko Koterle, Mak Kordić, Karim Shalaby, Anže Miklavec, Niko Klanšek, Blaž Zupan, Nastja Šimunić.
  This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We developed several working prototypes before coming to Kickstarter. Developing and delivering high technology hardware is no easy task, so we teamed up with an array of experts who have successfully delivered Kickstarted hardware products, and engineers with extensive experience in mass production scenarios. Teodoor was designed specifically with simplicity and mass production in mind, from the ground up; the latest prototype iteration ensures it’s easy to manufacture (and repair) and is built to last. With all of this in mind and on the table, we’re confident we can stay well within the timeline specified.

Now we need your backing, to overcome the last pre-production challenge in the process before manufacture: cost. And because we practice full transparency in everything we do, we’ll be providing regular updates and keeping you posted of any and all developments.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: We are sorry for the late update. We were wrong for not replying promptly to all of your messages and releasing more frequent updates. The project was underestimated in terms of how much time and funds were needed to be allocated for testing and fixing different types of issues. This project is very much alive, a few new team members joined recently for different roles and we still have 1950 units in storage, waiting to be fixed and shipped.

updates.update_userinfo: Feedback received on the first units
updates.update_content: As stated in the previous update in the past weeks we were heavily occupied with the assembly. It is taking way longer than anticipated to assemble everything. We are taking care to make sure everything is assembled correctly, so there will be fewer issues later. After assembling most of the first batch we've realized a lot of the parts can be optimized and improved for a faster and more streamlined assembly. This will mostly help us in future batches as we will keep improving the design of the parts in question.

We had an update prepared for last Wednesday, but the parts did not arrive. We were notified (on Wednesday morning, even though we were in contact with them multiple times a week) it would take longer as they had a backlog of orders to finish first. Sadly we didn’t have much choice but to wait. It was promised, that they will be ready to pick up by today with a slightly larger batch.
And they were. Finally. We carefully inspected and picked them up this morning. They are perfect. We had previously scheduled the anodizing (color & protection for the aluminum) for the end of the previous week. Thankfully the company that will anodize them was understanding of our situation and will do it tomorrow, even though we've missed our reserved schedule. On Monday the parts will be electropolished, and on Tuesday we will start the assembly. Yes, finally! We have no idea how many we will be able to assemble daily, but we will ramp up production speed as the days go on. This is the first time Teodoor will be assembled in quantities larger than 5.

This is going to be a brief update, just refreshing everyone on the status of the approaching assembly.
In approximately 10 days, we should start receiving the missing parts and start the assembly. We'll let you know of any changes if they happen. We've been in contact with the contractors and as of right now everything is on schedule on their end.

For the past few weeks, we were mostly going back and forth with the changes on the aluminum slider. As explained in the previous update due to the changes on the driving gears we had to do some changes on the circular aluminum slider that attaches to it. The PCBs are ok now.
As the machining time finally approached we were notified that the parts may suffer some scuffs during the machining. We made some precautions in order to minimize this and reduce the post-processing needed. As this process started the outside of parts were getting heavily damaged. Due to this, we had to machine the exterior again and reapply the anodization. This was time consuming, costly and the final parts were far from perfect. After doing a small series we tried more iterations (even with different shops), but they all ended up with a similar result. This is why we've decided (this week) that it's better to just order new parts - the cost is similar but they will look way better, just like the cover. The aluminum is on order and we are negotiating with the subcontractor to prepare the parts as soon as the material arrives. They will probably finish it in batches (so we can ship them faster - as soon as they arrive). ETA for the first batch is 3 weeks (mostly waiting for the materials the sequent batches will be sent out faster).

As promised we’ll be doing more frequent updates as the shipping approaches.
As stated in the previous update we’ve started the assembly process. During this, we’ve discovered that one of the custom gears (plastic molded part) was subpar. The outer wall wasn’t straight which would lead to slippage of the aluminum slider over time. We did another mold test run with different parameters but it still wasn’t up to our standards. Due to this, we had to change it a bit which requires modifying the tooling. Yesterday we received the edited part of a prototype run and it was perfectly straight! A full run will be done in the upcoming week. This also requires us to do some changes on the aluminum mounting parts.

updates.update_userinfo: May Update & Last call for surveys
updates.update_content:
We are finally approaching assembly! The electronics are scheduled to be complete this week. We will require an additional 1-2 weeks to test them properly and flash them with the latest software (like stated in the previous update). We’ll start assembling Teodoor Smart Locks next week in order to have everything prepared when the programmed and tested electronics arrive.
We are still missing 1 part that was not finished in time. It should be arriving late next week. Everything else is ready and waiting for the assembly.

We are waiting for the App Store review process to finish (we forgot some things the first try and it was declined). As soon as it's approved (I think tomorrow or the day after tomorrow will be accepted if everything is ok now) we start sending them out. Also as the app is accepted an update will go out. campaign.story:
“A father and son’s quixotic quest to bring back a lost ecosystem—and save the world.'"      -Science Magazine
“If Nikita has his way, Pleistocene Park will spread across Arctic Siberia and into North America, helping to slow the thawing of the Arctic permafrost.” - The Atlantic
“Zimov wants to answer some fundamental questions about the impact early modern humans had on the environment, and in the meantime he might just help to save the planet.”      - New Scientist
From Nikita Zimov, director of the Pleistocene Park.
Arctic permafrost is melting. It will trigger catastrophic global warming. We’re creating a northern Serengeti to stop that from happening.
Pleistocene Park is a proof of concept, a public demonstration, a landscape scale art project and a philosophy of rational co-existence between humans and nature.
Here in the most remote corner of Siberia my father, Sergey Zimov, and I are reviving the ice age “Mammoth Steppe” ecosystem. Re-wilding this vast area of the Arctic will not only create a northern Serengeti, but most importantly, today, is a vital tool to mitigate global climate change. As climate warms, permafrost here in the Arctic is starting to melt. It will soon unlock huge carbon stocks and trigger a catastrophic global warming feedback loop. Natural grasslands, maintained by numerous grazing animals, have the capacity to both slow climate warming and prevent permafrost from melting.
Me, Nikita Zimov, and my father, Sergey Zimov
We’ve already starting transforming the land, with our real world prototype.
For the past 20 years my family has spent a big portion of our time and all available finances to create Pleistocene Park. Currently we have over 70 large herbivores in the Park, including cold adapted Yakutian horses, moose, musk ox, reindeer, and European bison. These animals have shown that it is possible to transform ecosystems and reestablish high productivity grasslands by reintroducing large herbivores. 
 We have fenced 20 square kilometers of land, built infrastructure and installed monitoring equipment. To bring animals to the Park we have mounted extreme expeditions ourselves. We traveled by small boat through the Arctic Ocean to Wrangel Island and from the Mongolian border with a 4x4 military transport truck, driving thousands of kilometers on frozen rivers through roadless wilderness.
Bison and musk ox at the Pleistocene Park
To stand a chance of mitigating global warming on a much bigger scale we need your help to take the park to the next level!
However, for mitigating global warming, the size of the Park is not enough. This crowdfunding campaign is our first attempt to invite other people to participate in our project and an important step towards turning the modern Arctic into a northern Serengeti and stop permafrost degradation on a big scale.
Join us in creating a world where we harness nature to protect the planet we live on.
With this campaign, we plan to establish populations of bison and yaks in the Arctic.  We will transport them from their current home near the city of Perm in European Russia to the farthest point a road reaches on the Eurasian continent.  From there they will travel by barge down the Kolyma river to the Pleistocene Park.  Future plans are to extend populations of these animals far beyond the borders of Pleistocene Park.
Location of the Pleistocene Park
Even with growing alarm about global warming, the problem only gets worse. At best, governments of the world are taking  symbolic actions while global emissions of greenhouse gasses continue to increase. Here at my home in the Arctic, changes are coming so fast, it’s obvious to everybody. We are rapidly approaching a tipping point when continued warming will become unstoppable. It is too late to wait for others to deal with this. Even if restoring the Mammoth Steppe will not solve all of our climate change problems, it will prevent a worst-case scenario of runaway warming for the next generation and beyond. That is our goal, and we are working to achieve it! If you want to join our efforts, please support this Kickstarter campaign!
Selected Media reports about Pleistocene Park:
Here is a list of media which wrote or filmed about Pleistocene Park. The list is not complete, so please excuse if something is missing.
The Atlantic Magazine/Vice on HBO (to be released March 10 2017) (Preview)/National Geographic/BBC Radio/BBC News/New Yorker/New York Times/Science Magazine 1/Science Magazine 2/Science Magazine 3/NBC/ARD (1st German Television)/WDR/Scientific American/New Scientist/Business Insider/The Telegraph/Wired/Independent/Geocurrents/Live Science/How It Works/Der Spiegel/Siberian Times/Mysterious Universe/Daily Galaxy/Aljazeera/La Republica/24Heures/Ottawa Life/ABC/Stanford Magazine/TED Talk 1/TED Talk 2
An artists rendering of what the mammoth steppe looked like
What is Pleistocene Park reviving? 
During the last Ice Age, steppes with millions of mammoths, bison, horses, reindeers, tigers, wolves and numerous other animals occupied vast landscapes, spanning from Spain to Canada and from the Arctic islands to China.
Being the world biggest biome, mammoth steppe was as productive as the modern African savannah. These remains we collected on 1 hectare of eroded permafrost. Almost 30 big herbivores were roaming on each square kilometer of these endless pastures.
  These vast herds maintained their pastures by cycling nutrients, promoting grass and herb growth, and dramatically increasing the productivity of the pastures. Looking at the modern low productive vegetation and few animals in the Arctic, it is hardly possible for people to imagine such animal densities could exist in this place in the past. With the end the last Ice Age, the first humans came to this place and quickly killed most animals, driving many species extinct, and destroying the fragile symbiosis between plants and animals. Without herbivores, grasses could not compete with moss or shrubs. A few centuries later this ecosystem was gone forever. Now, for the first time in 10,000 years, we are bringing together animals which once roamed this place. Unfortunately not all the species made it to modern times, but we are trying to collect an animal assemblage which would restore the ecological function of the Mammoth Steppe.
  These animals are roaming together for the first time in 10 thousand years
  Melting Permafrost
The Arctic is rapidly getting warmer and permafrost is starting to thaw. On a local scale it means destruction of houses, roads and power lines. In addition, it means death to all modern Arctic ecosystems – the ground collapses, trees topple, canyons and depressions form, and Arctic rivers turn into mud flows with the destruction of fish populations.
However, the global impact of permafrost degradation is even greater. Permafrost contains twice as much carbon as the earth’s atmosphere. When it thaws microbes transform this organic material into carbon dioxide and methane, creating a massive source of greenhouse gases, thus amplifying global warming to an even greater extent.
Melting permafrost at Duvanii Yar. On the right you can see 30,000 year old roots of grass that will decompose and contribute to global warming.
  Methane bubbles from degrading permafrost trapped under ice (left). My father lighting methane on fire (right)
 How can restoring a lost Ice Age ecosystem mitigate global warming?
There are several mechanisms by which great herds of herbivores, once again roaming the Arctic, can cool the climate and reduce the amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.
Herds of herbivores will prevent permafrost from melting. To make permafrost colder, all that is needed is to remove heat insulating snow cover, and expose the ground to the extreme negative temperatures of the Arctic. In the steppe ecosystems, animal density is so high that animals looking for forage trample all the snow in the pastures several times per winter. This compacts the snow, massively reducing its heat insulating abilities.
This shows how animals trample snow and reduce its insulating value, making the soil colder
Grasses through the process of photosynthesis absorb carbon dioxide (strong greenhouse gas) from the atmosphere and preserve it in the form of roots. Cold Arctic soils assure that decomposition is low and roots do not decay for decades, centuries, or millennia. This creates a small but sustainable mechanism to partially absorb human emissions of greenhouse gases. The size of this is of course much smaller than our current human impact, but it is at least a step in the right direction.
Vast steppes allow direct cooling of the climate by increasing albedo. Grasslands are much lighter in color than shrublands and forests. Therefore, they reflect a greater portion of direct sunlight energy back into space without transforming it into heat (albedo effect). This effect is especially pronounced in the early spring, when the sun is already active in the Arctic – dark forests absorb heat, while steppes are covered with snow and remain white. This is also why the Arctic Ocean is warming as the Polar ice caps melt.
Difference in colour between grasslands and forest in different seasons.
These animated slides showing ecological effects of promoting steppes, was kindly provided by Revive & Restore, designed by Ben J. Novak
PLAY

 Why is Pleistocene Park asking for crowdfunding help? 
Up to this date, Pleistocene Park was an experiment created solely from the labor and funds of my father, my family and me, which we obtained from running the remote Arctic research station.
However, if we want to create a tool that will help us mitigate global warming, we have to take the Park to a totally different level. For that we need other people to participate in our project. For this purpose we have established the Pleistocene Park Foundation, Inc, which is a non-profit based in Pennsylvania, USA, to facilitate the development and implementation the Pleistocene Park ideas across the world. The Foundation is also charged with the goal to raise funds to the science and logistics behind this promising idea.
Using our tank to build the fence at Pleistocene Park.
What we will do: 
The specific scope of this campaign is to bring herds of bison and yaks to Pleistocene Park in the spring and summer of 2017. We will buy several American plains bison from a little reserve near the city of Perm, in the central part of Russia. Yaks will be bought in the republic of Tuva, on the border with Mongolia in southern Siberia. Using heavy duty trucks we will drive animals to one of the farthest parts of Siberia reachable by road, the village of Seimchan, 500 km west of Magadan. This distance is similar to driving round trip from San Francisco to New York. In Seimchan we will load animals on the first barge to navigate the Kolyma River after the winter ice recedes. After a few days on the river we will arrive in Pleistocene Park near the town of Cherskii, close to the point where the Kolyma empties into the Arctic Ocean.
  The Route we will take from Perm to Pleistocene Park
How will the Kickstarter money be spent? 
Our goal is to raise 106,000 dollars. This is the minimum we need to:
Purchase animals; 
Purchase and preparation of containers for animal transport; 
Rent 2 big trucks for transportation to Seimchan; 
River ship transportation fee from Seimchan to Cherskii; 
Small barge rental for 40km transportation from the port in Cherskii to the Pleistocene Park pier. 
Purchasing food for the animals for the duration of the trip; 
Miscellaneous trip expenses, including 2-3 people travelling with the animals, 
Expense of manufacturing and delivery of Kickstarter rewards 
Taxes, bank and legal fees
  Bison and yaks are the goal for this campaign
  Rewards we prepared for our supporters
Push goals and long-term development plans
Creation of the ecosystem is a complicated task, which would require lots of work and investments. Below we created a list of funding goals for Pleistocene Park to develop in the future. We are in hope that some of them would be possible within this campaign.
$200,000 We will also bring elk from Tuva to Pleistocene Park. This will involve another truck, driver, and more animal food. 
$300,000 We will also purchase 20 Yakutian horses. We will purchase at least 40 reindeer. We will bring additional forage and improve fencing and other infrastructure to support these animals.
$600,000 We will launch an expedition to bring a herd of at least 20 musk ox. We will explore other options of Arctic adapted animals and bring them. We will improve infrastructure to support the additional animals.
$1,000,000 We will extend the Pleistocene Park in every direction. There will be more land, more animals introduced, more people participating in our project.
$3,000,000 We will complete the ecosystem by introducing enough animal to maintain predators in the Park. Once there sustainable populations of herbivores in the Park are established, we will introduce predators: wolves and potentially Amur tigers.
$10,000,000 + We will transport 1000+ bison by ship to the Pleistocene Park region. This is the scale that will be necessary to begin fully implementing restoration of the high productive steppes and stabilize melting permafrost on a large scale.
$1 billion  is the rough estimate of the total price for our civilization to restore real wild nature on a continental scale and have actual impact on climate. While not a small amount of money it is one of the largest environmental impacts possible for a sum well within the budget of a wealthy individual or a corporation. Large infrastructure projects like bridges, dams or clean energy programs are in this range or larger.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Transportation of Animals to the Pleistocene Park:

We have prepared a logistical plan which will allow safe and comfortable trip for the animals. This is our 6th expedition to bring animals to Pleistocene Park. Some of these trips have been longer and more complicated and all have been successful. 

All animals in this trip will be transported in individual stalls within big containers. They will have enough space to stand up and lay down for rest. The design of the containers will allow animals to have access to enough fresh air, water and forage. The route and timing of the expedition will be planned to avoid extra hot temperatures. Trucks would drive for 5 hours in the morning, then animals will get rest for 2 hours, with 5 more hours drive in the afternoon. We will hire a veterinarian to drive with me in the "support car" all the way from Perm to Pleistocene Park to assure in-time care for all the animals. 

Adaptation of Animals in the Pleistocene Park.

In order to keep our kickstarter budget reasonable we did not include any of the expenses for the adaptation of the animals in their first year in the Park. However I have already committed to invest my personal resources in proper animal care. This will include:

- Full time salary for the ranger with veterinary education;
- Transportation of forage to the Park to supply animals in the winter period;
-- Construction of shelter/shelters to allow animals to adapt to the cold in the autumn/winter period.

Rewards: 

We are working with reputable and well established manufactures to produce our rewards so risk is minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Travel with the bison
support.descp:
That is our most prestigious reward for those who donate $20,000 or more. Since kickstarter does not allow more than $10,000 pledge amount, you wil have to make two donations here.
I will take you with us, on our journey to bring animals! We will start from Ural mountains and cross entire Russia on trucks and ships to reach our destination – Pleistocene Park. And there we will spend a week exploring the Arctic!
Honestly, even for me this upcoming journey will fall into top 3 biggest experiences of my life. I will not promise it will be an easy trip, and will not promise you will enjoy its every moment, but I guarantee you the experience of your life. Many years from now, your grandkids will chase you asking to retell that story once again.

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers!
We successfully brought 12 bison to the Pleistocene Park last spring, They are doing really good and adapting to the new environment. Happy to say that they deal with any type of cold very good, and feel comfortable even at -50C.
Yesterday we started new crowdfunding campaign to support our project. This time it is Patreon. You are all welcome to participate and please share the word about it.

Dear backers
This is our last update on kickstarter in the frames of this campaign. Two years later but we achieved a kickstarter goal. This goal we had for more than 20 years. Bison are finally roaming in the Pleistocene Park!
In order to do that we drove 13000 kilometers and then went on a barge for another 1500 kilometers.

updates.update_userinfo: Bison are coming to the Pleistocene Park!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
After a long silence from our side, I would love to announce that we are finally getting bison to the Pleistocene Park. We been promising it would work many times, so this time we kept our mouth shut, not to jinx anything. 
On the 5th of May we have loaded 12 american steppe bison at the Ditlevsdal Bison Farm in Denmark. On 7th of May bison successfully passed the Russian border and the custom and now we are travelling with them through Russia.

updates.update_userinfo: Alaska bison will not fly. We will try again in the spring.
updates.update_content:
From Luke:
Dear Kickstarter backers,
(Apologies if you are getting this twice buy if so thank you for supporting both of our campaigns.)  
Our 12 baby bison will not fly to Pleistocene Park this year. We exhausted all plausible options and a few fantastic options as well. Last week Nikita made the decision to pull the plug once and for all. Joe Burgess, the manager of the bison farm, released the bison from the quarantine pen earlier this week to join the rest of the herd out in the larger pasture. The bison will be fine. They are mostly females and the bison farm is growing their herd so they will most likely live a long life there.

updates.update_userinfo: Bison still in Alaska, Aiming To Fly Them To Siberia In Late September
updates.update_content:
Update from Luke:
Pleistocene Park, August 22nd 
If you got this update twice I apologize for that.  It means you are one of our "supper backers" who supported both our Kickstarter and Indigogo campaigns.  Double thank you!

updates.update_userinfo: One more chance to support our work!
updates.update_content:
Dear All!
As you may already know we are working on getting bison to the Pleistocene Park.
From the original plan which we had a year ago we have moved quiet a bit. Bison are coming from Alaska and number of animals is doubled. In order to make that happen we started another campaign. This time on Indiegogo. Campaign will end in a day, so it is a last call to help us with our work. The sum we raised is already helping us to move forward with flying bison but we would highly appreciate more support.

updates.update_userinfo: Final video of Yak trip/ Support our new campaign.
updates.update_content:
Hi All, 
Here is our final video update from the yak trip.  It's mostly just shots of happy yaks eating grass in Pleistocene Park.  Although there is a little surprise in there.  
https://vimeo.com/269305465

Here is the second to last video update from the "Trans Siberia Yak Rodeo".  This shows the yaks arriving in the park.  The final video (Happy Yaks Exploring Their New Home) will be coming shortly.  
You can also watch some footage from our current expedition to bring bison by going to our live Indigogo campaign.  (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bison-to-save-the-world--2/x/18559030#/)  where we are raising funds to charter then aircraft to fly the bison to the park.  Please share this new campaign with anybody who you think will be interested.

Dear Backers
Last year you helped this kickstarter campaign to happen. Your support has allowed Pleistocene Park to make a significant step forward. We have already brought yaks to the Park, and with your help have advanced in bringing bison.
Right now, we are working on that task. We finally settled with the exact bison we are taking. Twelve 1-year old bison are already in the quarantine for export in the Delta Junction, Alaska. We want to thank American Native tribe Stevens Village for collaborating with us, and willingness to sell their animals for our restoration project. However now we are asking for your support again.

campaign.story:
Do you have a difficult time splitting wood? We have a solution for you. Splitting wood has always been a hard nut to crack and dangerous as well. That's why we invented a product which will make such a task go smoothly. 
PLAY

We have combined cutting-edge technology and traditional metalworking to produce a superior designer tool. Shavlog is made of iron and that gives it virtual indestructibility and strength.  
A larger part of it is made by hand, using the old, tried and tested procedures. Despite that, we have also made it light enough, so anyone can use it. Shavlog will also beautifully decorate your patio, workshop or even a space in the house next to the fireplace, where it will garner envious glances from the neighbours.
 The blade is a very special story in and of itself: it is our innovation. It is cut by a machine to give a kind of a curve that gives the best results. We took the shape of the blade from the axe and its strength was further increased with tempering as used for the best kind of blades in the world.
Working with Shavlog is as easy as 1, 2, 3. We open the safety, set on a step, and press to make the kindling fly. It is also very fast because you don’t have to lean constantly to collect the cut pieces and put them back on the block. 
We added an oak handle to the iron blade, which is very useful at work and gives the Shavlog a unique appearance. We coated the handle with different kinds of natural lacquer to make it perfect. 

30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Shavlog community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or colleague who needs to enjoy life and
share our campaign!
You can use it anytime you want – whether you want to burn through the supply of wood or perhaps make fire and make a delicious meal for your family and friends.
Using Shavlog is not limited by seasons. You can use it everywhere and anytime. During the summer, you can use it to split wood for a delicious barbecue party, or for an open fire while you enjoy with your friends talking about future and life experiences under the stars. Moreover, it is indispensable in winter because you can use wood, which you split with Shavlog, to start a fire and get warm.
We are a team of young people who are passionate about finding different solutions or improving the existent designs. With our bodies and souls, we are devoted to what we do.
This project is our very first one, but definitely not the last. We are full of ideas that are going to be brought to life to make your life happier and easier.

The funding we will gather during this project are going to be used for finishing and delivering Shavlogs to all backers and to purchase some indispensable tools we need for realization of new ideas, which will render you speechless.
PLAY


Dear backers, we deeply appreciate your trust and we thank you in advance.  
Your whole family will thank you for the effortless work because you will soon be able to reap the results of Shavlog, which will make your life easier and help you save on time, which you could spend with your loved ones.
Shavlog can also be a very ingenious gift, which will never be left useless. It won't take much of your space.
One of the biggest advantages Shavlog offers is that it is far safer from either knife or axe. What is even better is that no quick movements need to be made while using it and that's what gives our product a great advantage. You simply cannot make imprecise movements with it.
PLAY

Even people with less strength and dexterity will not have a difficult time splitting wood with Shavlog.
See the variety of rewards we offer below and let us know if you have any questions or special requests. We love talking to you!
Elvis Halilovic / ONDU - Business advisor
Niko Klansek / FLYKLY- Business advisor
Aleksander Stern - Video making
Rado Mulej - Narrator
Anja Zupan - Editing and translation
Emil Kreft - Wood designer and advisor
Sandi Nemec - Iron designer and advisor
Hanna Turnsek, Valerija Turnsek, Bono Jovanovic, Milan Čadej and many more!
Dejan Jovanovic - Web designer / Web marketing / Product development
Vilko Beukovic - Logistics / Production / Product development
Mark Beukovic - Text writer / Social networker
Martina Jezernik - Web advertising
Nika Beukovic - Social networker
PLAY
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project itself is demanding. We were full of enthusiasm doing the Shavlog project and results were consequently above and beyond all expectations. 
This project was carried out very wisely because of our dedication and it has come to an end, but if we exceed our expectations, we still have some great functions for Shavlog, which can be added to the product and make it even better for the backers. 
Even though this is our first project, we have prepared well for it. We signed contracts with external collaborators as with other companies, which will help us transport Shavlogs all over the globe. Furthermore, we have also made packaging for the product. We have thought about almost everything so the project can go like clockwork. 
We also realize that something unexpected can always take place, like bad weather. We will always be open for everything you want to know and solve possible challenges at short notice.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter campaign is over, but you can still get a MAKERbuino. Head over to makerbuino.com/shop for more info and to place an order.
Ever wanted to build your own game console? MAKERbuino is what you need!
MAKERbuino is:
a game console
DIY - do it yourself
educational
fun
8-bit
portable
cool
open-source
Arduino powered
customizable
This neat little device is an open source handheld game device you can build yourself (it’s fully DIY). Besides that, MAKERbuino is also an educational device shaped like a game console.
MAKERbuino - a DIY game console
  MAKERbuino - a DIY game console
It comes in a kit form (not assembled) - you get a box with all the electronic components necessary for building your own portable game machine.
To build your own MAKERbuino the only things you'll need are some basic tools and an interest in technology.
You'll get a bunch of electronic components needed for building your own game console
  Yep, you can build your own handheld game console from scratch
This device is based on easy-to-find components and programmed in Arduino – one of the most popular DIY microcontroller platforms. It's open-source, hackable and easily customizable with additional hardware components and custom casings.
MAKERbuino is an educational device disguised in the shape of a game console. Its purpose: to motivate people to explore, learn and create something new in a fun and interesting way.
  MAKERbuino’s price equals the price of an average newly released game console video game. The idea is: instead of buying your kid, a nephew, a sibling or a friend a video game, you can buy him/her a MAKERbuino for the same price and motivate him/her to learn something new and enter the wonderful world of DIY electronics.
MAKERbuino kit costs around the price of just one average video game
  Forget the newest iPhone or the latest PlayStation, you will be the main hipster around after you show this one to your friends - a game console you've built and customized yourself! 
OK, it has a low-res screen and 2kB of RAM but you've made it with your own two hands, it's unique, it's retro, it's cool.
    Electronics is easy... really! We're in the 21st century... teenagers build their own game consoles at home using online tutorials and cheap components from china. Try building your own game console, you'll see how much fun it is.
  You'll need some basic tools and equipment for assembling your MAKERbuino:
regular soldering iron (nothing super expensive is required) and some solder
diagonal cutter pliers
regular screwdriver
desoldering vacuum pump (optional, but is really helpful if you make a mistake in soldering)
If you're a maker, you probably already have these tools.
If you're a maker-to-be and still don't have these tools, don't worry, we've got you covered. We've prepared a special version of the MAKERbuino kit that comes with required tools included. Check out the rewards section (at the bottom of the listing) for more info about the available kit versions.
  YES, we love Arduino.
MAKERbuino is based on ATmgea328p-pu - the same chip used on Arduino UNO board.
Therefore, it's programmed in Arduino IDE (based on C/C++) – the most popular programming environment for makers.
MAKERbuino is compatible with numerous Arduino related examples of manipulating various hardware and software components. In fact, it's compatible with all Arduino UNO software libraries available online and will work with many Arduino shields and modules with minimal or no library code modifications.
  Gamebuino is like a MAKERbuino, only a bit smaller. The biggest difference: it comes already assembled and is made out of tiny components that were pre-soldered by robots. It's an alternative for the ones that are afraid of getting their fingers burnt with a soldering iron.

Gamebuino was crowdfunded on Indiegogo back in 2014. It's a project made by Aurelien Rodot and it served as a great inspiration for the creation of MAKERbuino.
In 2016 we connected with Aurelien (on a Maker Faire, of course) and he helped us make MAKERbuino happen.
The best thing, MAKERbuino is 100% compatible with Gamebuino's vast collection of open-source games and its programming library.
MAKERbuino is fully compatible with Gamebuino's vast library of open-source games
              The MAKERbuino kit comes with an SD card loaded with numerous fun retro games which you can play as soon as you assemble your MAKERbuino. More games can be downloaded from an online MAKERbuino games gallery.

Every game in the games gallery is open-source and available with a downloadable Arduino source code along with a compiled .HEX file.
In other words, you can take a look at the code of every MAKERbuino compatible game, learn something new, change the code and implement parts of the game code in your own game project.

You can make your own games using our Arduino library and share them with other makers on the MAKERbuino games gallery. Our programming toolkit along with our Arduino library was made especially for programming video games using Arduino IDE.
It makes easy to:
develop in-game menus and other GUI-related content
play and develop sound FX and background music
draw, display and animate bitmaps
emulate MAKERbuino games on your PC
                               Playing games on a game console you've made is fun. But you know what's even more fun: having a multiplayer gaming party on retro DIY game consoles.
You heard it, MAKERbuino game consoles can connect with link cables, exchange data, and play multiplayer games.
The consoles communicate using i2c communication - a type of communication protocol used to interface microcontrollers with sensors and other microcontrollers.
Since i2c is serial, you can chain more than 2 MAKERbuino consoles together using link cables. Theoretically, you can connect up to 128 MAKERbuinos together and make a massive multiplayer match.
  MAKERbuino's detailed build guide leads you through the process of building your own game console. Here you can check out our current build guide used for beta tester kits.
We've designed the build guide with the purpose of teaching you something new, not only showing you how to assemble things. Every now and then, the build guide gives you some useful and educational info about the things your are doing (e.g: "Now you have to find a 10k resistor and place it on the spot marked R2. This is what the resistors look like.... Resistors are used for.... This is how you read a resistor....).
Who is this kit for?
Based on our experience, an 11-year-old kid should be able to assemble a MAKERbuino kit with a tiny bit of help from an adult. Therefore, the estimated age group is 11+.
Estimated build time: 5 hours. Build time varies and depends on the skills of the person and if the person has ever soldered before.
The build time will be significantly less if you're a skilled maker.
Building the MAKERbuino kit is just the beginning. After that you'll spend numerous hours creating your own games and experimenting with hardware.

This kit was designed to be assembled as easy as possible. However, if you have never soldered before, it might be a good idea to get some practice first.
Nevertheless, with enough patience and care, a total newbie can assemble this kit by precisely following these build instructions.
What you'll learn with MAKERbuino
how to solder 
what are the basic electronic components and what are their functions 
how can electronic components be connected and why
what are microcontrollers and some basics of digital electronics
how to program a microcontroller in C/C++
what are 3D printers and how to modify and design your own unique 3D printed casing
how to extend beyond MAKERbuino’s capabilities by adding various expansion modules
Let's get down to MAKERbuino's details!
Standard MAKERbuino kit comes with all the electronic components needed for building your own handheld game console:
MAKERbuino PCB
laser CNC cut acrylic casing (has three pieces)  
ATmega328P-PU microcontroller
28 pin IC socket (for the ATmega328)  
Nokia 5110 graphic LCD breakout board
Li-Po charger board with micro USB port (TP4056 charging circuit)
Li-Po battery, 3.7V, 600mAh with male JST connector
female JST battery connector  
128MB SD card preloaded with games (for storing, loading and streaming files and programs)  
SD socket
16Mhz crystal
3.3v voltage regulator (MCP1702-3302E)
4 pin angle anti-reverse pin header (for i2c ports) x2
3.5mm headphone socket
2N2222A NPN transistor
100uF capacitor x3
100nf capacitor x2
22pf capacitor x2
100Ω resistor
10kΩ resistor x2
4.7kΩ resistor x2
2kΩ resistor
1kΩ trim-potentiometer x2
1N4148 diode 
big clicky pushbutton with corresponding button cap x7
mini slide toggle switch x2
8Ω, 0.5W, 28mm diameter speaker
ISP port angle header pins
Serial port angle header pins
Breakout port angle header pins  
FTDI USB to rs232 adapter board (a board for conneccting your MAKERbuino to the computer)  
set of screws, nuts and spacers needed for fixating the screen and the casing
Let's talk tech specs:
CPU: ATmega328 @ 16MHz (same MCU used in Arduino UNO)
Display: Nokia 5110 84x48 monochrome graphic LCD /w white backlight (adjustable with a built in potentiometer)
Sound: 0.5W speaker with 4-channel audio generation, 3.5mm headphone connector, hardware volume control 
Input: 7 pushbuttons with replaceable button caps (D-pad + ABC buttons) 
Storage: 32kB of FLASH program memory, 2kB of RAM, up to 2GB SD card for loading and saving programs (HEX files) and data
Communication: serial UART port, i2c, SPI
Battery: single cell LiPo, 3.7V, 600mAh, charged with your regular micro USB smartphone charger 
Dimensions: approx. 13cm x 6cm x 2.5cm (depending on the casing, hacks, mods, expansions…)
MAKERbuino has a special bootloader that allows you to store and load programs from an SD card.
Unlike a regular Arduino UNO board, MAKERbuino can have multiple games and programs saved on the SD card in the form of .HEX files, which can then be selected and loaded in MAKERbuino's FLASH memory.
Since MAKERbuino's .HEX files are pretty small compared to an SD card's size, you can literally store hundreds of games and/or programs on your MAKERbuino. 
Every MAKERbuino kit comes with an SD card preloaded with numerous fun games and programs so that you can try your game console out as soon as you assemble it.
Sometimes sh*t happens while building stuff. You lose a component, you overheat or break something, a diode falls onto your carpet and you can’t find it anymore… We get it, that’s why we'll give you some extra components in your kit.
If you lose or break a component which isn't doubled in the package or if you're having trouble assembling your own MAKERbuino kit, notify us with a polite email and we’ll send you some extra components for minimal or no cost and help you with the build process.
MAKERbuino is fully customizable. Make your game console unique. Change the button caps, craft or 3D print a custom casing, add some expansion modules and make your MAKERbuino light up with a few blinking LEDs... We can't wait to see what your MAKERbuino will look like.
    See all that pin headers on the MAKERbuino board? They're used for connecting hardware add-ons. MAKERbuino is based on Arduino UNO. Therefore, it's compatible with lots of hardware expansion modules. You can easily plug in some LEDs , switches and photoresistors or some more complicated modules like accelerometers, gyroscopes or RF transceivers...
MAKERbuino was meant to be hacked. Our goal is to encourage people to become creative makers and explorers of the wonderful world of DIY electronics. MAKERbuino allows you to develop your hardware and software skills. Make video games, explore new hardware solutions, learn from numerous tutorials and share your work with the community. Change the button caps, code a Pokemon-like video game, connect a GPS module, turn your MAKERbuino into a robot car…get creative.
MAKERbuino's software is fully open-source and available for you to download.
MAKERbuino's hardware's schematics along with the bill of materials are also open-source and available online.
That means that you can use our documentation to build your own MAKERbuino clones on a breadboard, experiment with our hardware design using the provided documentation and schematics and create your own MAKERbuino compatible boards and modules. 
We need your help to mass produce the MAKERbuino!
For over a year we have been working on prototypes, collecting feedback from beta testers and learning about design and manufacturing.
Finally, we are ready to show our project on Kickstarter and we need you to get enough orders and collect enough money to produce MAKERbuino kits for everyone.
    MAKERbuino kit with tools
As described in the list above, this kit comes with diagonal cutter pliers, a screwdriver, some solder, a solder sucker, and a neat USB soldering iron.
Fun fact: this soldering iron is light, small and portable and can be plugged in a USB power bank so that you can solder on the go.
 MAKERbuino inventor's kit
This kit is for more advance users. It comes with a set of MAKERbuino compatible hardware components, some wires and a breadboard.

You'll get an i2c GPIO expander and a gyroscope & accelerometer module so that you can expand MAKERbuino's hardware capabilities.
Assembled MAKERbuino
Building MAKERbuino is a great experience and we highly recommend you to try it out. Maybe you'll get addicted to DIY electronics, who knows. Despite that, we understand that not everybody loves soldering and would like a MAKERbuino just to program games for it.... we respect that. 
We'll send you a fully functional assembled MAKERbuino so that you can get down to programming right away.
Educational packs
You want to organize a group MAKERbuino making party or a workshop, great!
We'll help you out by providing our educational material, workshop plans, worksheets and the experience we've gained with organizing MAKERbuino test workshops.
MAKERbuino's design is ready for manufacturing. The kits will be assembled at our headquarters in Croatia and controlled directly by us. We have sourced all the needed components and made deals with our components suppliers and PCB manufacturers.
We will start the production of MAKERbuino kits 10 days after the start of the crowdfunding campaign after we see the market's reaction.

Thus, we plan to ship the rewards really fast:  
early bird rewards will be shipped in April 2017
regular rewards will be shipped in May 2017
Until we ship the rewards, we will continue polishing MAKERbuino's software, documentation and tutorials and expand its library of games.
Every MAKERbuino kit is packed by hand in Croatia – a tiny country located in Central and Southeast Europe.
Croatia is popular for its seaside and Game of Thrones being filmed in it (google it), but it also has some pretty smart entrepreneurs living in it (and they help us make MAKERbuino happen).
Albert Gajšak
MAKERbuino kits were designed by me.
I’m an 18-year-old student from Croatia and I really like electronics and programming. I started developing the MAKERbuino 3 years ago. It all started as a weekend project and recently turned into something more. All of this is possible thanks to supporters like you (thanks again) and the support of my family and other helpers:
 Emil Gajšak
That's my little bro, he’s really smart. He's 14 and a primary school student. He helps with documentation and hardware and software development.
Zoran Gajšak
That's my dad (and Emil's dad, too). He’s a mechanical engineer, a high-school teacher, and a photographer in his free time. He helps with hardware design, promotional material and documentation.
Other important collaborators:
Tomislav Car - advisor
Ana Car - advisor
Niko Klansek - business advisor
Hrvoje Hafner - crowdfunding advisor
It all started with this prototype back in 2014:
Since then, a lot has changed. We've displayed MAKERbuino at various technology conferences and shows and worked hard on improving its design.
first prototype vs. the latest prototype
  MAKERbuino at Maker Faire Rome 2016
  Ross Atkin (thecraftyrobot.net) checking out a MAKERbuino
  Mate Rimac - CEO of Rimac Automobili - checking out a MAKERbuino
  First MAKERbuino workshop, January 2017
  It takes far more than the whole MAKERbuino team to make MAKERbuino happen.
Here are some of many supporters that have been an enormous help: Ivančica Gajšak, Jonne Valola and his Pokitto project, Aurelien Rodot and his Gamebuino project, David Roper, e-radionica, Matija Abičić, Technical culture community of Karlovac, STEMI, Infinum, Dobriša Adamec, Martin Adamec, HUB385, Robokacija, Fablab.hr, Projektni biro 2a, Izvan Fokusa, Pavle Kocanjer, Vladimir Mitrović, HZTK, Matija Fućek, Anton Premec, Nikola Petrović, Antonio Valentić, Bruno Mastelić Ivić, Dragan Petric, BUG, Gradionica, Gueidan Audric, Denis Plavetić, Digitalni Tisak.

We hope that you're as excited about MAKERbuino as we are and that you'll back our campaign and make our ideas come true.
Thank you!

support.title: Educational pack - inventor's edition
support.descp:
10 standard MAKERbuino kits equipped with a set of hardware add-ons for exploring, inventing and playing. Also comes with some extra goodies like multiplayer cables, extra button caps, extra casings, spare parts, etc. Educational material with a workshop plan and some printable worksheets is included. You’ll also get a cheat sheet with some experiences, advice and tricks we’ve learned from organizing various MAKERbuino test workshops. This perk is great for the ones that want to organize a workshop for more advance users.
INCLUDES:
10× standard MAKERbuino kit
10× set of hardware expansion modules with wires and a breadboard
6× super-duper multiplayer link cable
extra button caps and casings in various colors
spare parts and other hardware goodies
educational material, a workshop plan and printable worksheets
workshop organizer cheat sheet

support.title: MAKERbuino superbacker pack
support.descp:
10 MAKERbuino kits with required tools, some hardware add-ons and other various goodies like multiplayer cables, button caps, casings. Educational material with a workshop plan and some printable worksheets is included. Comes with a cheat sheet with some experiences, advice and tricks we’ve learned from organizing various MAKERbuino test workshops. You’ll also be among the first to get a beta tester kit of our next mystery project.
INCLUDES:
10× standard MAKERbuino kit
10× tools and equipment needed for assembling the MAKERbuino kit
10× set of hardware expansion modules with wires and a breadboard
6× super-duper multiplayer link cable
extra button caps and casings in various colors
spare parts and other hardware goodies
educational material, a workshop plan and printable worksheets
workshop organizer cheat sheet
beta tester preview kit of our next mystery project

support.title: MAKERbuino kit - early bird
support.descp:
Get your MAKERbuino kit for a special price before anybody else. Includes a kit with all game console components included. You’ll need some basic tools to assemble it. Thorough online build guide and learning resources are included.
This reward is open for a limited number of fastest backers
INCLUDES:
standard MAKERbuino kit

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,

It's been a while since our last update here, but we're alive and still going strong!

After MAKERbuino, we've released Ringo - a DIY mobile phone, Nibble - a revamped version of MAKERbuino, and , a DIY voice assistant that was first released as a part of our subscription service that we launched through a as well.

updates.update_userinfo: STEM Box's Kickstarter is coming to an amazing end, all thanks to you folks!
updates.update_content:
With our Kickstarter campaign approaching its end after a wild 50 days, I wanted to say a special little thank you to some of you folks.
STEM Box is a huge success on Kickstarter and I couldn’t be happier:

updates.update_userinfo: Sharing is caring: Get 20% cashback by helping us share the news about our new campaig
updates.update_content:
Hi folks, we really appreciate all of you sharing our new campaign and helping us take this project to the next level <3

We wanted to give back a little extra love (and cash) for all your support:
We’ve created a referral program on a page called Kickbooster where you can earn 20% cashback from every pledge you bring in to our campaign (from your shares with your family, friends, and digital network).

Hey folks, after launching MAKERbuino and MAKERphone, we have been working even harder on a whole new line of DIY electronic projects and we are very excited to share the news with you:
STEM Box is finally here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/circuitmess-stem-box

updates.update_userinfo: THANK YOU - MAKERphone Kickstarter campaign is live now

MAKERphone's Kickstarter campaign just went live: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/makerphone-an-educational-diy-mobile-phone

And I just wanted to send you all a big THANK YOU!

@valentina no problem! Also if you ever need to undo a solder joint ( too much or too little solder ) then take like 3 small diamater wires and strip the insulation , then bundle the strands of wire with tape on each end of the bundles ( eaiser to work with.) Into 3 bundles . Then brade the bundles into a bigger "wick" looking brade . Now you have repurposed scrap wires out of an old device into a solder sucking wick! Just put a little rosin flux on the solder joint you have to fix . Then lighty place your solder wick be over the joint . Place you solder iron on top of the wick for a couple seconds and watch the solder soak into your wick ! Once all the excess solder has been soaked up ,( max of 5 seconds with the iron on the board) remove the iron and wick at the same time and you should have a clean area to fix .

I had absolutely no problems soldering the MAKERbuino - and I only had some very basic soldering experience from school. So I'm sure you will be doing fine as well!

Try de soldering components without burning the main board . Remember it's not the solider you are heating up . It's the little metal circle where you put the component at that you are trying to heat up . Also rosin flux is going to be your best friend . I would use a paste so it's eaiser to work with . Put a little of that where you are going to be soldering and it will make the solider transfer to the joint ( metal circle with a hole in the middle ) much easier.

@Albert, Radio Shack would have been a possibility, but they are going out of business in most areas. For US resellers, there might be specialty electronics stores, but there aren't very many across the country the way Radio Shack was. Microcenter would be a good possibility. They are a big online store and have several physical stores around the country. They have an entire section of their store dedicated to 3d Printing, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, etc. This would be a good fit for that section. There are also some smaller "Hobby shops" that deal in various STEM products, RC cars/drones, etc. Hobby Town is probably the biggest "chain". Outside of that, most are independently owned shops. Lastly, there's always Amazon. You can ship your product to them, and they handle all the fulfillment and shipping. I don't know what the fees would be, though, as compared to a normal distributor model. PS, you could always try online shops like Adafruit or others that already sell/distribute Pi/Arduino stuff.
Any ETA for when the normal kits will start shipping? (the ones after early bird)

For those in USA, many Radio Shack stores are going out of business, so if you wait long enough, you can find some good deals...but know what things should cost because they mark things up before putting them "on sale".

campaign.story:
Skippy is high performance product that skips on water's surface.
        We are two sport enthusiasts who like to have fun with their friends. We saw that there isn’t any toy or gadget on this big saturated market that would capture the attention of young generation and satisfy the need of high performance toy that really tests your limits. Because of that we came up with an idea to make our own, which is better, faster and offers you more fun than any other product curently on the market. 
     Skippy is currently available in four different colours.
         Keep Skippin'
   Check us on social media...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this is our first project on Kickstarter, we promise you, we will work around the clock, so you will get your Skippy on time and it will be everything you've thought it would be.

In case we encounter any problems on the road, please bare with us and lets make this journey one to remember.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello!
-
As you may have read in our previous updates/comments, the very last batch of Skippies was sent out on August 21st. Skippies are shipped all around the world using standard type of delivery from our country, which can take up to 1 month to deliver if it's outside of EU. So in worst possible scenario you will get your Skippy till end of September.  
We are really sorry for this delay that no one could predicted. Also we would like to ask everyone to keep us updated about your situation, if you have already received Skippies or not, in our messages. We promise we will work with you towards solution, so no one will feel cheated!

updates.update_userinfo: First wave of Skippies sent off & Announcement of our new website
updates.update_content:
Finally! 
After all the inconveniences we encountered on our road, we are thrilled to let you know that yesterday we dropped the first shipment off at the post station. 
We will continue to drop a part of Skippies at the post station each day so by the end of the week everyone's Skippies will be shipped out!

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping out Skippies by the end of the week
updates.update_content:
Hello to all of our backers,
we are happy to inform you that despite all the things that happened to us that we couldn't possible predict, we are finally ready to start shipping Skippies to you.

Hello everyone,
first of all we would like to thank each and every single one of you for staying patient with us through this learning experience.
Despite all the setbacks and unexpected mainly negative things that we had to encounter we can proudly say that Skippy is finally in production!

We are officially 1 day away from completing our campaign and would like to thank each and every one of you for making it successful!   
As we have surpassed $12,000 you managed to unlock new stretch goal! The colour Pink will be able for selection amongst other 5 colours that are Black, Yellow, Red, Blue and Green.
We have spent last two weeks actively working on all elements of successful production after the campaign is finished. This week we have reached an agreement with our shipping company and we are happy to inform you that tomorrow the tool for Skippies will go into making. Once we have the tool all we need is material and we can start with production of right away.

updates.update_userinfo: Unlocked first stretch goal & news about process of establishing production
updates.update_content:
Good job! With your help we managed to unlock our first stretch goal. The colour GREEN will now be available alongside other four original colours. 
Although we managed to successfully collect and even surpass our goal we still have 8 days. Let's make the most of it and try to unlock another stretch goal for all of our better halves - Pink Skippy! :)
Unfortunately alongside all the good news this is the first time we have to share something we're not really happy about. Few days before reaching our goal, our main deliverer of material told us that he has a solution for Skippies that could glow in dark. We were ecstatic to offer you that option you were asking for and we couldn't wait to tell you. But when we went to see him in person, the truth wasn't what he told us on the phone, so we have to put glow in the dark Skippies on hold for a moment. We will continue to look for solutions, so stay tuned for all of our updates about that matter and others!

updates.update_userinfo: We are FUNDED! New stretch goal?!
updates.update_content:
WOW! Yesterday we were officially funded and we still have 14 days left! Let's make the most of it! 
Thanks to every single one of you for your support and we promise you we will work hard to get Skippy to everyone till end of July.

Hooray! We are over 3/4 of our journey to our goal and we couldn't be more excited to bring all of our 290 backers with us. Let's keep sharing, telling our friends about Skippy, so we will blow past our goal in no time and everyone will have their own Skippy by the time the summer season really starts!

Hello everyone!
We want to thank you for all your continuous support so far and let you know that we will be doing a livestream on Kickstarter. The livestream will be live on Wednesday, exact time TBD. We will post countdown, so everyone who wants to be part of the action will get notified on time.
We would like to ask all of you to join us and leave us a question in a comment section if you want to know anything. We will also play with Skippy live, so you will have an opportunity to see it in person.

campaign.story:
Unique Travel Set is ready made, smart clothing solution for busy women. 
1 bag +7 pieces of clothing = your new way of traveling lightweight with 30 different clothing combinations for any occasion and the whole package weights only 2 kilos or just below 4 pounds!
Perfectly designed and harmonized pieces of clothing packed in a fashionable and multifunctional bag gives you a feeling of freedom and careless living. 
7 pieces of women’s clothing packed into 1 magic bag = 30 different styles for a 3 to 5 day trip. Weighs only 1.7 kilo or just below 4 pounds.
The Unique Travel Set comes in FIVE SIZES (XS, S, M, L, XL) and PETITE, REGULAR AND TALL/LONG lengths. (Please scroll down for sizing table).
The Unique Travel Set is made from super comfy, durable and wrinkle-free fabrics (viscose) and its perfect shape and pattern prevents embarrassing sweat stains on your clothing. 
AND GUESS WHAT?! IT'S MACHINE WASHABLE TOO.
DESIGNED AND PRODUCED IN THE EUROPEAN UNION WITH HIGH ETHICAL AND SUSTAINABILITY STANDARDS!
Available in Diamond Black, COAL GRAY (on this photo) and Golden Beige.
  Available in Diamond Black, Coal Gray and GOLDEN BEIGE (on this photo).
  Available in DIAMOND BLACK (on this photo), Coal Gray and Golden Beige.
  Breathable mesh on the back of the dress.
  Unique Travel Set Luxury Edition consists of Basic set with additional mesh dress and long scarf for the elegant and luxurious look! (Photo: Coal Gray and Diamond Black)
  Unique Travel Set Luxury Edition consists of Basic set with additional mesh dress and long scarf for the elegant and luxurious look! (Photo: Golden Beige)
   6IN1 multifunctional bag can be a back-pack, cross-body, tote or a clutch. Available in the same colors as the Set.
CHECK OUT what you can do with the Unique Travel Set BAG. So many combinations!
PLAY

  Unique Travel Set packed in the multifunctional BAG weighs only 1.7 kilos or just under 4 pounds.
  PLAY

Re-style in just few seconds
If you would like to have your Unique Travel Set and one additional dress in another color, please choose UNIQUE TRAVEL SET + DRESS PLEDGE and you will receive your dress for $98 (Future retail price $125) and the Unique Travel Set for lowest possible $242. You will receive your full pledge together but you will pay only for the shipping of the Unique Travel Set.
For available colors, please check the pledge.
UNIQUE TRAVEL SET + ADDITIONAL DRESS Pledge you pay only Unique travel Set shipping. Dress travels for free!
   PLEDGE For: UNIQUE TRAVEL SET + ADDITIONAL DRESS
             
CHOOSE BETWEEN PETITE, REGULAR AND LONG SIZES (height and length).
   
EXCHANGE POLICY:
If you follow the sizing chart carefully, then the Unique Travel Set will fit you. If you anyway wish to exchange your Unique Travel Set, we will allow you to do that, but you’ll have to pay for the two way shipping. As we are just starting up and offering the Unique Travel Set at really discounted prices on Kickstarter, we won’t be able to accept returns.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team is composed of different team members such as fashion designers, patterning experts, design experts, business managers and operations managers to assure that you will get the best product on time. 

We are here to present you the product that is the result of work of professionals with more than 25 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience, so rest assured that the Unique Travel Set will exceed your expectations

Quality has been the most important part of the product creation from the day 1 and together with good business organization and process management, we are ready to deliver best product in arranged time.

We are professionals and perfectionists, working on this product for last two years and our product is ready to market so risks are minimal!

Each part of the Unique Travel Set has been tested by over 100 women from all over the world and all of them were partners in the making of this product during the last two years. Thanks to their feedback and comments, we can proudly say – we have a perfect travel apparel for women!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dearest backers!
we are so happy to inform you that our production is almost finished. We will start shipping first Unique Travel Sets next week with DHL. We are still waiting those additional dresses some of you have ordered and they will also come out of the production next week.
Also, we are so happy to share with you that MIC magazine has published a review of the Unique Travel Set. You can read it here: http://bit.ly/2rRqhHz

Dear backers!
We have send you a very short survey 10 days ago to find out about your size and color preference. We have received many of your answers but still some of you did not answer it.
We are super excited to start producing and shiping your Unique Travel Sets and it really depends on the survey results.�

Dear Backers!
Thank you SOOOO MUCH for supporting us and being our friends and backers!
Our campaign has just ended and we are starting our next steps immediately.

Dear Backers!
We are so happy to share with you today published article about Unique Travel Set in worlds most popular tourist guide and wonderful web page Lonely Planet!
Find the story here: http://bit.ly/2q13gQZ

Dear Backers!  
We are getting to our goal soon and we wanted to let you know that you can UPGRADE your $242 pledge of Super Early Bird Unique Travel Set to an extended version with an additional dress that comes in a different color than the one you have already chosen.

campaign.story:
Designing and coding an email template can be a very stressful and complex task. As a matter of fact You need to be both a good designer and coder to complete this task. With Zenduz You can do this job without the need of special technical and/or coding skills.
Zenduz = Photoshop for Email
With ZENDUZ it is possible to create both personal or for your company styled emails that are looking great. ZENDUZ allows individuals, small and medium sized companies to add their style or identity to their every day email communication.
Compatibility:
Email Templates designed with Zenduz can be used in any off the modern on and offline email clients like Outlook, Gmail, Apple Mail, Yahoo Mail, Thunderbird and many more...
PLAY

What makes Zenduz special?
One can learn the basic use of Zenduz in a very little time. (half an hour). Or goals is to bring back email on a higher level. A good look and feel of the paper business letter or an offer, invitation or just a nice looking greetings or a postcard. By using Zenduz people and organisations can create high quality templates.
Why use Zenduz - Movie
PLAY

Design samples build with Zenduz
 Example Business Card
 Example Invoice 
Example Offer
                                           Example Letter
                                           See more examples at our web page Gallery
How to use the current version of editor - Movie
PLAY

 About Us - Movie
Who are we? And why? We will show in this video...
PLAY

Funding goal : Do the final touch
Our main and first goal is 'parenting' the software. As you know the software is up and running, and fully usable to complete your email design task. We want you to work with our current software version and give us feedback to give our baby the right 'parenting'
To do this we need a little bit of money € 10.000,-
Stretch goals
As we have more funding and you guys are using the software we also see the following goals ahead...
1. Add responsive templates functionality
Of course we made preparations in the editor to build great responsive email templates. 
This goal will take up € 25.000,-
2. Improve object orientation: improve usability
Since we are working already a few years on this software, we have some object orientated ideas who will lead to usability improvements.
This goal will take up € 100.000,-
3. Ipad (app) version
Of course we see also an app development for our software.
This goal will take up € 250.000,-

campaign.story:
We love nature and combining it with technology is what we are all about. This is why we have created WOCH, which combines the newest technology with the simplicity of nature.
       
 
      WOCH is beautifully hand crafted with carefully selected wood, which makes every WOCH unique and special, just as a product like this should be.  

  We know quality is very important. This is why all WOCH's components are manufactured in EU because we can work closer with the manufacturers and make sure that every WOCH is an A-quality product. 
  And why is WOCH made from wood? Well simply because technology should be more friendly to use and because we think it should be made of us and environment friendly materials. And of course because it looks cool!

WOCH works with all QI compatible devices. Most new phones already have built in QI receiver, but if you have an IPhone or other phone without QI receiver, don't worry. You can simply just put QI receiver behind your case. It's so thin, that you won't even notice it. Or better yet, use QI phone case.
You can order QI receiver or QI case with WOCH so you don't need to worry about anything.
    Output: up to 5 W power transfer to the receiver (max: 5V, 1A)
Current limit and over-temperature protection
1 m (39 inch) long cable with USB connector
Check the variety of rewards we offer below. If you have any questions or a special request please let us know. We love talking to you!
  We can`t wait to start making WOCH, so you can try it out too. We already have everything planned, so you don't need to worry about anything. 
  This campaign wouldn't be possible without the great people who worked really hard, to make it happen. It has been a great pleasure working and creating with: Lenart Megušar-photography and video; Meta Mohorič-actress; Rok Gerbec-actor; Tina Pretnar-video voice; and Andrej Mohorič-video production, photos editing and co-founder.
THANK YOU !
Anze Kozjek, Founder
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are new to Kickstarter, but bringing new ideas to life is what we love doing and we are going to make sure everybody gets WOCH just as we promised. 

The biggest challenge is going to be the production. But don't worry. We already have agreements with components manufacturers. All WOCH's components are manufactured in Europe because we can work closer with the manufacturers, make sure everything is going to be made on time and because we want WOCH to be an A-quality product.

Speaking of shipping... We got that covered too, so you don't have to worry about anything.

We are so excited for you to start using WOCH and we are sure, once you try it, you will never use a cable again.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
